title: b'Peoples and Cultures 2022'
description: b'Peoples and Cultures of the World - Second Editiion'
Categories: b'anthropology' b'geography' b'cultures' b'peoples'
Call For Papers: b'\nCall for papers\rPeoples and Cultures of the World \r2nd Edition\r International Conference\rJune 30th and July 1st 2022\r Building 15 (Edificio 15), Viale delle Scienze, Palermo \rAula Multimediale, 7th Floor\rIn-Person and online (Microsoft Teams platform)\r University of Palermo, Italy\rDepartment of Cultures and Societies\rDepartment of Psychology, Educational Science and Human Movement\r Deadline for abstracts: May 30th 2022\r The first edition of the International Conference \xe2\x80\x9cPeoples and Cultures of the World\xe2\x80\x9d, organized in 2019, was an important opportunity to focus on conceptual definitions and critical aspects concerning identity formations. In this second edition, we want to deepen our previous reflection and consider new topics. For example, is it still possible today to speak of cultures that are somehow homogeneous and spatially circumscribed? Or, instead, is it more appropriate to overturn these assumptions and overall deconstruct the concepts of culture and space? How is it possible to study various cultural dynamics in a world where Identity and Otherness are not only organized in terms of generalized proximity or distance, but also according to overlapping global and local forms? To this respect, what is the position of social scientists regarding individual, subjective and processual experiences? To what extent do \xe2\x80\x9csubjective\xe2\x80\x9d or \xe2\x80\x9cobjective\xe2\x80\x9d approaches contribute to the result of the research and to the formalization of the process? A further, delicate question should also be included in our consideration: the recent pandemics have revealed new asymmetries between minorities and larger groups, the vulnerable and the powerful of the world. How can we deal with these new asymmetries and, more specifically, how can we position ourselves as scholars? Finally, larger access to the digital world is increasingly changing the relationships established between fiction and reality, the everyday and the extraordinary, spaces and otherness. How are these subjects articulated alongside notions of culture and identity? The aforementioned questions are some possible subjects to deal with at the conference. We are particularly interested in proposals taking a critical look at the policies exerted from the outside, or in a top-down manner, and also considering forms of resistance escaping hegemonic perspectives. We encourage proposals taking into account single cultures (ethnic groups, communities, indigenous minorities, etc.) by discussing their specificities and differences, possibly with a focus on theories and applied perspectives. Some possible subjects:\r \xe2\x80\xa2\tCultural dynamics and singular / plural belonging\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tContacts / conflicts between cultures\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tHybridization of identity and new forms of cultural belonging\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tCultural theories and geo-anthropological spaces\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tSymbolic, real or virtual spaces\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tSpatial and / or symbolic centers and peripheries\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tFood, nutrition and recognition paths\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tCities, narratives and visual imaginaries\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tEthnographic documentaries and visual representation\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tEthnographic methods, field research and Social Sciences epistemology\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tRites and cultures\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tCultures and ecological and sustainability\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tForms of mobility, tourism and identity routes\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tDiasporas and migrations\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tColonialisms and imperialisms\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tSocial resilience / resistance\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tCultures, spaces and literary forms\r  Modalities of participation and deadline:\rSend abstracts by May 30th 2022 to Leonardo Mercatanti (leonardo.mercatanti@unipa.it), Stefano Montes (stefano.montes@unipa.it) or Gaetano Sabato (gaetano.sabato@unipa.it). Abstracts, max 300 words, include title, 3 key-words and a short biography (max 5 lines, not to be counted among the 300 words). The conference will take place in-person, in Palermo, and at the same time online through the Teams platform. Participants are free to choose their mode of participation. Admitted languages are English, Italian, French and Spanish. Each speech is 20 minutes. Registration to the Conference (both for participants on location and online) is free of cost. Grants are not foreseen. Travel, accommodation and food costs are to be covered by participants. \r Scientific board:\rLeonardo Mercatanti, Stefano Montes and Gaetano Sabato, University of Palermo, Italy.\r Organizing committee:\rFrancesco De Pascale, Giovanni Messina, Mariachiara Modica, Alessandro Morello.\r\n'

title: b'ICMPPT 2022'
description: b'2022 International Conference on Material Physics and Processing Technology \xef\xbc\x88ICMPPT 2022\xef\xbc\x89'
Categories: b'material physics' b'processing technology'
Call For Papers: b'\n2022 International Conference on Material Physics and Processing Technology\r\xef\xbc\x88ICMPPT 2022\xef\xbc\x89\rDate Venue: August 12-14, 2022 in Fuzhou, China\rSubmission Deadline: July 5\xef\xbc\x8c2022\rIndex : EI Compendex, Scopus \rWebsite: http://icmppt.net/\r \xe3\x80\x90Introduction\xe3\x80\x91\r2022 International Conference on Material Physics and Processing Technology\xef\xbc\x88ICMPPT 2022\xef\xbc\x89will be held in August 12-14, 2022 in Fuzhou, China. Focused on hot research topics and difficulties in Material Physics and Processing Technology, ICMPPT 2022 will explore cutting-edge Material Physics and Processing Technology, share typical study cases and encourage scientific innovation in this field. Renowned experts and academics in relevant fields will be invited to this conference to deliver keynote speeches, present reports and exchange ideas with attendees on research advancements and challenges.\r We are looking forward to meeting you in the very beautiful city Fuzhou, China, during August 12-14, 2022. Definitely, ICMPPT 2022 will provide you a pleasant experience, new contacts and happy stay in Fuzhou.\r \xe3\x80\x90Publication\xe3\x80\x91\rAll full paper submissions to the ICMPPT 2022 could be written in English and will be sent to at least 2-3 reviewers and evaluated based on originality, technical or research content or depth, correctness, relevance to conference, contributions, and readability.\rAll accepted papers of ICMPPT 2022 will be published in the Conference Proceedings, which will be submitted to EI Compendex, Scopus for indexing.\r \xe3\x80\x90Call for Papers\xe3\x80\x91\r(Include but not limited to the following topics)\rMaterials Physics and chemistry\rPhysical properties of materials\rThermodynamics of materials\rMaterial preparation technology\rFundamentals of Materials Engineering\rAtomic physics\rQuantum mechanics\rSolid state physics\rMechanical properties of materials\rPhotoelectric material\rMicroelectronic material\rSemiconductor\rA superconductor\rNano Materials and Nano Technology\rNano manufacturing\rMaterial Processing\rSynthesis and processing\rSurface treatment\r\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\xa6\r\xef\xbc\x88For more topics, see the conference official website\xef\xbc\x9ahttp://icmppt.net/\xef\xbc\x89\r \xe3\x80\x90Submission and Attending\xe3\x80\x91\r#Submission#\r1. Submission Method: Please submit your paper(word+pdf) to Online Submission System or English Submission System\xef\xbc\x9a\xef\xbc\x88https://www.ais.cn/attendees/paperSubmit/VVFZRI\xef\xbc\x89\r2.  Paper Template: The manuscript should be written in accordance with the standard of template\xef\xbc\x9a (https://www.ais.cn/attendees/material/VVFZRI )\r3. The paper should not be less than 4 pages in length and not exceed 12 pages.\r Note: All submitted articles should report original, previously unpublished research results, experimental or theoretical. Articles submitted to the conference should meet these criteria and must not be under consideration for publication elsewhere. Authors need to check the duplicates at their own expense through the query system, and the papers suspected of plagiarism will not be published and will be published on the conference homepage.We firmly believe that ethical conduct is the most essential virtual of any academic. Hence any act of plagiarism is a totally unacceptable academic misconduct and cannot be tolerated. \r #Attending#\r1. How to Attending: You can register for the conference through the online registration system\xef\xbc\x9a\xef\xbc\x88https://www.ais.cn/attendees/toSignUp/VVFZRI\xef\xbc\x89 \r2. Join as Listener: ICMPPT 2022 is an unmissable conference. It is a good chance and an effective plateform to meet many renowned experts and researchers in the filed of latest academic research. You are welcome to attend this great event. \r3. Join as Presenter: If you are interested in giving presentation on conference, without publishing your paper in the proceeding, you can choose to attend ICMPPT 2022 as a Presenter. As presenter, you need to submit the abstract and title of your presentation before register, the presentation will not be published.\r \xe3\x80\x90Registration\xe3\x80\x91\r1.Author (Regular) (4-6 Pages)\xef\xbc\x9a3200RMB / Paper \r2.Manuscript numbers \xe2\x89\xa5 3\xef\xbc\x9a2900RMB / Paper \r3.Extra Pages (Begin at Page 7)\xef\xbc\x9a300 RMB/ Extra Page\r4.Attendees without a Submission\xef\xbc\x9a1200 RMB / Person\r5.Attendees without a Submission (Groups\xef\xbc\x89\xef\xbc\x9a1000 RMB/ Person\xef\xbc\x88\xe2\x89\xa5 3 Person\xef\xbc\x89\r6.Purchase Extra Proceedings/Journal copies: 500 RMB /book\r(Note: Team submissions can enjoy more discounts. Please consult the conference secretary for more details.)\r \xe3\x80\x90Contact Us\xe3\x80\x91\rConference Secretary: Miss.Huang\rQQ: 3465006475\rPhone number/WeChat: 19872446270\rWebsite: http://icmppt.net/\rE-mail: icmppt@163.com\r \n'

title: b'DSDE--Ei 2023'
description: b'2023 the 6th International Conference on Data Storage and Data Engineering (DSDE 2023)'
Categories: b'data mining' b'big data' b'information security' b'information management'
Call For Papers: b'\nFull name: 2023 the 6th International Conference on Data Storage and Data Engineering (DSDE 2023)\rAbbreviation: DSDE 2023\r The 6th International Conference on Data Storage and Data Engineering (DSDE 2023)\rFebruary 24-26, 2023 | Mianyang, Sichuan, China\r We would like to invite you to contribute to and participate in the 6th International Conference on Data Storage and Data Engineering (DSDE 2023), which will be held in Mianyang, Sichuan, China during February 24-26, 2023.\r DSDE 2023 is hosted by Southwest University of Science and Technology, China, and assisted by Donghua University, China. Southwest University of Science and Technology is located in Mianyang--the only Science and Technology City in China, which is surrounded by green mountains and with beautiful Fujiang River running through.\r \xe2\x98\x85Publication\rAll papers will be strictly double blind reviewed by the program committee, and accepted papers of DSDE 2023 after proper registration and presentation will be published in the conference proceedings, which will be submitted for indexing by Ei Compendex, Scopus, etc.\r \xe2\x96\xb6 DSDE 2022 conference proceedings (ACM-ISBN: 978-1-4503-9572-4) will be included in ACM Digital Library and indexed by Ei Compendex and Scopus soon.\r\xe2\x96\xb6 DSDE 2021 conference proceedings (ACM-ISBN: 978-1-4503-8930-3) has been indexed by Ei Compendex and Scopus.\r\xe2\x96\xb6 DSDE 2019 conference proceedings (ACM-ISBN: 978-1-4503-7216-9) has been indexed by Ei Compendex and Scopus.\r \xe2\x98\x85Topics\rTopics of interest for submission include, but are not limited to:\r\xe2\x96\xb7BIG DATA: \xe2\x96\xaa Big Data Applications \xe2\x96\xaa New Computational Models for Big Data \xe2\x96\xaa New Data Standards \xe2\x96\xaa Social Data Analytics \xe2\x96\xaa Social Web Search and Mining \xe2\x96\xaa Big Data as a Service \xe2\x96\xaa Big Data Infrastructure\r\xe2\x96\xb7DATA MANAGEMENT AND QUALITY: \xe2\x96\xaa Architectural Concepts \xe2\x96\xaa Mobile Data Management \xe2\x96\xaa Modeling and Managing Large Data Systems \xe2\x96\xaa Open Data \xe2\x96\xaa Organizational Concepts and Best Practices \xe2\x96\xaa Smart Cities and Urban Data Analytics\r\xe2\x96\xb7DATA SCIENCE: \xe2\x96\xaa Data Fusion \xe2\x96\xaa Pattern Recognition \xe2\x96\xaa Predictive Modeling \xe2\x96\xaa Support Vector Machines \xe2\x96\xaa Data Science \xe2\x96\xaa Data Mining \xe2\x96\xaa Deep Learning\rFor more topics, please visit: http://dsde.org/CFP.html\r \xe2\x98\x85Submission Guideline\r \xe2\x99\xa2 English is the official language. Paper should be prepared and presented in English. \r\xe2\x99\xa2 Full paper (no less than 8 Pages) submission is required for Publication and Presentation. For presentation only, just send us the abstract.\r\xe2\x99\xa2 Submission: \r- By online submission system: http://confsys.iconf.org/submission/dsde2023\r- Or Submit to dsde@iacsit.net as attachment\r \xe2\x98\x85General Program \rFirst Day - February 24, 2023\r10:00-17:00 | Registration & Materials Collection\r14:00-16:00 | Campus Tour\r14:00-17:00 | Committee Conference\r Second Day - February 25, 2023\r09:00-09:10 | Opening Ceremony\r09:10-09:50 | Keynote Speech\r09:50-10:30 | Group Photo & Coffee Break & Poster Session \r10:30-11:50 | Keynote Speeches\r12:00-13:30 | Lunch\r13:30-15:30 | Invited Speeches & Parallel Sessions\r15:30-16:00 | Coffee Break\r16:00-18:00 | Invited Speeches & Parallel Sessions\r18:00-20:00 | Dinner Banquet\r Third Day - February 26, 2023\r09:00-12:00 | Invited Speeches & Parallel Sessions\r13:30-14:30 | Awards & Closing Ceremony\r14:30-19:00 | City Tour\r \xe2\x98\x85Contact us\rConference secretary: Miss Joie Wu\rEmail: dsde@iacsit.net\rTel.: +86-18302820449\rWeChat: iacsit2009 \rWebsite: http://www.dsde.org/\rOffice Hour: Monday-Friday, 9:30-18:00 (GMT+8)\r\n'

Southwest University of Science and Technology is located in Mianyang--the only Science and Technology City in China, which is surrounded by green mountains and with beautiful Fujiang River running through.\r \xe2\x98\x85Publication\rAll papers will be strictly double blind reviewed by the program committee, and accepted papers of DSDE 2023 after proper registration and presentation will be published in the conference proceedings, which will be submitted for indexing by Ei Compendex, Scopus, etc.\r \xe2\x96\xb6 DSDE 2022 conference proceedings (ACM-ISBN: 978-1-4503-9572-4) will be included in ACM Digital Library and indexed by Ei Compendex and Scopus soon.\r\xe2\x96\xb6 DSDE 2021 conference proceedings (ACM-ISBN: 978-1-4503-8930-3) has been indexed by Ei Compendex and Scopus.\r\xe2\x96\xb6 DSDE 2019 conference proceedings (ACM-ISBN: 978-1-4503-7216-9) has been indexed by Ei Compendex and Scopus.\r \xe2\x98\x85Topics\rTopics of interest for submission include, but are not limited to:\r\xe2\x96\xb7BIG DATA: \xe2\x96\xaa Big Data Applications \xe2\x96\xaa New Computational Models for Big Data \xe2\x96\xaa New Data Standards \xe2\x96\xaa Social Data Analytics \xe2\x96\xaa Social Web Search and Mining \xe2\x96\xaa Big Data as a Service \xe2\x96\xaa Big Data Infrastructure\r\xe2\x96\xb7DATA MANAGEMENT AND QUALITY: \xe2\x96\xaa Architectural Concepts \xe2\x96\xaa Mobile Data Management \xe2\x96\xaa Modeling and Managing Large Data Systems \xe2\x96\xaa Open Data \xe2\x96\xaa Organizational Concepts and Best Practices \xe2\x96\xaa Smart Cities and Urban Data Analytics\r\xe2\x96\xb7DATA SCIENCE: \xe2\x96\xaa Data Fusion \xe2\x96\xaa Pattern Recognition \xe2\x96\xaa Predictive Modeling \xe2\x96\xaa Support Vector Machines \xe2\x96\xaa Data Science \xe2\x96\xaa Data Mining \xe2\x96\xaa Deep Learning\rFor more topics, please visit: http://dsde.org/CFP.html\r \xe2\x98\x85Submission Guideline\r \xe2\x99\xa2 English is the official language. Paper should be prepared and presented in English. \r\xe2\x99\xa2 Full paper (no less than 8 Pages) submission is required for Publication and Presentation. For presentation only, just send us the abstract.\r\xe2\x99\xa2 Submission: \r- By online submission system: http://confsys.iconf.org/submission/dsde2023\r- Or Submit to dsde@iacsit.net as attachment\r \xe2\x98\x85General Program \rFirst Day - February 24, 2023\r10:00-17:00 | Registration & Materials Collection\r14:00-16:00 | Campus Tour\r14:00-17:00 | Committee Conference\r Second Day - February 25, 2023\r09:00-09:10 | Opening Ceremony\r09:10-09:50 | Keynote Speech\r09:50-10:30 | Group Photo & Coffee Break & Poster Session \r10:30-11:50 | Keynote Speeches\r12:00-13:30 | Lunch\r13:30-15:30 | Invited Speeches & Parallel Sessions\r15:30-16:00 | Coffee Break\r16:00-18:00 | Invited Speeches & Parallel Sessions\r18:00-20:00 | Dinner Banquet\r Third Day - February 26, 2023\r09:00-12:00 | Invited Speeches & Parallel Sessions\r13:30-14:30 | Awards & Closing Ceremony\r14:30-19:00 | City Tour\r \xe2\x98\x85Contact us\rConference secretary: Miss Joie Wu\rEmail: dsde@iacsit.net\rTel.: +86-18302820449\rWeChat: iacsit2009 \rWebsite: http://www.dsde.org/\rOffice Hour: Monday-Friday, 9:30-18:00 (GMT+8)\r\n'

title: b'Cancers (ISSN 2072-6694). 2022'
description: b'MDPI - CANCERS - Special Issue: Innate Immunity in Cancer Therapy'
Categories: b'MDPI' b'tumor' b'cancer' b'immunity'
Call For Papers: b"\nDear Colleagues,\r In the last years the immuno-oncology has represented a break point in cancer treatment and many new therapies have been recently developed and utilized in the clinical practice. The majority of these novel therapeutic approaches have been designed to potentiate the anti-tumor immune responses of T lymphocytes by acting on inhibitory or activating pathways. Although these therapies showed remarkable results, the efficacy of these treatments appears to be limited only to tumors characterized by high pre-existing T cell infiltration, the so-called \xe2\x80\x9chot\xe2\x80\x9d tumors, whereas the T-cell excluded \xe2\x80\x9ccold\xe2\x80\x9d cancers are poorly responsive.\r However, it should be highlighted that a  large proportion of tumor-associated immune cells belongs to the innate arm of the immune system, including macrophages, dendritic (DCs), myeloid cells, natural killer (NK) cells, \xce\xb3\xce\xb4 T cells and innate lymphoid cells (ILCs). All these immune populations have been demonstrated to participate to the \xe2\x80\x9cinnate sensing\xe2\x80\x9d of tumors, representing a promising target for the treatment of \xe2\x80\x9ccold\xe2\x80\x9d tumors. In particular, macrophages have emerged as an attractive therapeutic target for cancer immunotherapies as they are frequently found infiltrating the tumor bed and are involved in restraining the cytotoxic activity of T lymphocytes and, in general, the anti-tumor immune responses.\r The present Special Issue aims to collect original research articles and reviews about the role of innate cells in the tumor microenvironment and how these cells can be manipulated to boost their anti-tumor activity. Research areas may include but are not limited to: detection of tumor cells by the innate immune system, cross-talk between adaptive and innate immune cells, mechanisms of immunesupression exerted by innate immune system, novel therapeutic strategies to promote tumor cell killing by innate immune cells.  \r We are pleased to invite you to contribute in this field that is emerging extremely important in fighting cancer,  highlighting strategies that could open up new therapeutic possibilities.\r We look forward to receiving your contributions.\r Dr. Lucia Sfondrini\rDr. Valentino Mario Le Noci \rDr. Michele Sommariva\rGuest Editors\r Manuscript Submission Information\r Manuscripts should be submitted online at www.mdpi.com by registering and logging in to this website. Once you are registered, click here to go to the submission form. Manuscripts can be submitted until the deadline. All submissions that pass pre-check are peer-reviewed. Accepted papers will be published continuously in the journal (as soon as accepted) and will be listed together on the special issue website. Research articles, review articles as well as short communications are invited. For planned papers, a title and short abstract (about 100 words) can be sent to the Editorial Office for announcement on this website.\r Submitted manuscripts should not have been published previously, nor be under consideration for publication elsewhere (except conference proceedings papers). All manuscripts are thoroughly refereed through a single-blind peer-review process. A guide for authors and other relevant information for submission of manuscripts is available on the Instructions for Authors page. Cancers is an international peer-reviewed open access semimonthly journal published by MDPI.\r Please visit the Instructions for Authors page before submitting a manuscript. The Article Processing Charge (APC) for publication in this open access journal is 2400 CHF (Swiss Francs). Submitted papers should be well formatted and use good English. Authors may use MDPI's English editing service prior to publication or during author revisions.\r Keywords\rinnate immunotherapy\rimmune evasion\rtoll-like receptors\rantigen presenting cells\rinnate recognition\rhost defense\rinnate lymphoid cells\rinflammation\rcytokines\rmacrophages\rPublished Papers\rThis special issue is now open for submission.\n\t"

Call For Papers: b"\n\xe2\x98\x85 ICCCR 2023-EI Compendex, Scopus-Shanghai, China \xe2\x98\x85\r IEEE--2023 3rd International Conference on Computer, Control and Robotics (ICCCR 2023)--Ei Compendex, Scopus\r *  Date: March 24-26, 2023\r*  Place: Shanghai, China\r*  Website: http://www.icccr.org/ \r 2023 3rd International Conference on Computer, Control and Robotics (ICCCR 2023-www.icccr.org) will be held during the period March 24-26, 2023 in Shanghai, China. It's sponsored by Shanghai University, and hosted by School of Mechatronic Engineering and Automation, Shanghai University. ICCCR focuses on the synergetic interaction of computing technologies, control technologies and robotic technologies, and provide an excellent platform to all researchers share latest ideas. The mutual benefit make it possible to build and evolve new robotic systems, to reduce the development cost, and to enhance the quality.\r \xe2\x98\x85\xe2\x98\x85Call for Papers\rPlease check the topics of ICCCR 2023. The topics are not limited to those as below:\r\xe2\x98\x85Control Systems and Optimization \r* Genetic Algorithms\r* Fuzzy Control\r* Decision Support Systems\r* Machine Learning in Control Applications\r\xe2\x98\x85Robotics \r* RAMS abilities of robotic systems\r* Hardware modeling and abstraction\r* Resource awareness\r* Sensor fusion, integration\r\xe2\x98\x85Computer Science \r* Formal methods for analysis and design\r* Software architectures\r* Middleware infrastructures\r* Model-driven engineering\rMore details, please view:http://www.icccr.org/cfp.html\r  \xe2\x98\x85\xe2\x98\x85Proceedings\rSubmitted Papers to the conference will be subjected to the rigorous peer-review process. For accepted papers, it will be published in the ICCCR 2023 Conference Proceedings, which will be published and submitted to IEEE Xplore. Those papers will be indexed by Ei Compendex, Scopus and other main academical databases.\r \xe2\x98\x85\xe2\x98\x85Submission\r1. Full paper (publication and presentation)\r2. Abstract (only presentation)\r\xe2\x98\x85Submission Online Electrical System: http://www.easychair.org/conferences/?conf=icccr2023\rMore detail about submission, please visit at http://www.icccr.org/sub.html\r \xe2\x98\x85\xe2\x98\x85Conference schedule\rMarch 24th,  2023 | 10:00 - 17:00 | Registration,collecting conference materials\rMarch 25th,  2023 | 09:00 - 19:00 | Opening Remark & Keynote Speeches & Presentation Sessions & Dinner Banquet\rMarch 26th,  2023 | 09:00 - 17:00 | Invited speeches & Presentation Sessions\r \xe2\x98\x85\xe2\x98\x85Conference venue\rLehu Hotel, Shanghai Unversity (Baoshan), China\rAddress: No. 716, Jinqiu Road, Shanghai, China\r \xe2\x98\x85\xe2\x98\x85Contact us\rChris Zhang (Conference Secretary)\rE-mail: icccr_conf@robotics.ac.cn\n\t"

Call For Papers: b'\nCCCIS 2022_Topic: Computer Communication and Information Systems | Ei Compendex and Scopus\r \xe2\x98\x85Full name:  2022 3rd International Conference on Computer Communication and Information Systems (CCCIS 2022)--Ei Compendex, Scopus\rAbbreviation\xef\xbc\x9aCCCIS 2022\r\xe2\x98\x85Website\xef\xbc\x9ahttp://www.cccis.org/\r\xe2\x98\x85Time\xef\xbc\x9aDecember 7-9, 2022\r\xe2\x98\x85Place\xef\xbc\x9aSingapore \r  We welcome your participation and contribution to the 2022 3rd International Conference on Computer Communication and Information Systems (CCCIS 2022) which is to be held in Singapore during December 7-9, 2022. The opportunity to explore Marseille will be an incredible experience and we hope it exceeded your expectations. \r This year, CCCIS 2022 will be organized to provide a platform for academicians, researchers, scientists, professionals and students to share their knowledge and expertise in the field of computer communication and information systems and Convergence and address various issues to Increase awareness of technological innovations and to identify challenges and opportunities for the development of future using multidisciplinary research techniques. CCCIS 2022 will include state-of-the-art oral presentation related to the key areas. Featured with keynote session, technical session, social networking event.\r  \xe2\x98\x85Call for paper\xe2\x98\x85\rTopic about: \r\xe2\x96\xa0 Track 1: Computer Science and Information System\rAlgorithms\rAutonomic and Trusted Computing\rBig data and machine learning for networks\rBiomedical Informatics and Computation\rBusiness Analytics and Big Data\r\xe2\x96\xa0 Track 2: Communication and Information Engineering\r5G and beyond networks\rCyber-security, Privacy and Ethics of IS\rDatacenter networking\rAge of Information\rCellular networks\rCubeSats\r For details about topics, please visit at http://www.cccis.org/cfp.html\r \xe2\x98\x85 Publication\rAccepted papers will be published into the International Conference Proceedings Series, which will be archived in the Online Digital Library and submitted for index by Ei Compendex and Scopus.\r \xe2\x98\x85Submission\xe2\x98\x85\rA. Full Paper (for Presentation and Publication) \rRegular paper is required to have at least 8 full pages including tables, figures and references. A paper is usually no more than 20 pages.\rAccepted full paper will be invited to give the oral presentation at the conference and be publsihed into conference proceedings.\r B. Abstract (Presentation only)\rAccepted abstract will be invited to give the oral presentation at the conference, the presentation will not be published.\r For submission, please upload it to the Electronic Submission System (.pdf)\rhttps://www.zmeeting.org/submission/cccis2022\rSubmission template: http://www.cccis.org/acm_template.docx\rMore detail about submission, please visit: http://www.cccis.org/submission.html\r \xe2\x98\x85\xe2\x98\x85Conference Schedule\xe2\x98\x85\xe2\x98\x85\rDecember 7, 2022\r 10:30 - 17:00, On-site Registration & Online ZOOM test\r Participants are supposed to sign in at the conference venue and collect all the conference materials at the registration counter on this day.\rDecember 8, 2022\r 9:00-12:00, Opening Ceremony & Keynote Speeches\r 13:30-18:00, Parallel Sessions ( Oral Presentation )\rDecember 9, 2022\r Online Parallel Session\r \xe2\x98\x85\xe2\x98\x85Singapore\rSingapore, the Asian Tiger is vibrant and ever changing, at once a city, an island, and a nation with more than 5 million inhabitants: it has become an icon worldwide. Along with Bangkok and Hong Kong, Singapore is one of the most popular tourist destinations in South East Asia.\rExploring the Singapore river by boat, eating in a hawker, seeing the skyscrapers from the Merlion Park, visiting Little India, exploring Chinatown or having a drink in Clarke Quay... Singapore has any number of unforgettable experiences just waiting for you.\r \xe2\x98\x85\xe2\x98\x85Contact:\rMs. Slyvia Ding (Conference Secretary)\rE-mail: cccis_general@163.com \rTel: +86-182-1565-4293; +86-28-86527868\r\n'

Categories: b'computer engineering' b'signal processing' b'information systems' b'cloud computing'
Call For Papers: b'\nCCCIS 2022_Topic: Computer Communication and Information Systems | Ei Compendex and Scopus\r \xe2\x98\x85Full name:  2022 3rd International Conference on Computer Communication and Information Systems (CCCIS 2022)--Ei Compendex, Scopus\rAbbreviation\xef\xbc\x9aCCCIS 2022\r\xe2\x98\x85Website\xef\xbc\x9ahttp://www.cccis.org/\r\xe2\x98\x85Time\xef\xbc\x9aDecember 7-9, 2022\r\xe2\x98\x85Place\xef\xbc\x9aSingapore \r  We welcome your participation and contribution to the 2022 3rd International Conference on Computer Communication and Information Systems (CCCIS 2022) which is to be held in Singapore during December 7-9, 2022. The opportunity to explore Marseille will be an incredible experience and we hope it exceeded your expectations. \r This year, CCCIS 2022 will be organized to provide a platform for academicians, researchers, scientists, professionals and students to share their knowledge and expertise in the field of computer communication and information systems and Convergence and address various issues to Increase awareness of technological innovations and to identify challenges and opportunities for the development of future using multidisciplinary research techniques. CCCIS 2022 will include state-of-the-art oral presentation related to the key areas. Featured with keynote session, technical session, social networking event.\r  \xe2\x98\x85Call for paper\xe2\x98\x85\rTopic about: \r\xe2\x96\xa0 Track 1: Computer Science and Information System\rAlgorithms\rAutonomic and Trusted Computing\rBig data and machine learning for networks\rBiomedical Informatics and Computation\rBusiness Analytics and Big Data\r\xe2\x96\xa0 Track 2: Communication and Information Engineering\r5G and beyond networks\rCyber-security, Privacy and Ethics of IS\rDatacenter networking\rAge of Information\rCellular networks\rCubeSats\r For details about topics, please visit at http://www.cccis.org/cfp.html\r \xe2\x98\x85 Publication\rAccepted papers will be published into the International Conference Proceedings Series, which will be archived in the Online Digital Library and submitted for index by Ei Compendex and Scopus.\r \xe2\x98\x85Submission\xe2\x98\x85\rA. Full Paper (for Presentation and Publication) \rRegular paper is required to have at least 8 full pages including tables, figures and references. A paper is usually no more than 20 pages.\rAccepted full paper will be invited to give the oral presentation at the conference and be publsihed into conference proceedings.\r B. Abstract (Presentation only)\rAccepted abstract will be invited to give the oral presentation at the conference, the presentation will not be published.\r For submission, please upload it to the Electronic Submission System (.pdf)\rhttps://www.zmeeting.org/submission/cccis2022\rSubmission template: http://www.cccis.org/acm_template.docx\rMore detail about submission, please visit: http://www.cccis.org/submission.html\r \xe2\x98\x85\xe2\x98\x85Conference Schedule\xe2\x98\x85\xe2\x98\x85\rDecember 7, 2022\r 10:30 - 17:00, On-site Registration & Online ZOOM test\r Participants are supposed to sign in at the conference venue and collect all the conference materials at the registration counter on this day.\rDecember 8, 2022\r 9:00-12:00, Opening Ceremony & Keynote Speeches\r 13:30-18:00, Parallel Sessions ( Oral Presentation )\rDecember 9, 2022\r Online Parallel Session\r \xe2\x98\x85\xe2\x98\x85Singapore\rSingapore, the Asian Tiger is vibrant and ever changing, at once a city, an island, and a nation with more than 5 million inhabitants: it has become an icon worldwide. Along with Bangkok and Hong Kong, Singapore is one of the most popular tourist destinations in South East Asia.\rExploring the Singapore river by boat, eating in a hawker, seeing the skyscrapers from the Merlion Park, visiting Little India, exploring Chinatown or having a drink in Clarke Quay... Singapore has any number of unforgettable experiences just waiting for you.\r \xe2\x98\x85\xe2\x98\x85Contact:\rMs. Slyvia Ding (Conference Secretary)\rE-mail: cccis_general@163.com \rTel: +86-182-1565-4293; +86-28-86527868\r\n'

title: b'ICITM--EI 2023'
description: b'2023 the 12th International Conference on Industrial Technology and Management (ICITM 2023)'
Categories: b'industrial engineering' b'management' b'automation' b'artificial intelligence'
Call For Papers: b"\nICITM 2023 - Industrial Technology and Management Conference | Scopus & Ei Compendex Index\r \xe2\x98\x85Full name:  2023 the 12th International Conference on Industrial Technology and Management (ICITM 2023)--Ei Compendex, Scopus\r\xe2\x98\x85Abbreviation\xef\xbc\x9aICITM 2023\r\xe2\x98\x85Website\xef\xbc\x9ahttp://www.icitm.org\r\xe2\x98\x85Conference dates\xef\xbc\x9aFebruary 16-18, 2023\r\xe2\x98\x85Venue\xef\xbc\x9aCambridge, United Kingdom\r  We welcome you to submit your original research paper(s) to the 12th International Conference on Industrial Technology and Management that to be held in Cambridge, United Kingdom on the February 16-18, 2023. ICITM 2023 accepts virtual presentation way, and the registration fee for online/Video presentation has be added.\rICITM has been an annual event which was held in many places. We would like to extend our grateful thanks to all the participants. The ICITM 2023 Conference will build on the success of the previous conferences.\r \xe2\x98\x85Call for paper\xe2\x98\x85\rTopics of interest include, but are not limited to:\rTrack 1: Industrial Automation, Communication, Networking and Informatics\rTrack 2: Control Systems, Robotics and Mechatronics\rTrack 3: Electrical Machines and Drives\rTrack 4: Power Electronics and Renewable Energy Conversion\rTrack 5: Power Systems and Smart Grids\rTrack 6: Sensors, Actuators and Micro\xe2\x80\x90Nanotechnology\rTrack 7: Cloud Computing, Big Data and Software Engineering\rTrack 8: Electronic Systems on Chip and Embedded Control\rTrack 9: Signal and Image Processing and Computational Intelligence\rTrack 10: Production Management\rTrack 11: Advanced Production Management Methodologies\rTrack 12: Project Management\rTrack 13: Research and Development\rTrack 14: Quantitative Analysis in Industrial Management\rTrack 15: Artificial Intelligence and Information Technology in Industrial Management\rTrack 16: Practice and Experiences in Industrial Management\rTrack 17: Digital Factory\rTrack 18: Energy and Environment Management\r For details about topics, please visit at http://www.icitm.org/cfp.html\r \xe2\x98\x85Publication\xe2\x98\x85\rSubmitted papers will be peer reviewed by conference committees, and accepted papers will be included into ICITM 2023 Conference Proceedings which will be published and submitted to Xplore. \rThe publication records, please refer to: http://www.icitm.org/proceedings.html \rICITM 2023 has arranged special issues with journals to publish an extended version of the conference's most top conference papers:\r-IEEE Consumer Electronics Magazine: ISI impact Factor, ISSN: 2162-2248, 2018 Impact Factor: 3.273-International Journal of Computing and Digital Systems (IJCDS): SCOPUS & INSPEC, ISSN 2210-142X\r \xe2\x98\x85Submission\xe2\x98\x85\r1. Full paper(publication and presentation)\r2. Abstract (only presentation)\rSubmission Online Electrical System (Please submit via the following link) : \r https://www.easychair.org/conferences/?conf=icitm2023\rMore details about submission, please via: http://www.icitm.org/sub.html\r \xe2\x98\x85Conference Schedule\xe2\x98\x85\rDay 1, February 16, 2023\rCheck in for ICITM 2023 and Conference Material Collection\rDay 2, February 17, 2023  \r09:00 \xe2\x80\x93 18:00 Opening Remarks & Keynote Speech & & Plenary Speech & ICITM Parallel Sessions\rDay 3, February 18, 2023\r09:00 \xe2\x80\x93 16:45 ICITM Parallel Sessions\r \xe2\x98\x85Cambridge, United Kingdom\xe2\x98\x85\rAbounding with exquisite architecture, exuding history and tradition, and renowned for its quirky rituals, Cambridge is a university town extraordinaire. The tightly packed core of ancient colleges, the picturesque riverside 'Backs' (college gardens) and the leafy green meadows surrounding the city give it a more tranquil appeal than its historic rival Oxford.\rLike 'the Other Place', as Oxford is known locally, the buildings here seem unchanged for centuries, and it's possible to wander around the college buildings and experience them as countless prime ministers, poets, writers and scientists have done. Sheer academic achievement seems to permeate the very walls: cyclists loaded down with books negotiate cobbled passageways, students relax on manicured lawns and great minds debate life-changing research in historic pubs. First-time punters zigzag erratically across the river, and those long past their student days wonder what it would have been like to study in such splendid surroundings.\r \xe2\x98\x85Contact\xe2\x98\x85\rMs. Eileen Wu (Secretary Assistant)\rE-mail: icitm_icitm@outlook.com\rTel: +86-28-86527868\rMonday - Friday (09:30-18:00)\n\t"

title: b'SPIES 2022'
description: b'2022 4th International Conference on Smart Power & Internet Energy Systems (SPIES 2022)'
Categories: b'energy' b'systems engineering' b'electrical engineering' b'power'
Call For Papers: b"\nFull name: 2022 4th International Conference on Smart Power & Internet Energy Systems (SPIES 2022)\rAbbreviation: SPIES 2022\r 2022 4th International Conference on Smart Power & Internet Energy Systems will be held in Beijing, China on October 27-30, 2022.\r Conference Website: http://www.icspies.org/\r  SPIES 2022 Information:\r1. The accepted and presented papers of the 2022 4th International Conference on Smart Power & Internet Energy Systems (SPIES 2022) will be published in conference proceedings to be archived into IEEE Xplore\xc2\xae Digital Library, indexed by Ei Compendex, Scopus, INSPEC, Thomson Reuters\xe2\x80\x99Web of Science, and others.\r 2. Some excellent papers will be recommended to IEEE Transactions on Industry Applications (Impact Factor 3.488), CSEE Journal of Power and Energy Systems(Impact Factor 3.938), and Journal of Modern Power Systems and Clean Energy(Impact Factor 3.265). Invited authors need to submit an extended version of the conference paper.\r 3. SPIES 2022 is co-sponsored by Tsinghua University, China and Shandong University, China. It is also technically co-sponsored by IEEE Industry Applications Society, IEEE Industrial Electronics Society and IEEE Power and Energy Society. And great supports also come from University of Vaasa, University of Technology of Belfort-Montb\xc3\xa9liard, Changmai Unversity, Universite de Bretagne Occidentable, Auckland University of Technology, University of Nottingham Malaysia and Qatar University etc.\r 4. Call For Papers: b"\nThe Workshop on 'Cyber Threat Intelligence and Hunting'(CyberHunt 2022) is organized for the 5th year by the Digital Security Group of the University of Oslo in conjunction with the 2022 IEEE International Conference on Big Data (IEEE BigData 2022). \r CyberHunt 2022 provides a forum where experts from academia, industry, and government can present and publish research that advances the domain of CTI and other related domains that rely on and make use of CTI.\r  ## Important dates\r Submission deadline: October 1, 2022\rNotifications due: November 1, 2022\rCamera-ready of accepted papers deadline: November 15, 2022\rConference and workshops: Dec 17-20, 2022\r  ## The workshop's webpage:\rhttps://cyberhunt2022.cyberhunt.no/\r  ## Submission page: \rhttps://wi-lab.com/cyberchair/2022/bigdata22/scripts/submit.php?subarea=S02&undisplay_detail=1&wh=/cyberchair/2022/bigdata22/scripts/ws_submit.php\r  ## Submission details: \rhttps://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html\r  ## Research topics\r The workshop welcomes research in the following areas.\r -Attribution\r-CTI sharing and machine-readable formats\r-Data sources, collection, and processing\r-Intelligence analysis\r-Intelligence-driven incident response\r-Intelligence-driven red teaming\r-Intelligence-driven Threat Hunting\r-Intelligence (knowledge) representation, management, and dissemination (symbolic AI/ontologies/templating approaches)\r-Legal, privacy, and ethical factors\r-Machine Learning (ML) for CTI\r-Open-source tools\r-Political (cyber politics) and geopolitical aspects, and decision making\r-Security automation\r-Tradecraft\r-Visualisation techniques for CTI\r  ## Organizing committee\r Co-chair: Vasileios Mavroeidis (University of Oslo)\rCo-chair: Mateusz Zych (University of Oslo) - mateusdz@ifi.uio.no\rProgram committee chair: Andre Buttner (University of Oslo) - andrbut@ifi.uio.no\r \n"

4th International Conference on Mechanical Engineering (MECN 2022)

December 17 ~ 18, 2022, Dubai, UAE

Scope & Topics

4thInternational Conference on Mechanical Engineering (MECN 2022) will provide an excellent international forum for sharing knowledge and results in theory, methodology and applications impacts and challenges of Mechanical Engineering. The conference documents practical and theoretical results which make a fundamental contribution for the development of Mechanical Engineering\r

Authors are solicited to contribute to the conference by submitting articles that illustrate research results, projects, surveying works and industrial experiences that describe significant advances in the following areas, but are not limited to.\r

Topics of interest include, but are not limited to, the following

  • Advances of Aero Space Technology\r
  • Artificial Intelligence and Expert Systems\r
  • CAD/CAM, Automation & Robotics\r
  • Design Tools, Cutting Tool Material and Coatings\r
  • Energy Conservation, Renewable Energy Techniques\r
  • Fluid Dynamics, Bio-fuels, Fuel Cells\r
  • Logistics and Supply Chain Management\r
  • Machinability of Materials, Composite Materials\r
  • Non-Traditional Machining processes\r
  • Operations Management\r
  • Recent Trends and Advances\r
  • Reliability and Maintenance Engineering\r
  • Total Quality Management and Quality Engineering\r
  • Transportation Systems\r
  • Tribolog

Paper Submission

Authors are invited to submit papers through the conference Submission System by August 27, 2022. Submissions must be original and should not have been published previously or be under consideration for publication while being evaluated for this conference. The proceedings of the conference will be published by International Journal of Recent advances in Mechanical Engineering (IJMECH)series (Confirmed).

Selected papers from MECN 2022, after further revisions, will be published in the special issues of the following journals.

  • Mechanical Engineering: An International Journal (MEIJ)

Important Dates

Submission Deadline: August 27, 2022
Authors Notification: October 31, 2022
Final Manuscript Due: November 08, 2022

Call For Papers: b"\nFirst International Conference on Computer Communications and Intelligent Systems (I3CIS'22)\r                             http://www.i3cis.org/\r                             November 22 - 23, 2022\r                               Jijel, Algeria\r Aims:\r The international conference on computer communications and intelligent systems (I3CIS\xe2\x80\x9922) will be held in the beautiful city of Jijel, Algeria, on November 22-23, 2022. I3CIS aims to be one of the emerging international conferences for presenting recent innovative advances in the fields of computer communications and intelligent systems. The main purpose of I3CIS\xe2\x80\x9922 is to gather novel and original research results in the areas of networking, cyber security, applications of artificial intelligence, software engineering and data science. The conference will provide a platform for exchanging inspiring ideas, discussing innovative solutions, and sharing recent experiences among researchers and professionals from all over the world and from both academia and industry, in the domain of computer communications and intelligent systems.\r In case of travel restrictions due to the COVID pandemic, the conference will be in the form of a hybrid conference with as many authors and participants as possible attending the conference in Jijel in person, and others attending remotely.\r The topics include, but are not limited to:\r  a- Networking and Communications\r- Mobile/Wireless/ Underwater and Underground Communications\r- Ad hoc networks/Vehicular ad hoc networks / Wireless Sensors Networks and Mesh Networks\r- Flying Ad hoc Networks and self-powered airborne wireless networks\r- Wireless body area networks and e-health services\r- Software Defined-Networking / Network Function Virtualization\r- 5G and 6G communications and Beyond\r- Massive MIMO, beamforming, mmWave and Terahertz communications\r- Device-to-device and machine-to-machine communications\r- Cognitive and Cooperative Communication and Radios\r- Smart cities / Smart Mobility / Smart Grid Networks\r- Green networks, Energy efficiency and Energy harvesting\r- Internet of Thing and enabling technologies\r- Ultra-reliable, Tactile Internet, and title: b'OCL 2022'
description: b'21st International Workshop on OCL and Textual Modeling'
Categories: b'software engineering' b'modeling' b'modeling languages' b'model-based engineering'
Call For Papers: b'\nModeling started out with UML and its precursors as a graphical notation. Such visual representations enable direct intuitive capturing of reality, but they have weaknesses: for example, detailed visual representations bear the risk of becoming overcrowded faster than textual models and some of the visual features lack the level of precision required to create complete and unambiguous specifications. These weaknesses of graphical notations encouraged the development of text-based modeling languages that either integrate with or replace graphical notations for modeling. Typical examples of such languages are OCL, textual MOF, Epsilon, and Alloy.\r The goal of this workshop is to create a forum where researchers and practitioners interested in building models using OCL or other kinds of textual languages can directly interact, report advances, share results, identify tools for language development, and discuss appropriate standards.\r This year, MODELS workshops share a common theme of "Modeling for social good". Thus, we particularly encourage submissions considering the application of textual modeling to intelligent systems, and social/ethical issues.\r Topics of interest\r Topics of interest include (but are not limited to):\r - Mappings between textual modeling languages and other languages/formalisms\r- Mathematical models and/or formal semantics for textual modeling languages\r- Algorithms, evaluation strategies and optimizations in the context of textual modeling languages for:\r  - validation, verification, and testing,\r  - model transformation and code generation,\r  - meta-modeling and DSLs, and\r  - query and constraint specifications\r- Alternative graphical/textual notations for textual modeling languages\r- Evolution, transformation and simplification of textual modeling expressions\r- Libraries, templates and patterns for textual modeling languages\r- Tools that support textual modeling languages (e.g., verification of OCL formulae, runtime monitoring of invariants)\r- Model-driven security using textual modeling languages\r- Complexity results for textual modeling languages\r- Quality models and benchmarks for comparing and evaluating textual modeling tools and algorithms\r- Successful applications of textual modeling languages\r- Case studies on industrial applications of textual modeling languages\r- Experience reports:\r  - usage of textual modeling languages and tools in complex domains,\r  - usability of textual modeling languages and tools for end-users,\r  - applications of textual modeling in the lifecycle of intelligent systems,\r  - applications of textual modeling with a positive impact on society\r- Empirical studies about the benefits and drawbacks of textual modeling\r- Innovative textual modeling tools\r- Comparison, evaluation and integration of modeling languages\r- Correlation between modeling languages and modeling tasks\r- Reflections on the future trends of textual modeling languages and their integrity with other software development technologies\r Submissions\r Four types of submissions will be considered:\r * Presentation only submission (not included in the workshop proceedings), e.g., for already published work. Authors should submit a short (1 page) abstract of their presentation.\r* Short papers (5 pages) describing new ideas or position papers.\r* Tool papers (5 pages) describing tools supporting textual modeling.\r* Full papers (between 7 and 10 pages).\r All submissions should follow the ACM sigconf style and should be uploaded to EasyChair (https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ocl2022). \r The program committee will review the submissions (minimum 2 reviews per paper, usually 3 reviews) and select papers according to their relevance and interest for discussions that will take place at the workshop. Accepted papers will be included in a joint MODELS\' workshop proceedings volume to appear in the ACM digital library.\r Important Dates (AoE - Anywhere on Earth)\r - Abstract submission:     July 13, 2022\r- Paper submission:        July 20, 2022\r- Notification:          August 19, 2022\r- Camera ready:          August 26, 2022\r- Workshop:          October 23-25, 2022 (To be decided)\r\n'

title: b'NCIRTTM 2022'
description: b'CFP: Narrative Complexity in Recent Time-Travel Media '
Categories: b'humanities' b'interdisciplinary' b'film' b'popular culture'
Call For Papers: b"\nWe are seeking contributors for an edited collection of scholarly essays on these recent changes in the complexity of time-travel media (film, television, gaming, or literature). Submissions that are interdisciplinary in theory and method are welcome, especially those in popular culture, science fiction, fantasy, genre studies, critical media studies, narratology, etc. Abstracts and papers discussing recent time-travel media, approximately within the last decade, may include but are not limited to research concerning narrative structure, theme, genre, reception, comprehension, and other relevant topics.  \r Historically, time-travel films and television (TV) shows relied on science-fiction (sci-fi) tropes and storytelling devices to convey atemporal narratives. More recently, an increasing number of time-travel media have begun incorporating a variety of non-sci-fi elements to create new, increasingly complicated spins on well-worn tropes. The rapidly evolving landscape of technological advancements in our world today have made narratives dealing with the exclusive science/mechanics of time travel less of an imaginative possibility. Many viewers today seem receptive to the recycling of science-fiction time-travel tropes in many of these more traditional sci-fi narratives. However, more authors have begun creating unique adaptations on tropes such as time travel to engage audiences\xe2\x80\x99 narrative understanding in new ways, and the audiences want to see and be entertained by them. Whether this is seen as a component of hybrid genre or structural complexity, more recent time-travel media have purposefully complicated their narratives by reconditioning audiences to expect the unexpected and require audiences to learn how to engage with the story to better understand the narrative on multiple levels. \r This edited collection will demonstrate that time-travel media is more complicated now than ever before, but also that newer time-travel media has expanded into the \xe2\x80\x9cmainstream\xe2\x80\x9d of multiple narrative genres that, prior to, were predominantly superhero, fantasy, thriller, etc. Time travel now has grown into a tried and true crossover of these genres and many more, taking the necessity of \xe2\x80\x9cscience\xe2\x80\x9d out of time travel, thus constructing a fresh cultural trope that can be used by any author writing in any genre. This exploration of how a staple trope strongly tied to a single genre, like time travel was to science-fiction media, can successfully become mainstream adds to the current conversation surrounding interdisciplinary studies in areas such as critical media, genre, narrativity, and more. This exploration also aims to reveal the interdependent relationship of the time-travel trope and its malleability, the authors and their ability to make said trope believable, and the audience and their ability to suspend their disbelief and accept the use of the trope in new media and genres. \r Abstracts, up to 300 words, should present research intentions, the research\xe2\x80\x99s original contribution, and how the focus aligns with the main \xe2\x80\x9ctheme\xe2\x80\x9d of narrative complexity in this collection. All papers should be approximately 10-25 double-spaced pages following the current 9th ed. MLA style with in-text citations and Works Cited page at the end. We are currently in conversations with leading publishers and will provide more concrete publication deadline information as those decisions are finalized. \r Please submit abstracts by October 31st, 2022. \rFinal paper drafts deadline is tentatively set for August 31st, 2023. \r Please direct all abstracts, papers, and inquiries to TimeTravelCFP@gmail.com. We look forward to hearing from you and learning more about your contributions. \r Liz Trepanier, Luke Leonard, and Emory O'Malley (editors)\r\n"

Call For Papers: b'\nFull paper submissions or abstracts are invited for the 3rd Edition of the 2022 International Conference on Multidisciplinary Research (MyRes) to be held physically in Mauritius from 8th to 9th December 2022. This is an exceptional platform for researchers, academics, students, innovators, scientists and industry practitioners to discuss current research which is shaping a new world society. This conference will be a good platform to share research, innovations and best-practices where constructive feedback and engagement with domain experts is expected. Many topics of the multi-disciplinary nature as a response to everyday challenges faced in both developing and developed world contexts will be discussed. We encourage submissions of cross-disciplinary nature cutting across many disciplines/subject-areas. We encourage any submissions that present novel ideas, works-in-progress or any concepts that you think can benefit from inputs from experts. Students and/or emerging researchers are encouraged to participate. The different tracks in this conference are as follows:\rTrack 1: Education, Teaching, Learning & Assessment\rTrack 2: STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics)\rTrack 3: Arts, Humanities & Social Sciences\rTrack 4: Business, Management, Economics & Accounting\r Please note that the lists of topics considered in these tracks are not collectively exhaustive.\n\t'

title: b'BDL 2022'
description: b' Workshop on Big Data & Deep Learning in High Performance Computing'
Categories: b'high performance computing' b'big data' b'deep learning'
Call For Papers: b'\n---------------\rCALL FOR PAPERS\r---------------\rBDL 2022\r Workshop on Big Data & Deep Learning in\rHigh Performance Computing\r Bordeaux, France, November 2-5, 2022\r https://www.dcc.fc.up.pt/bdl2022/\r ----------------------\rAims and scope of BDL\r----------------------\r The number of very large data repositories (big data) is increasing in\ra rapid pace. Analysis of such repositories using the traditional\rsequential implementations of Machine Learning (ML) and emerging\rtechniques, like deep learning, that model high-level abstractions in\rdata by using multiple processing layers, requires expensive\rcomputational resources and long running times.\r Parallel or distributed computing are possible approaches that can\rmake analysis of very large repositories and exploration of high-level\rrepresentations feasible. Taking advantage of a parallel or a\rdistributed execution of a ML/statistical system may: i) increase its\rspeed; ii) learn hidden representations; iii) search a larger space\rand reach a better solution or; iv) increase the range of applications\rwhere it can be used (because it can process more data, for\rexample). Parallel and distributed computing is therefore of high\rimportance to extract knowledge from massive amounts of data and learn\rhidden representations.\r The workshop will be concerned with the exchange of experience among\racademics, researchers and the industry whose work in big data and\rdeep learning require high performance computing to achieve\rgoals. Participants will present recently developed\ralgorithms/systems, on going work and applications taking advantage of\rsuch parallel or distributed environments.\r ------\rTopics\r------\r BDL 2022 invites papers on all topics in novel data-intensive\rcomputing techniques, data storage and integration schemes, and\ralgorithms for cutting-edge high performance computing architectures\rwhich targets Big Data and Deep Learning are of interest to the\rworkshop. Examples of topics include but not limited to:\r * parallel algorithms for data-intensive applications;\r* scalable data and text mining and information retrieval;\r* using Hadoop, MapReduce, Spark, Storm, Streaming to analyze Big Data;\r* energy-efficient data-intensive computing;\r* deep-learning with massive-scale datasets;\r* querying and visualization of large network datasets;\r* processing large-scale datasets on clusters of multicore and\r   manycore processors, and accelerators;\r* heterogeneous computing for Big Data architectures;\r* Big Data in the Cloud;\r* processing and analyzing high-resolution images using\r  high-performance computing;\r* using hybrid infrastructures for Big Data analysis;\r* new algorithms for parallel/distributed execution of ML systems;\r* applications of big data and deep learning to real-life problems.\r ------------------\rProgram Chairs\r------------------\r Jo\xc3\xa3o Gama, University of Porto, Portugal\rCarlos Ferreira, Polytechnic Institute of Porto, Portugal\rMiguel Areias, University of Porto, Portugal\r -----------------\rProgram Committee\r-----------------\r TBA\r ----------------\rImportant dates\r----------------\r Submission deadline: July 30, 2022(AoE)\rAuthor notification: September 2, 2022\rCamera-ready: September 12, 2022\rRegistration deadline: September 14, 2022\r ----------------\rPaper submission\r----------------\r Papers submitted to BDL 2022 must describe original research results\rand must not have been published or simultaneously submitted anywhere\relse.\r Manuscripts must follow the IEEE conference formatting guidelines and\rsubmitted via the EasyChair Conference Management System as one pdf\rfile. The strict page limit for initial submission and camera-ready\rversion is 8 pages in the aforementioned format.\r Each paper will receive a minimum of three reviews by members of the\rinternational technical program committee. Papers will be selected\rbased on their originality, relevance, technical clarity and quality\rof presentation. At least one author of each accepted paper must\rregister for the BDL 2022 workshop and present the paper.\r -----------\rProceedings\r-----------\r All accepted papers will be published at IEEE Xplore.\n\t'

title: b'ICADL 2022'
description: b'International Conference on Asia-Pacific Digital Libraries'
Categories: b'digital libraries' b'scientometrics' b'open science' b'research data management'
Call For Papers: b'\nThe 24th International Conference on Asia-Pacific Digital Libraries (ICADL 2022)\r                     November 30 - December 2, 2022\r                           Hanoi, Viet Nam\r (Onsite face-to-face conference, allowing those who cannot attend to present their papers online)\r                Website: https://icadl.net/icadl2022/\r [Introduction]\rThe International Conference on Asia-Pacific Digital Libraries (ICADL), which started in Hong Kong in 1998 and, over the years, traveled to many countries in the Asia-Pacific region, is known as a significant digital library conference. Along with JCDL and TPDL, ICADL is held annually as one of the three top venues for connecting digital library, computer science, and library and information science communities.\r [Conference Format]\rThis year ICADL will be held from November 30th to December 2nd, 2022, in Hanoi, Vietnam (Hanoi time zone), as an onsite face-to-face conference but allows those who cannot attend to present their papers online and join sessions. ICADL2022 will be held in conjunction with the Asia-Pacific Chapter of iSchools (AP-iSchools). A graduate student symposium will also be held with the Asia-Pacific Chapter of iSchools (AP-iSchools) and A-LIEP communities.\r Attendees are encouraged to join ICADL2022 in-person or online if physical attendance is difficult. Registration is still required for either way of participation prior to the conference.\r [Publication]\rProceedings of ICADL 2022 will be published by Springer as an LNCS volume, which is indexed by Scopus. This year, we have the following submission categories: full research papers, short research papers, and practice papers as well as demo/poster papers.\r [Topics]\rWe invite submissions on diverse topics related to digital libraries and related fields including, but not limited to:\r Information Technologies, Data Science, & Applications\rCultural Information, Digital Humanities, & Scholarly Data Analysis\rSocial-Informatics and Socio-Technological Issues in Digital Libraries\r For details of topics, please refer to https://icadl.net/icadl2022/.\r [Submission]\rAll submissions must be in English and submitted as PDF.\rPapers should follow Springer Computer Science Proceedings guidelines (https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines).\rAll papers are to be submitted via the conference\xe2\x80\x99s EasyChair submission system (https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=icadl2022).\r The review process is single-blind (authors will not know the reviewers). At least 3 Program Committee members will review each submission. The review for practice paper submissions will put less emphasis on the novelty and more on real-world practices and applications of DL technologies in institutions or companies.\r Sufficient time will be given to the oral presentation for accepted papers in all submission categories. Each accepted paper must be presented by at least one of the co-authors.\r The Best Paper and the Best Student Paper will be awarded by the Program Committee among the accepted full papers. In addition, same as the last year, selected best papers are planned to be invited for a special issue to be published in the International Journal on Digital Libraries (IJDL), Springer.\r The lengths of submissions should be as follows:\r\xef\xbd\xa5 Full papers: 12-14 pages + references\r\xef\xbd\xa5 Short papers: 6-8 pages + references\r\xef\xbd\xa5 Practice papers: 6-8 pages + references\r\xef\xbd\xa5 Demo/poster papers: 4-6 pages + references\r IMPORTANT DATES\r- Full, Short Research and Practice Papers Submission: July 1, 2022\r- Demo/poster Papers Submission: July 1, 2022\r- Acceptance Notification (All paper categories): August 20, 2022\r- Camera Ready Copy of Papers: September 10, 2022\r- Attendee and Author Information Registration Deadline: November 10, 2022\r- Conference: November 30 - December 2, 2022\r [Organizers]\rConference general co-chairs:\r- Nguyen Hoang Son (Library & Information Centre, Vietnam National University, Vietnam)\r- Shigeo Sugimoto (University of Tsukuba, Japan)\r Program committee co-chairs:\r- Yuen-Hsien Tseng (National Taiwan Normal University, Taiwan)\r- Marie Katsurai (Doshisha University, Japan)\r- Hoa N. Nguyen (VNU University of Engineering and Technology, Vietnam)\r Publicity co-chairs:\r- Ricardo Campos (INESC TEC; Polytechnic Institute of Tomar, Portugal)\r- Songphan Choemprayong (Chulalongkorn University, Thailand)\r- Adam Jatowt (University of Innsbruck, Austria)\r- Hao-Ren Ke  (National Taiwan Normal University, Taiwan)\r- Akira Maeda (Ritsumeikan University, Japan)\r- Maciej Ogrodniczuk (The Polish Academy of Sciences, Poland)\r- Muhammad Syafiq Mohd Pozi (Unversiti Utara Malaysia)\r- Michael F\xc3\xa4rber (Karlsruhe Institute of Technology, Germany)\r- Chutiporn Anutaria (AIT, Thailand)\r Co-hosts:\r- Vietnam National University at Hanoi, Vietnam\r- ICADL Steering Committee\r Collaboration:\r- the Asia-Pacific Chapter of iSchools\n\t'

title: b'DS 2022'

Call For Papers: b'\nThe 25th International Conference on Discovery Science (DS 2022)\r https://ds2022.sciencesconf.org/\r Montpellier, France, October, 10-12, 2022\r ***********************************\r::: IMPORTANT DATES :::\r***********************************\rAbstract submission: June 18, 2022 [EXTENDED DEADLINE]\rFull paper submission: June 20, 2022 [EXTENDED DEADLINE]\rNotification: July 27, 2022\rCamera ready version, author registration: August 8, 2022\rConference: October 10-12, 2022\r  ***********************************\rCOVID-19\r***********************************\rWe hope that by October the world will have returned to normality and we can welcome you in Montpellier. However, in case the COVID-19 risk persists and traveling is difficult, DS 2022 will take place either as a mixed event by offering both remote and on site presentation options or as a fully online event in the worst case. The accepted papers will still be published by Springer and the special issue will proceed as announced. In these challenging times that the whole of humanity is going through, we hope that all of you are safe and remain healthy. \r ***********************************\r::: Scope ::: \r***********************************\rThe 25th International Conference on Discovery Science (DS 2022) provides an open forum for\rintensive discussions and exchange of new ideas among researchers working in the area of Discovery Science.  The scope of the conference includes the development and analysis of methods for discovering scientific knowledge, coming from machine learning, data mining, intelligent data analysis, big data analysis as well as their application in various scientific domains.\r ***********************************\r::: Keynote Speakers ::: \r***********************************\r \xe2\x80\xa2\tLeman Akoglu, Carnegie Mellon University, USA\r\xe2\x80\xa2\tStefan Kramer, University of Mainz, Germany\r  ***********************************\r::: Submission Topics :::\r***********************************\rWe invite submissions of research papers addressing all aspects of discovery science: papers that focus on the analysis of different types of massive and complex data, including structured, spatio-temporal and network data. We would also like to encourage contributions from the areas of computational scientific discovery, mining scientific data, computational creativity and discovery informatics.  \rWe particularly welcome papers addressing applications from different domains of science including biomedicine and life sciences, astronomy, physics, chemistry, as well as social sciences. Applications to massive, heterogeneous, continuous or imprecise data sets are of particular interests. Possible topics include, but are not limited to:\r -\tKnowledge discovery, machine learning and statistical methods\r-\tUbiquitous Knowledge Discovery\r-\tData Streams, Evolving Data and Models\r-\tChange Detection and Model Maintenance\r-\tActive Knowledge Discovery\r-\tInformation extraction from scientific literature\r-\tKnowledge discovery from heterogeneous, unstructured and multimedia data\r-\tData and knowledge visualization\r-\tPlanning to Learn\r-\tKnowledge Transfer\r-\tComputational Creativity\r-\tHuman-machine interaction for knowledge discovery and management\r-\tEvaluation of models and predictions in discovery setting\r-\tCausality modelling\r-\tAutoML, meta-learning, planning to learn\r-\tExplainable AI, interpretability of machine learning and deep learning models\r-\tLearning from complex data\r-\tGraphs, networks, linked and relational data\r-\tSpatial, temporal and spatiotemporal data\r-\tUnstructured data, including textual and web data \r-\tMultimedia data\r-\tAI frameworks for discovery in scientific domains\r-\tBiomedical knowledge discovery, analysis of  (multi)omics, micro-array, gene deletion, gene set enrichment data\r-\tMachine Learning for High-Performance Computing, Grid and Cloud Computing\r-\tApplications of the above techniques in scientific domains, such as\r-\tPhysical sciences (e.g., materials sciences, particle physics)\r-\tLife sciences (e.g., systems biology/systems medicine)\r-\tEnvironmental sciences\r-\tLife Sciences\r-\tNatural and social sciences\r   ***********************************\r::: Publishing :::\r***********************************\rTraditionally the proceedings of DS series appear in the Lecture Notes in Artificial Intelligence Series by Springer-Verlag. In addition, authors of best papers will be invited to submit their extended versions to a special issue on Discovery Science of the Machine Learning journal published by Springer. Fast Track Processing will be used to have them reviewed and published.\r  ***********************************\r::: Submission guidelines :::\r***********************************\rRegular research papers may contain up to fifteen (15) pages and must be formatted according to the layout supplied by Springer-Verlag for the Lecture Notes in Computer Science series. The Program Committee reserves the right to offer acceptance as Short Papers (10 pages in the Proceedings) to some submissions. The reviews are single-blind. You do not need to anonymize your submission.\rSubmitted papers may not have appeared in or be under consideration for another workshop, conference or a journal, nor may they be under review or submitted to another forum during the DS 2022 review process. \rWe encourage all authors to include their individual ORCID in their address information.\rAuthors can submit their regular papers via our submission page through Easychair: \r https://easychair.org/my/login_author?sum=073323801fd3b7125c2b6cc57ecf0a6f;conference=267691\r Authors of accepted papers must submit along with the final version of their paper a consent to publish, filled and signed. Authors of accepted papers are expected to register to the conference and present their work (see author registration date). \r ***********************************\rSpecial issue and Best Student Paper Award\r***********************************\rThe authors of a number of selected papers presented at DS 2022 will be invited to submit extended versions of their papers for possible inclusion in a special issue of Machine Learning journal (published by Springer) on Discovery Science. Fast-track processing will be used to have them reviewed and published.\rThere will be an award for the Best Student Paper in the value of 555 Eur sponsored by Springer.\r   Dino Ienco (PC Co-Chairs DS)\rPascal Poncelet (PC Co-Chairs DS)\rSa\xc5\xa1o D\xc5\xbeeroski  (General Chair DS)\r  \n'

title: b'ONTOBRAS 2022'
description: b'15th Seminar on Ontology Research in Brazil'
Categories: b'ontology' b'conceptual modeling' b'information science' b'phylosophy'
Call For Papers: b"\n+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++\rCall for Contributions: Research papers,  Doctoral and Masters proposals, Tutorials\r+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++\r 15th Seminar on Ontology Research in Brazil \xe2\x80\x94 ONTOBRAS 2022\rNovember 22-25, 2022\rOnline and Open\rhttps://www.inf.ufrgs.br/ontobras\r ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------\rABOUT\r----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------\r The Seminar on Ontology Research in Brazil (ONTOBRAS) is a scientific venue for researchers and practitioners from computer and information science to discuss theories, methodologies, languages, tools, and experiences related to the theory and practice of ontologies. In addition, Master's and Ph.D. students whose research is focused on Ontologies will find in the Doctoral and Masters Consortium on Ontologies (WTDO) the opportunity to present and discuss their proposals with experts in the field \xe2\x80\x93 a valuable opportunity to receive feedback on their research and network within the community. Likewise, through the Tutorials Track. Students, practitioners, and lecturers will have the opportunity to learn techniques and tools used by the community.\r In its 15th edition, ONTOBRAS 2022 is recognized by the Brazilian ontology community as a unique and highly qualified forum for the presentation and discussion of ontologies and application cases in Brazil. The WTDO is in its 6th edition and has been consolidating itself as a rich space for discussion among researchers of different generations, contributing to the expansion and renewal of the community of ontology researchers in Brazil. This year, with the tutorials track, participants will also have the opportunity to learn state-of-the-art ontology techniques and tools.\r ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------\rTOPICS\r----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------\r We list in a non-exhaustive way areas and research communities from which we expect to receive submissions:\r - Conceptual modeling: conceptual methods and tools for the formal representation of concepts in ontologies.\r - Information Science: construction and use of taxonomies, thesauri, knowledge organization systems, information indexing, and other applications.\r - Logic and Reasoning: formal representation languages and systems applied to representation and reasoning with ontologies.\r - Philosophy: philosophical aspects that underlie ontological modeling, top ontologies, mereology, essence and identity, and others.\r - Software engineering: ontology representation languages, system architecture, methodologies for developing ontology-based systems.\r - Linguistics and natural language processing: concept extraction, meaning determination.\r Researchers and practitioners are invited to submit theoretical, technical, and practical research contributions that directly or indirectly deal with the areas listed above. We welcome papers ranging from philosophical and theoretical foundations to new technologies and innovative applications.\r ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------\rTRACKS\r----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------\r ONTOBRAS 2022 welcomes submissions for the following tracks:\r - Main track: full and short papers presenting theoretical, technical, and practical research contributions that directly or indirectly deal with the following areas: conceptual modeling, information science, logic and reasoning, philosophy, software engineering, linguistics, and natural language.\r - Doctoral and Masters Consortium on Ontologies (WTDO): papers describing research proposals, at the master's or doctoral level, whose theses and dissertations have not been concluded by the date of the event.\r - Tutorials: teaching and training of techniques and tools of broad interest to the community.\r ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------\rIMPORTANT DATES\r----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------\r Submission deadlines:\r -
