title: b'CIIS 2022'
description: b'CIIS-UL 2022 : V International Congress in Systems Engineering'
Categories: b'computer science' b'software engineering' b'information technology' b'systems engineering'
Call For Papers: b'\nPost-Pandemic Hybrid Environments: Possibilities For New Technologies\rThe Systems Engineering Undergraduate Program of the University of Lima is pleased to organize and present the 5th International Conference on Systems Engineering (CIIS 2022) called \xe2\x80\x9cPost-Pandemic Hybrid Environments: Possibilities for New Technologies.\xe2\x80\x9d The objective of the congress is to reflect, discuss and present applications related to hybrid environments and new technologies with special focus on the current post-pandemic context. Research in the fields of information systems, software engineering, computer science and information technologies is expected to address these phenomena.\r Hybrid environments are especially important in the current context, characterized by mobility restrictions, social distancing and shutdown of some in-person activities. Individuals, organizations and companies have been adjusting to this situation and have learned or enhanced learning tools, which facilitate remote worker productivity, tracking of infected people, identification of new disease variants, among others. On one side, a large amount of these initiatives were developed as a response to emergencies, i.e., reactively. On the other side, the solutions created more virtual interactions and experiences among their physical counterparts, increasing the number of hybrid environments.\r In this context, it is convenient to proactively explore the possibilities offered by new technologies to maximize the results of these hybrid environments at a short, medium and long term. Results mean not only those achieved economically but also the innovative potential that may stem from these environments, the well-being of their members or the flexibility as a competence to adapt to future changes caused by technological disruptions and other health or social emergencies.\r As in previous editions, the congress will be attended by prominent world-class speakers, who will share their vision on the topics covered in the event. Furthermore, the 5th International Conference on Systems Engineering (CIIS 2022) organizing committee invites to the presentation of seminars and academic posters showing innovative research proposals from the fields of information systems, software engineering, computer science, information technologies or others related to the event topic.\r Finally, CIIS 2022 will be held on October 18 to 20 in person and virtually to respond to the limitations that may still exist due to the COVID-19 health emergency and to offer the best experience to our participants.\r CIIS 2021 will be held on October 26, 27 and 28 of 2021 and we will provide a space of international academic scope.\r Call For Papers and Posters:\rWe welcome original papers and posters reporting on research and empirical studies in the following, but not limited to, area topics:\r Information Systems:\rE-Business\rE-Government\rEducation in Information Systems\rGlobal issues in IS\rSecurity, Privacy and Ethics in IS\rProject Management\r Software Engineering:\rSoftware Architectures\rAgile Methodologies\rRequirements Engineering\rFormal Methods\rMethodologies in Software Development\rQuality Assurance\rMobile and Ubiquous Systems\rTesting, Verification and Validation of Software\r Computer Science:\rData Structures and Algorithms\rBig Data\rBioinformatics\rComputer Graphics\rComputer Science Education\rData Mining\rHuman Computer Interaction\rArtificial Intelligence\rInformation Processing\rVirtual and Augmented Reality\rTheory of Computing\rComputational Vision\rSocial and Ethics Issues in Computing\r Information Technology\rInternet of Things\rEmbedded Systems\rCloud Computing\rSoftware define Networks\rCybersecurity\rWeb and Internet Computing\rGrid Computing\rGreen Computing\rNetworks and Communications\r Link with instructions:\rhttps://ciis.ulima.edu.pe/en/elements/call-for-papers/\r Important Dates\rPaper submission deadline: July 25, 2022\rReview committee\xe2\x80\x99s notice of acceptance and observations deadline: September 5, 2022\rFinal paper submission deadline: September 19, 2022\r \n'

title: b'ICICO 2022'

Categories: b'computing' b'optimization' b'technology' b'artificial intelligence'
Call For Papers: b'\nCALL FOR PAPERS, SPECIAL SESSIONS, POSTERS & DEMOS\rICO 2022- Hybrid Conference (Zoom Webinar + Hua Hin)\t\rhttps://ghuahin.com/\r5th International Conference on Intelligent Computing & Optimization 2022\rOctober 27-28, 2022\r Conference website: https://www.icico.info/\rSubmission link: https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ico2022\rSubmission deadline: July 24, 2022\rE-mail: icico2018@gmail.com\r SCOPE\rInnovative global optimization approaches have attracted many research scientists, decision makers, managers, executives, engineers, academicians, officers, policy makers and practicing researchers in recent years as powerful intelligent computational techniques for solving many complex real-world application problems.\r The International Conference on Intelligent Computing and Optimization (ICO\xe2\x80\x992022) highlights the latest research innovations and applications of algorithms designed for optimization applications within the fields of Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, Management, Finance, Business and Economics. Focusing on a variety of methods and systems as well as practical examples, this conference is a significant resource for post graduate-level students, decision makers, and researchers in both public and private sectors who are seeking research-based methods for modeling uncertain and unpredictable real-world problems.\r Highlights\rAll accepted and reviewed papers will be published by Springer and made available through Springer-Link Digital Library, one of the world\'s largest scientific libraries.\r Conference Topics\rTopics to be discussed in this conference include (but are not limited to) the following:\rIntelligent Computing: Artificial Intelligence, Quantum Computing, Deep Neural Networks, Self Organizing, Fuzzy Logic, Membrane Computing, Evolutionary Computation, Learning theory, Probabilistic methods, Image processing computer vision, Speech recognition, Big Data Analytics, Evolutionary Algorithm, Randomness Monte Carlo Methods, Algorithmic Probability, Chaos Theory, Cryptography, Game Theory, Information Theory, Pattern Recognition, Natural Computing, Evolutionary Robotics Knowledge-based System, Machine Learning, Unsupervised Learning, Computational Finance, Computational Economics, DNA Computing, Deep Learning, Wavelets.\r Optimization: Ant Colony Optimization, Artificial Bee Colony, Artificial Immune Systems, Artificial Neural Networks, Automatic Computing, Bacterial Foraging, Biological Computing, Chaos Optimization, Cloud Computing, Combinatorial Optimization, Computational intelligence, Continuous Optimization, Cultural Algorithms. Differential Evolution, Direct Search, Evolutionary Computing, Fuzzy Optimization, Genetic Algorithms, Granular Computing, Hybrid Algorithms, Local and Global Search, Memetic Algorithms, Meta-heuristic Methods, Particle Swarm Optimization, Pattern Search, Simulated Annealing, Simulation and Modeling, Soft Computing Techniques, Support Vector Machines, Swarm Intelligence, Tabu Search, Variable Neighborhood Search, Quasi-Newton Methods, Monkey algorithm, Mathematical programming.\rApplications:\rIoTs, Adaptive Response, Microwave Field, Electric Skin Activity, Flood Management, Leg Mating Unit, Animal Husbantry, Reinforcement Learning, Solar Energy, Anaerobit Treatment Radiation, Elastic Damping Mechanism, Optimal Power Supply, Smart Home, Traveling Salesman Problem, Clustering Algorithms, Neural Machine Translation, Handwritten Recognition, Web Based Instruction, Load & Pollution Forecasting, SSD-Mobile net, Financial & Debt Ratios, Truth Discovery, Learning Analytics, Face Recognition, Mobile Cloud Gaming, Disposing Waste, Smart Audit, Drone, Menstrual Cycle, Pulse Wave, Traffic Data, Supply Chain, Electricity Prices, Health Economics, Photocells, Knight\xe2\x80\x99s Tour Problem, Electro-activated air, Vehicular communications, Elastic damping mechanism, Energy saving, Autonomous Vehicle, Photovoltaic, Grain drying, Loose material, Social Network, Monitoring System, Electroencephalogram, Block-chain, Molecular dynamics, Tree hierarchies, Hub Location, Path relinking, Interoperability, Trend Detection, Packing problem, Android.\r Tutorials/Workshops/Special Sessions\rProposals should provide a focused lecture or scope on new and emerging topics within the scope of the conference. Accepted and presented papers will be published in the Conference Proceedings. All proposals should be submitted by electronic mail to:\ricico2018@gmail.com\r Posters/Demos \rAll ICO 2021 Posters & Demos should be submitted by electronic mail to:\ricico2018@gmail.com\r Paper Submission\rWebsite: The submission Web page for ICO 2022 is\rhttps://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ico2022\r Submission guidelines\r- Papers should be in English.\r- Regular papers should be up to 10 pages in length.\r- Short papers should be up to 6 pages in length.\r- Previously published work may not be submitted, nor may the work be concurrently submitted to any other conference or journal. Such papers will be rejected without review.\r- Papers must be formatted using the SPRINGER Author\'s Kit.\r Publication\rThe accepted and reviewed papers of ICO 2022 will be published in the SPRINGER series "Lecture Notes in Networks and Systems". The proceedings are submitted for inclusion to the leading indexing services: SCOPUS, DBLP, Google Scholar, Thomson Scientific ISI Proceedings (CPCI), Elsevier Engineering Index, CrossRef, Web of Science, and Springer link.\r Best and high quality papers will be selected and reviewed by IPC in order to publish extended version of the paper in SCOPUS and WoS/ISI/ESCI journals.\rImportant Dates\rWorkshops/Tutorial proposals         10 June 2022\rFull paper/Poster/Demos    \t     24 July 2022\rAcceptance Notification              15 August 2022\rCamera ready deadline                10 September 2022\r Keynote Speakers \rProfessor Elmer P. title: b'PRELUDE 2022'
description: b'PeRvasive sEnsing and muLtimedia UnDErstanding'
Categories: b'computer vision' b'artifcial intelligence' b'pervasive computing' b'machine learning'
Call For Papers: b'\n**Co-located with:**\r SITIS 2022 - The 16th International Conference on Signal Image Technology & Internet based Systems\r19-21 October 2022 - Dijon, France\r *Scope*\r Advances in sensing and computing are currently impacting several sectors ranging from healthcare to cultural heritage, from smart cities to Industry 4.0. Information collected by sensors is propagated through internet-based systems and processed through the network\'s nodes. Mobile, edge and fog computing approaches have pushed advanced "smart" processing to the far edges of the network, while AI as a Service (AIaaS) paradigms abstract and virtualise intelligent services for deployment on the cloud. Multimedia information, including images, video streams, acoustic data and temporal series, are a relevant part of the data to be processed, analysed and understood for fully taking advantage of sensing resources.\r This workshop aims to shorten the gap between edge-based and cloud-based approaches for multimedia understanding by addressing the challenges and opportunities of the combined approach. Relevance will be given to transversal issues, such as those related to the privacy and security of such hybrid strategies, as well as to the quest for optimal and greener configuration of AI services towards sustainable and ethical use of computing resources. The co-existence of intelligent services distributed in a computational continuum made of heterogeneous nodes opens the possibilities of performing learning, including reinforcement learning, in such scenarios while coping with possible data shortages or faults of some nodes.\r Contributions addressing the above issues from a theoretical or simulation perspective are sought, while demonstrations in applicative scenarios will also be welcome.\r   *Topics* \r Topics for the workshop include, but are not limited to:\r \xe2\x80\xa2     Embedded systems and smart camera networks\r \xe2\x80\xa2     Mobile and pervasive computing\r \xe2\x80\xa2     Artificial intelligence in resource-constrained environments and on-device machine learning;\r \xe2\x80\xa2     Learning in multi-tier networked ecosystems\r \xe2\x80\xa2     Perception, sensing, and smart environment monitoring;\r \xe2\x80\xa2     Sensor fusion for environment perception;\r \xe2\x80\xa2     Video data representation, summarization, and visualization.\r \xe2\x80\xa2     Multi-view computer vision\r \xe2\x80\xa2     Learning in scarce data scenarios\r \xe2\x80\xa2     Reinforcement learning\r \xe2\x80\xa2     Fault-tolerant decision making\r \xe2\x80\xa2     Privacy and security aspects\r \xe2\x80\xa2     Explainability, trustworthiness and sustainability of pervasive AI paradigms\r \xe2\x80\xa2     Applications in\r o    Industry, smart cities and smart mobility\r o    Cultural heritage and tourism\r o    Healthcare\r   *Important dates*\r Submission deadline: July 15, 2022\r Acceptance/Reject notification: September 9, 2022\r Camera-ready: September 16, 2022\r Author Registration: September 16, 2022\r *Submission*\r Each submission should be at most 8 pages in total, including bibliography and well-marked appendices and must follow the IEEE double columns publication format available at:\r \xc2\xb7       Manuscript templates for IEEE conference proceedings\r Paper submission will only be online via: Easy Chair.\r All submitted papers will be carefully evaluated based on originality, significance, technical soundness, and clarity of expression by at least two reviewers. The organizers will examine the reviews and make final paper selections.\r *Publication*\r All the papers accepted for the workshop will be included in the conference proceedings. The proceedings will be published by IEEE Computer Society and referenced in IEEE Xplore Digital Library, Scopus, DBLP and major indexes.\r *Registration*\r At least one author of each accepted paper must register for the workshop. The workshop registration fee is determined by SITIS. A single registration for the workshop or the conference allows attending both events.\r *Contacts*\r giuseppericcardo.leone@cnr.it\rdavide.moroni@isti.cnr.it\rtoreyin@itu.edu.tr\rmaria.trocan@isep.fr\n\t'

Call For Papers: b"\nTaylor & Francis Group, CRC Press, Book Chapters\r Industry 4.0 Key Technological Advances and Design Principles in Engineering, Education, Business and Social Applications\r Edited by:\rDr. Ossama Embarak, Assistant Prof of Computer Information Sys, Higher Colleges of Technology (HCT), Fujairah, UAE\rDr. Sagaya Aurelia, CHRIST University, Bangalore India\r  To be published by CRC Press Taylor & Francis Group in 2022\r Chapter Proposal Submission Deadline: 10 June 2022\rProposals to be sent to: oembarak@hct.ac.ae :::  Sagaya.aurelia@christuniversity.in.\r The Prominent Topics to be covered in this book\r\xe2\x97\x8f IoT\r\xe2\x97\x8f Smart technologies\r\xe2\x97\x8f Smart transportation\r\xe2\x97\x8f Hybrid education\r\xe2\x97\x8f Successful practical education through Virtual labs\r\xe2\x97\x8f Use of Augmented reality and virtual reality in education\r\xe2\x97\x8f HR analysis\r\xe2\x97\x8f Cloud computing for Business\r\xe2\x97\x8f Big data technologies for business analysis \r\xe2\x97\x8f Innovative business model in future\r\xe2\x97\x8f Business Intelligence and data driven models-based application\r\xe2\x97\x8f Smart assistance systems for elder people\r\xe2\x97\x8f Smart cities based on immersive technologies\r\xe2\x97\x8f Data securities in IOT systems\r\xe2\x97\x8f M-Governance \r\xe2\x97\x8f Digitalization and centralised data management\r\xe2\x97\x8f Women safety toolkit \r\xe2\x97\x8f Human traffic avoidance system\r\xe2\x97\x8f Augmented reality and virtual reality-based news broadcasting system\r\xe2\x97\x8f Data manipulation and effective visualization technique for journalism industry\r\xe2\x97\x8f Effective weather forecasting system using IoT\r\xe2\x97\x8f Smart irrigation system \r\xe2\x97\x8f Effective water management system:  an eco-friendly model\r\xe2\x97\x8f Wearable technology-based safety tourism model\r\xe2\x97\x8f Security and privacy innovative methods \r\xe2\x97\x8f Wearable technologies for smart cities\r\xe2\x97\x8f IOB based system for health care\r\xe2\x97\x8f IOB based system for physically disabled people\r\xe2\x97\x8f Alternative route suggestive models\r\xe2\x97\x8f Emergency assistance system\r\xe2\x97\x8f Integration of theft and safety system\r\xe2\x97\x8f Smart monitoring model\r\xe2\x97\x8f Smart grids based smart cities\r\xe2\x97\x8f Innovative models for energy efficiency \r\xe2\x97\x8f Crop suggestion and predictive system \r\xe2\x97\x8f Climate forecasting model\r\xe2\x97\x8f Plant growth analysis model\r\xe2\x97\x8f Pesticides suggestion system: An automated model\r\xe2\x97\x8f Real time applications based on smart contracts\r\xe2\x97\x8f Proof of concept and proof of values for various services\r\xe2\x97\x8f Supply chain tracking systems \r\xe2\x97\x8f Other relevant topics\r - Submission Procedure\rAuthors and practitioners are invited to submit chapter proposals (approximately 150-200 words) clearly stating the proposed chapters' objective, scope, and structure - by the deadline mentioned above. Authors of accepted proposals will be notified within two weeks (in most cases) and given guidelines for full chapter preparation. Completed chapters should be approximately 10,000 words or 20-30 pages in length \xe2\x80\x93 longer chapters will also be acceptable. Full chapters will be reviewed following a double-blind peer-review process to ensure relevance, quality, originality, and high information content. CRC Press e-editorial discovery system will be used for most of the chapter development and submission processes. In the first instance, the chapter proposals, as WORD files, should sent to Sagaya.aurelia@christuniversity.in & oembarak@hct.ac.ae . \r  Important Dates\r\xe2\x97\x8f Notification of acceptance:  within 2 weeks of receipt of proposals\r\xe2\x97\x8f Full chapters due date: within 8 weeks of acceptance notification\r\xe2\x97\x8f Chapter reviews feedback:  2 Weeks of chapter due date\r\xe2\x97\x8f Revised chapters due date: 3 Weeks of review feedback\r For Enquiries:\rPlease get in touch with the editors: \r- Dr. Ossama Embarak at  oembarak@hct.ac.ae   (+971569023031)\r- Dr. Sagaya Aurelia at Sagaya.aurelia@christuniversity.in ( +91 9113264461)\r\n"

title: b'NWC  2022'
description: b' 6th Edition of Nursing World Conference'
locality: b'Hilton Garden Inn Lake Buena Vista/Orlan'
Categories: b'nursing events' b'nursing education' b'nursing conferences'
Call For Papers: b'\nAfter the grand success of six years of nursing conference, we solicit your gracious presence at the \xe2\x80\x9c6th edition of Nursing World Conference" (NWC 2022) which will be conducted during October 27-29, 2022 as a hybrid event at Orlando, Florida, USA and virtually. The conference will emphasize the theme \xe2\x80\x9cPioneering Spirit of Enriching the Nursing Profession.\xe2\x80\x9d\r Nursing is a dynamic field that evolves with time. We must make creative advances such as improving outpatient treatment, emphasizing ethnic accomplishment, improving patient health and experience, and expanding data analysis abilities among nurses to embrace new challenges and advance in your profession. Innovative ideas and intelligence have recently compelled all industries to lead the way for the creation of modern technical systems and software in the health-care industry. NWC 2022 will expose you to a variety of viewpoints as well as the most recent advancements and advances in the field of nursing.\r Distinguished speakers, researchers, scientists, academicians, nurses, nursing practitioners, healthcare professionals, midwives, clinicians, and industry giants from around the world will present outstanding research that informs improvements in nursing practice, education, and management at this conference. The global congress provides an opportunity to network with nursing colleagues, academicians, researchers, and clinical practitioners who will present evidence-based discoveries for improving patient care quality and safety, as well as healthcare delivery systems in global health. This conference provides a wonderful opportunity for all nursing professionals to learn about current trends in nursing practice around the world. Keynote addresses, oral presentations, poster sessions by young researchers and students, seminars, and networking opportunities are all part of this three-day event.\r This event aims to fill the void left by current worldwide academic and scientific efforts in response to many global concerns. Join us for a discussion of the most recent scientific data, to network with your peers, exchange skills and experiences, and empower yourself with the most up-to-date information to take your field and career to the next level. You will undoubtedly appreciate your participation in this meeting.\r Upcoming Nursing Conferences 2022 | Nursing World Conference | Nursing Conferences | Nursing Conference | Nursing Conference 2022 | Nursing Congress\n\t'

title: b'AIMS 2022'
description: b'2022 International Conference on AI & Mobile Services'
Categories: b'ai as a service' b'ai & machine-to-machine intera' b'ai & mobile health and service' b'ai & cyber-physical integratio'
Call For Papers: b'\nAIMS 2022 Call for Papers\r 2022 International Conference on AI & Mobile Services (AIMS 2022, http://www.ai1000.org/2022)\r Theme: Intelligent Services for Digital Transformation\r ==================================================================\r AIMS 2022 organizing committee invites you to participate in 2022 edition of AIMS, to be held on December 10 - 14, 2022.\r Regular Theme of AIMS 2022: Mobile and AI applications\r AI and mobile Internet hves revolutionized the computing paradigm in multiple domains, such as economics, finance, e-commence, etc. The 2022 International Conference on AI & Mobile Services (AIMS 2022) is the emerging theme-topic conference for the development, publication, discovery, orchestration, invocation, testing, delivery, certification, and management of artificial intellgence (AI) and mobile applications and services. Part of the SCF 2018, AIMS 2018 was successfully held on June 25 - June 30, 2018, Seattle, USA. Part of the SCF 2019, AIMS 2019 was successfully held on June 25 - 30, 2019, San Diego, USA. Part of the SCF 2020 and SCF 2021, AIMS 2020 and AIMS 2021 were successfully held over the Internet. In 2022, we will celebrate our 2022 version of gathering, to strive to advance the largest international professional forum on AI and mobile services.\r AIMS 2022 is a member of Services Conference Federation (SCF). SCF 2022 will have the following 10 collocated service-oriented sister conferences: 2022 International Conference on Web Services (ICWS 2022), 2022 International Conference on Cloud Computing (CLOUD 2022), 2022 International Conference on Services Computing (SCC 2022), 2022 International Conference on Big Data (BigData 2022), 2022 International Conference on AI & Mobile Services (AIMS 2022), and 2022 World Congress on Services (SERVICES 2022), 2022 International Conference on Internet of Things (ICIOT 2022), 2022 International conference on Cognitive Computing (ICCC 2022), 2022 International Conference on Edge Computing (EDGE 2022), and 2022 International Conference on Blockchain (ICBC 2022). \r The Hot Topics of AIMS 2022 invites you to submit practical innovations, solutions, and case studies which include but not limited to the following tracks.\r The technical program of AIMS 2022 will include a Research Track, an Application Track, and a Short Paper Track. The AIMS 2022 tracks seeks original, UNPUBLISHED research papers reporting substantive new work in various aspects of AI or mobile Internet-based services. Example topics include but not limited to Social Media Services, Emerging Mobile Applications, Mobile Intelligence, Innovations of Mobile AI, AI as a Service, Innovations of Mobile Operating System (e.g. Android, iOS, Windows Phone), Neural Networks, Learning Algorithms, Machine Learning, Traing Data Sets, AI Scenarios, AI Solutions, AI Supporting Infrastructure, Federated Learning, Interactive Voice Assistants, Robots, Android Application Innovations, IOS Application Innovations, and Huawei Mobile Services (HMS). Research Track papers MUST clearly indicate their contributions to the field of AI or mobile Internet-based technologies, applications and solutions. All papers MUST properly cite related work in the field, such as those published in the proceedings of ICWS, SCC, CLOUD, AIMS, SERVICES, BigData, ICIOT, ICBC, EDGE, APSCC, ECOWS, and related journals including STBD, JWSR, STSC, STCC, STIOT and IJBPIM (see Literature Recommendations page).\r All topics relevant to AI and mobile Internet services are of interest. AIMS 2022 will organize refereed paper reviews in the following 9 research areas (themes):\r - AI & Wireless & sensor networks\r- AI & Mobile & wearable computing\r- AI & Mobile enterprises & eCommerce\r- AI as a service\r- AI & Ubiquitous collaborative & social services\r- AI & Machine-to-machine Interaction\r- AI & Internet-of-things & edge computing\r- AI & Cyber-physical integration\r- AI & Bigdata analytics for mobility-enabled services\r- AI & Mobile Health and Services\r All submitted manuscripts will be peer-reviewed by at least 3 program committee members. Accepted and presented papers from all AIMS tracks will appear in the conference proceedings published by SCF. Extended versions of selected research track papers will be invited for potential publication in the Services Transactions on Services Computing (STSC), International Journal of Web Services Research (IJWSR), and International Journal of Business Process Integration and Management (IJBPIM). JWSR is indexed by SCI and EI.\r Submitted Research Track and Application Track manuscripts will be limited to 15 (LNCS Proceedings style) pages and REQUIRED to be formatted using the LNCS Proceedings template (WORD, Latex). Submitted Short Paper track manuscripts will be limited to 8 (LNCS Proceedings style) pages. The authors can extend a maximum of 2 pages for each paper but will have to pay extra fees for each extra page. Unformatted papers and papers beyond the maximum page limit may not be reviewed. Electronic submission of manuscripts (in PDF or Word format) is required. Detailed instructions for electronic paper preparation and submission, panel proposals, tutorial proposals, workshop proposals, and review process can be found at conference site.\r The Proceedings of AIMS 2022 will be published in the Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS) by Springer International Publishing AG. Currently the Abstracting and Indexing services covered by Springer\'s data feeds for LNCS proceedings include ISI Conference Proceedings Citation Index (included in Web of Science), Engineering Index EI (Compendex and Inspec databases), DBLP, Google Scholar, IO-Port, MathSciNet, Scopus, and ZBlMath. For all 10 collocated conferences of SCF 2022, the content of this proceedings volume will be made freely accessible to anyone in the Springer\'s digital library after four years upon publication.\r At least one author of each accepted paper is required to register to the conference and present the paper. One Best Paper award and one Best Student Paper award will be granted at AIMS 2022. The first author of the best student paper must be a full-time student.The Best Paper Awards will be sponsored by Springer, which is a leading global scientific, technical and medical portfolio, providing researchers in academia, scientific institutions and corporate R&D departments with quality content through innovative information, products and services.\r Manuscripts submitted to the Research Track focusing on application or solution descriptions may be recommended to the Application Track or other tracks for further consideration if the session slots are available. \r Author Guidelines and Templates\rSCF 2022 Guidelines & copyright forms\r Guidelines for proceedings authors (pdf)\rLNCS Copyright Form (pdf, 61kb)\rSCF 2022 Templates, sample files & useful links\r LaTeX2e Proceedings Templates (zip)\rMicrosoft Word Proceedings Templates (zip)\rMicrosoft Word 2003 Proceedings Templates (zip, 229kb)\rYour ORCID identifier\r Important Dates:\rResearch Track/Application Track/Short Paper Track:\rEarly-birds paper submission due: June 26, 2022\rReview comments to Early-birds paper submission: July 20, 2022\rRegular paper submission due: August 15, 2022\rReview comments to Regular paper submission: September 13, 2022\rCamera ready manuscripts due: September 20, 2022\rConference dates: December 10 - 14, 2022\r Submission System\r AIMS 2022 Research Track:\rhttps://www.edas.info/newPaper.php?c=29819&track=112941\r AIMS 2022 Application and Industry Track:\rhttps://www.edas.info/newPaper.php?c=29819&track=112940\r AIMS 2022 Short Paper Track:\rhttps://www.edas.info/newPaper.php?c=29819&track=112942\r SCF Policy\r Review Policy\r SCF Policy and professional ethics require that referees treat the contents of papers under review as privileged information not to be disclosed to others before publication. It is expected that no one with access to a paper under review will make any inappropriate use of the special knowledge, which that access provides. Contents of abstracts submitted to conference program committees should be regarded as privileged as well, and handled in the same manner. The Conference Publications Chair shall ensure that referees adhere to this practice.\r Organizers of SCF conferences are expected to provide an appropriate forum for the oral presentation and discussion of all accepted papers. An author, in offering a paper for presentation at a SCF conference, or accepting an invitation to present a paper, is expected to be present at the meeting to deliver the paper. In the event that circumstances unknown at the time of submission of a paper preclude its presentation by an author, the program chair should be informed on time, and appropriate substitute arrangements should be made. In some cases it may help reduce no-shows for the Conference to require advance registration together with the submission of the final manuscript.\r About the Services Society\r The Services Society (S2) is a non-profit professional organization that has been created to promote worldwide research and technical collaboration in services innovations among academia and industrial professionals. Its members are volunteers from industry and academia with common interests. S2 is registered in the USA as a "501(c) organization", which means that it is an American tax-exempt nonprofit organization. S2 collaborates with other professional organizations to sponsor or co-sponsor conferences and to promote an effective services curriculum in colleges and universities. The S2 initiates and promotes a "Services University" program worldwide to bridge the gap between industrial needs and university instruction. The Services Society has formed 10 Special Interest Groups (SIGs) to support technology and domain specific professional activities.\r SCF As A Platform\r As the founding member of the Services Conference Federation (SCF), the first International Conference on Web Services (ICWS) was held in June 2003 in Las Vegas, USA. Meanwhile, the First International Conference on Web Services - Europe 2003 (ICWS-Europe\'03) was held in Germany in Oct, 2003. ICWS-Europe\'03 is an extended event of the 2003 International Conference on Web Services (ICWS 2003) in Europe. In 2004, ICWS-Europe was changed to the European Conference on Web Services (ECOWS), which was held at Erfurt, Germany. SCF 2019 was held successfully in San Diego, USA. In 2020 and 2021, SCF were held as a fully virtual conference affected by the world-wide corona virus emergency. To celebrate its 20-year-old birthday, SCF 2022 will be held on December 10 - 14, 2022.\r The past 19 years, ICWS community has been expanded from Web engineering innovations to scientific research for the whole services industry. The service delivery platforms have been expanded to mobile platforms, Internet of Things, cloud computing, and edge computing. The services ecosystem is gradually enabled, value added, and intelligence embedded through enabling technologies such as big data, artificial intelligence, and cognitive computing. In the coming years, all the transactions with multiple parties involved will be transformed to blockchain.\r Based on the technology trends and best practices in the field, the Services Conference Federation (SCF) will continue serving as the conference umbrella\'s code name for all services-related conferences. SCF 2022 defines the future of New ABCDE (AI, Blockchain, Cloud, BigData & IOT) and Digital Transformation. We are very proud to announce that SCF 2022\'s 10 co-located theme topic conferences will all center around "services", while each focusing on exploring different themes (web-based services, cloud-based services, Big Data-based services, services innovation lifecycle, AI-driven ubiquitous services, blockchain driven trust service-ecosystems, industry-specific services and applications, and emerging service-oriented technologies).\r SCF 2022 Highlights:\r - Bigger Platform: The 10 collocated conferences (SCF 2022) get sponsorship from the Services Society which is the world-leading not-for-profits organization (501 c(3)) dedicated for serving more than 30,000 worldwide Services Computing researchers and practitioners. Bigger platform means bigger opportunities to all volunteers, authors and participants. Meanwhile, Springer provides sponsorship to best paper awards and other professional activities. All the 10 conference proceedings of SCF 2022 will be published by Springer and indexed in ISI Conference Proceedings Citation Index (included in Web of Science), Engineering Index EI (Compendex and Inspec databases), DBLP, Google Scholar, IO-Port, MathSciNet, Scopus, and ZBlMath.\r - Brighter Future: While celebrating 2022 version of ICWS, SCF 2022 highlights the 5th International Conference on Blockchain (ICBC 2022) to build the fundamental infrastructure for enabling secure and trusted services ecosystems. It will also lead our community members to create their own brighter future.\r - Better Model: SCF 2022 will continue to leverage the invented Conference Blockchain Model (CBM) to innovate the organizing practices for all the 10 theme conferences. Senior researchers in the field are welcome to submit proposals to serve as CBM Ambassador for an individual conference to start better interactions during your leadership practices for organizing SCF 2022.\r Look forward to your great contributions as a volunteer, author, and conference participant for the fast-growing worldwide services innovations community. If you would like to contribute to SCF 2022 as a leading volunteer or try the new Conference Blockchain Model. For other queries or questions, please feel free to visit our conference web sites and find contact information on SCF 2022.\r See you all on December 10 - 14, 2022.\r Contact Information\r If you have any questions or queries on AIMS 2022, please send email to aims AT ServicesSociety DOT org.\r ========================================================\r The Services Society Community Membership Program has been created to enhance its member\'s career as a services innovation professional.\r Please join the Services Society - Global Services Computing Community as a member at https://community.ServicesSociety.org for FREE. You can get access to the online community portal that supports community members to post messages, ask questions, answer questions, access online presentations by SCF 365 and conduct discussions, gain reputation scores, and grow membership grades (Member, Senior Member, Distinguished Member, Fellow, and Member of National Academy of Services (NASV)). Services Token Framework (Digital Currency) has been created for awarding Global Services Computing Community members for proactively participating in SCF as an organizing committee member, an author, a program committee member, a reviewer, a presenter, a conference participant, and a session chair as well as interacting with online community members through knowledge sharing. The Services Token can be used to redeem conference registration fees for SCF 2022. The goal of Services Society (S2) is to foster Building the Modern Services Industry through Services Computing technologies and business innovations.\r\n'

title: b'BigData  2022'

Categories: b'big data storage' b'big data applications' b'big data security and privacy' b'ig data analytics'
Call For Papers: b'\nBigData 2022 Call for Papers\r 2022 International Conference on Big Data (BigData 2022, http://www.bigdatacongress.org/2022/)\r Theme: Data Services for Digital Transformation\r ==================================================================\r BigData 2022 organizing committee invites you to participate in 2022 edition of BigData, to be held on December 10 - 14, 2022.\r As cloud computing turning computing and software into commodity services, everything as a service in other words, it leads to not only a technology revolution but also a business revolution. Insights and impacts of various types of services (infrastructure as a service, platform as a service, software as a service, business process as a service) have to be re-examined. The 2022 International Conference on Big Data (BigData 2022) aims to provide an international forum that formally explores various business insights of all kinds of value-added "services" based on data. Big Data is a key enabler of exploring business insights and economics of services.   Part of the SCF 2018, BigData 2018 was successfully held on June 25 - June 30, 2018, Seattle, USA. Part of the SCF 2019, BigData 2019 was successfully held on June 25 - 30, 2019, San Diego, USA. Part of the SCF 2020 and SCF 2021, BigData 2020 and BigData 2021 were successfully held over the Internet. In 2022, we will celebrate our 2022 version of gathering, to strive to advance the largest international professional forum on big data and all kinds of data services.\r BigData 2022 is a member of Services Conference Federation (SCF). SCF 2022 will have the following 10 collocated service-oriented sister conferences: 2022 International Conference on Web Services (ICWS 2022), 2022 International Conference on Cloud Computing (CLOUD 2022), 2022 International Conference on Services Computing (SCC 2022), 2022 International Conference on Big Data (BigData 2022), 2022 International Conference on AI & Mobile Services (AIMS 2022), and 2022 World Congress on Services (SERVICES 2022), 2022 International Conference on Internet of Things (ICIOT 2022), 2022 International Conference on Cognitive Computing (ICCC 2022), 2022 International Conference on Edge Computing (EDGE 2022), and 2022 International Conference on Blockchain (ICBC 2022).\r The technical program of BigData 2022 will include a Research Track, an Application Track, and a Short Paper Track. The BigData 2022 tracks seeks original, UNPUBLISHED research papers reporting substantive new work in various aspects of data-based services. Research Track papers MUST clearly indicate their contributions to the field of AI or mobile Internet-based technologies, applications and solutions. All papers MUST properly cite related work in the field, such as those published in the proceedings of ICWS, SCC, CLOUD, AIMS, SERVICES, BigData, ICIOT, ICBC, EDGE, APSCC, ECOWS, and related journals including STBD, JWSR, STSC, STCC, STIOT and IJBPIM (see Literature Recommendations page).\r In addition, two special tracks (Real-Time Big Data Analytics, and Big Data/Smart Cities) are included for BigData 2022. The special tracks will significantly expand the scope of BigData to include innovative contributions that cover the entire lifecycle of big data research: (1) vision papers to point out emerging challenges, (2) data sets and benchmarks that enable innovative big data research, (3) technical papers that describe significant research output, (4) applications and experience papers that apply and evaluate research methods and tools, and (5) survey papers that organize and summarize important research results and resources. Accordingly, these broadly defined contributions will be evaluated by PC members with special interest and expertise in each phase of the research lifecycle: vision papers, research contributions, applications and experiences, and enabling resources that include data sets, benchmarks, and surveys. \r Technical topics of interest include but are not limited to the following: \r - Big Data Storage\r- Big Data Indexing\r- Big Data Cleaning\r- Big Data Modeling\r- Big Data Analytics\r- Big Data Applications\r- Big Data Value Chain\r- 5G for Big Data\r- Big Data Security and Privacy\r- Data governance (Cooperation with DAMA China\xef\xbc\x89\rAll submissions must be original and previously unpublished papers. The submitted manuscripts will be peer-reviewed by at least 3 program committee members. Accepted and presented papers from all BigData tracks will appear in the conference proceedings. Selected research track papers will be invited for extension and revision for publication (after journal reviewing process) in special issues of the Services Transactions on Services Computing (STSC), Services Transanctions on Big Data (STBD), International Journal of Web Services Research (JWSR), and International Journal of Business Process Integration and Management (IJBPIM). JWSR is indexed by SCI and EI.\r Submitted Research Track and Application Track manuscripts will be limited to 15 (LNCS Proceedings style) pages and REQUIRED to be formatted using the LNCS Proceedings template (WORD, Latex). Submitted Short Paper track manuscripts will be limited to 8 (LNCS Proceedings style) pages. The authors can extend a maximum of 2 pages for each paper but will have to pay extra fees for each extra page. Unformatted papers and papers beyond the maximum page limit may not be reviewed. Electronic submission of manuscripts (in PDF or Word format) is required. Detailed instructions for electronic paper preparation and submission, panel proposals, tutorial proposals, workshop proposals, and review process can be found at conference web site.\r The Proceedings of Bigdata 2022 will be published in the Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS) by Springer International Publishing AG. Currently the Abstracting and Indexing services covered by Springer\'s data feeds for LNCS proceedings include ISI Conference Proceedings Citation Index (included in Web of Science), Engineering Index EI (Compendex and Inspec databases), DBLP, Google Scholar, IO-Port, MathSciNet, Scopus, and ZBlMath. For all 10 collocated conferences of SCF 2022, the content of this proceedings volume will be made freely accessible to anyone in the Springer\'s digital library after four years upon publication.\r For each paper, authors choose one appropriate track at submission time. However, the PC co-chairs may assign reviewers with appropriate expertise from all areas and tracks for each submission. In addition, if session slots are available, manuscripts submitted to one track may be recommended to another track for further consideration. If a paper is accepted by a track different from the original choice, the authors have the discretion to agree to the PC recommendation or to decline the paper acceptance.\r At least one author of each accepted paper is required to register for the conference and present the paper. One Best Paper award and one Best Student Paper award will be granted at BigData 2022. The first author of the best student paper must be a full-time student. The Best Paper Awards will be sponsored by Springer, which is a leading global scientific, technical and medical portfolio, providing researchers in academia, scientific institutions and corporate R&nbmpD departments with quality content through innovative information, products and services.\r Manuscripts submitted to the Research Track focusing on application or solution descriptions may be recommended to the Application Track or other tracks for further consideration if the session slots are available. \r Author Guidelines and Templates\rSCF 2022 Guidelines & copyright forms\r Guidelines for proceedings authors (pdf)\rLNCS Copyright Form (pdf, 61kb)\rSCF 2022 Templates, sample files & useful links\r LaTeX2e Proceedings Templates (zip)\rMicrosoft Word Proceedings Templates (zip)\rMicrosoft Word 2003 Proceedings Templates (zip, 229kb)\rYour ORCID identifier\r Important Dates:\rResearch Track/Application Track/Short Paper Track:\rEarly-birds paper submission due: June 26, 2022\rReview comments to Early-birds paper submission: July 20, 2022\rRegular paper submission due: August 15, 2022\rReview comments to Regular paper submission: September 13, 2022\rCamera ready manuscripts due: September 20, 2022\rConference dates: December 10 - 14, 2022\r Submission System\r BigData 2022 Research Track:\rhttps://www.edas.info/newPaper.php?c=29820&track=112945\r BigData 2022 Application and Industry Track:\rhttps://www.edas.info/newPaper.php?c=29820&track=112944\r BigData 2022 Short Paper Track:\rhttps://www.edas.info/newPaper.php?c=29820&track=112946\r SCF Policy\r Review Policy\r SCF Policy and professional ethics require that referees treat the contents of papers under review as privileged information not to be disclosed to others before publication. It is expected that no one with access to a paper under review will make any inappropriate use of the special knowledge, which that access provides. Contents of abstracts submitted to conference program committees should be regarded as privileged as well, and handled in the same manner. The Conference Publications Chair shall ensure that referees adhere to this practice.\r Organizers of SCF conferences are expected to provide an appropriate forum for the oral presentation and discussion of all accepted papers. An author, in offering a paper for presentation at a SCF conference, or accepting an invitation to present a paper, is expected to be present at the meeting to deliver the paper. Call For Papers: b'\nCLOUD 2022 Call for Papers\r 2022 International Conference on Cloud Computing (CLOUD 2022, http://www.thecloudcomputing.org/2022/)\r Theme: Cloud Services for Digital Transformation\r ==================================================================\r CLOUD 2022 organizing committee invites you to participate in 2022 edition of CLOUD, to be held on December 10 - 14, 2022.\r The International Conference on Cloud Computing (CLOUD) has been a prime international forum for both researchers and industry practitioners to exchange the latest fundamental advances in the state of the art and practice of cloud computing, identify emerging research topics, and define the future of cloud computing.\r Cloud Computing has become a scalable services consumption and delivery platform in the field of Services Computing. The technical foundations of Cloud Computing include Service-Oriented Architecture (SOA) and Virtualizations of hardware and software. The goal of Cloud Computing is to share resources among the cloud service consumers, cloud partners, and cloud vendors in the cloud value chain. The resource sharing at various levels results in various cloud offerings such as infrastructure cloud (e.g., hardware, IT infrastructure management), software cloud (e.g. SaaS focusing on middleware as a service, or traditional CRM as a service), application cloud (e.g., Application as a Service, UML modeling tools as a service, social network as a service), and business cloud (e.g., business process as a service).\r CLOUD 2022 is a member of Services Conference Federation (SCF). SCF 2022 will have the following 10 collocated service-oriented sister conferences: 2022 International Conference on Web Services (ICWS 2022), 2022 International Conference on Cloud Computing (CLOUD 2022), 2022 International Conference on Services Computing (SCC 2022), 2022 International Conference on Big Data (BigData 2022), 2022 International Conference on AI & Mobile Services (AIMS 2022), and 2022 World Congress on Services (SERVICES 2022), 2022 International Conference on Internet of Things (ICIOT 2022), 2022 International Conference on Cognitive Computing (ICCC 2022), 2022 International Conference on Edge Computing (EDGE 2022), and 2022 International Conference on Blockchain (ICBC 2022).\r The technical program of CLOUD 2022 will include a Research Track, an Application Track, and a Short Paper Track. The CLOUD 2022 tracks seeks original, UNPUBLISHED research papers reporting substantive new work in various aspects of cloud services. Research Track papers MUST clearly indicate their contributions to the field of Web-based services. All papers MUST properly cite related work in the field, such as those published in the proceedings of CLOUD, SCC, CLOUD, SERVICES, APSCC, ECOWS, and related journals including STBD, JWSR, STSC, STCC, STIOT and IJBPIM (see Literature Recommendations page).\r Contributions addressing all areas related to cloud computing technology, systems, applications and business innovations are solicited. CLOUD 2022 will organize refereed paper reviews in the following research areas:\r - Infrastructure As A Service (IaaS)\r- Platform As A Service (PaaS)\r- Software As A Service (SaaS)\r- Cloud Security and Privacy\r- Cloud Storage\r- Cloud Application Development\r- Cloud Performance Management\r- Industry-Specific Clouds\r- Business Models in Cloud\r- Serverless\r- 5G Cloud\r All submitted manuscripts will be peer-reviewed by at least 3 program committee members. Accepted and presented papers from all CLOUD tracks will appear in the conference proceedings. Extended versions of research track papers and selected application track papers will be invited for potential publication in the Services Transactions on Cloud Computing, and International Journal of Business Process Integration and Management (IJBPIM). JWSR is indexed by SCI and EI.\r Submitted Research Track and Application Track manuscripts will be limited to 15 (LNCS Proceedings style) pages and REQUIRED to be formatted using the LNCS Proceedings template (WORD, Latex). Submitted Short Paper track manuscripts will be limited to 8 (LNCS Proceedings style) pages. The authors can extend a maximum of 2 pages for each paper but will have to pay extra fees for each extra page. Unformatted papers and papers beyond the maximum page limit may not be reviewed. Electronic submission of manuscripts (in PDF or Word format) is required. Detailed instructions for electronic paper preparation and submission, panel proposals, tutorial proposals, workshop proposals, and review process can be found at conference site.\r The Proceedings of CLOUD 2022 will be published in the Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS) by Springer International Publishing AG. Currently the Abstracting and Indexing services covered by Springer\'s data feeds for LNCS proceedings include ISI Conference Proceedings Citation Index (included in Web of Science), Engineering Index EI (Compendex and Inspec databases), DBLP, Google Scholar, IO-Port, MathSciNet, Scopus, and ZBlMath. For all 10 collocated conferences of SCF 2022, the content of this proceedings volume will be made freely accessible to anyone in the Springer\'s digital library after four years upon publication.\r At least one author of each accepted paper is required to register to the conference and present the paper. One Best Paper award and one Best Student Paper award will be granted at CLOUD 2022. The Best Paper Awards will be sponsored by Springer, which is a leading global scientific, technical and medical portfolio, providing researchers in academia, scientific institutions and corporate R&D departments with quality content through innovative information, products and services. All the 10 conference proceedings of SCF 2022 will be published by Springer and indexed in ISI Conference Proceedings Citation Index (included in Web of Science), Engineering Index EI (Compendex and Inspec databases), DBLP, Google Scholar, IO-Port, MathSciNet, Scopus, and ZBlMath.\r - Brighter Future: While celebrating 2022 version of ICWS, SCF 2022 highlights the 5th International Conference on Blockchain (ICBC 2022) to build the fundamental infrastructure for enabling secure and trusted services ecosystems. It will also lead our community members to create their own brighter future.\r - Better Model: SCF 2022 will continue to leverage the invented Conference Blockchain Model (CBM) to innovate the organizing practices for all the 10 theme conferences. Senior researchers in the field are welcome to submit proposals to serve as CBM Ambassador for an individual conference to start better interactions during your leadership practices for organizing SCF 2022.\r Look forward to your great contributions as a volunteer, author, and conference participant for the fast-growing worldwide services innovations community. If you would like to contribute to SCF 2022 as a leading volunteer or try the new Conference Blockchain Model. For other queries or questions, please feel free to visit our conference web sites and find contact information on SCF 2022.\r See you all on December 10 - 14, 2022.\r Contact Information\r If you have any questions or queries on CLOUD 2022, please send email to cloud AT ServicesSociety DOT org.\r ========================================================\r The Services Society Community Membership Program has been created to enhance its member\'s career as a services innovation professional.\r Please join the Services Society - Global Services Computing Community as a member at https://community.ServicesSociety.org for FREE. You can get access to the online community portal that supports community members to post messages, ask questions, answer questions, access online presentations by SCF 365 and conduct discussions, gain reputation scores, and grow membership grades (Member, Senior Member, Distinguished Member, Fellow, and Member of National Academy of Services (NASV)). Services Token Framework (Digital Currency) has been created for awarding Global Services Computing Community members for proactively participating in SCF as an organizing committee member, an author, a program committee member, a reviewer, a presenter, a conference participant, and a session chair as well as interacting with online community members through knowledge sharing. The Services Token can be used to redeem conference registration fees for SCF 2022. The goal of Services Society (S2) is to foster Building the Modern Services Industry through Services Computing technologies and business innovations.\r\n'

Call For Papers: b'\nCALL FOR PAPERS - IWBIS 2022\r The International Workshop on Big Data and Information Security (IWBIS) provides an international forum designed to examine key critical innovations in the research of Big Data and Information Security areas. IWBIS thus invites scientists, engineers, and professionals alike to present their ideas and experiences related to Big Data and Information Security topics in the workshop.\r The 7th International Workshop on Big Data and Information Security (IWBIS 2022) will be held virtually on October 1st-3rd, 2022. Papers related to this conference theme including but not limited to the following technical areas:\r Big Data\rData capture and storage;\rBig data technologies / tools / (programming/development) tools;\rData visualization;\rMachine learning algorithms for big data;\rCloud computing platforms;\rDistributed file systems and databases;\rScalable storage systems;\rLarge-scale knowledge graphs.\rBig Data management;\rBig Data applications and implementations;\r Information Security\rAuthentication and access control;\rAnonymity and privacy;\rCryptographic protection;\rDigital forensics;\rHuman factors in security;\rMultimedia security;\rNetwork and mobile security;\rSecurity management and policies;\rHardware and physical security;\rCryptocurrency and Blockchain;\r [General Chairs]\rE. K. Budiardjo, Universitas Indonesia, ID\rM. Asvial, Republic of Indonesia Defense University, ID; Universitas Indonesia, ID\rW. Jatmiko, Universitas Indonesia, ID\r [Program Chairs]\rHendrana Tjahjadi, Republic of Indonesia Defense University, ID \rKurnianingsih, Politeknik Negeri Semarang, ID\rPanca Hadi Putra, Universitas Indonesia, ID\r [Hosts]\rUniversitas Indonesia\rRepublic of Indonesia Defense University\r [IMPORTANT DATES]\rFull Paper Submission: June 12th, 2022 (Round 1) | July 10th, 2022 (Round 2)\rNotification of Acceptance: July 3rd, 2022 (Round 1) | August 14th, 2022 (Round 2)  \rCamera Ready Paper Submission: August 15th, 2022 (Round 1) | September 4th, 2022 (Round 2)\rIWBIS 2022 Main Event: October 1st-3rd, 2022\r For More Information, visit:\rhttps://iwbis.cs.ui.ac.id\n\t'

title: b'EDGE  2022'
description: b'2022 International Conference on Edge Computing'
Categories: b'edge storage' b'edge ai' b'edge processing engine' b'5g and edge'
Call For Papers: b'\nEDGE 2022 Call for Papers\r 2022 International Conference on Edge Computing (EDGE 2022, http://theEdgeComputing.org/2022/)\r Theme: Edge Services for Digital Transformation\r ==================================================================\r EDGE 2022 organizing committee invites you to participate in 2022 edition of EDGE, to be held on December 10 - 14, 2022.\r The International Conference on Edge Computing (EDGE) aims to become a prime international forum for both researchers and industry practitioners to exchange the latest fundamental advances in the state of the art and practice of Edge computing, identify emerging research topics, and define the future of Edge computing. EDGE covers the localized resource sharing and connections with the cloud. Part of the SCF 2018, EDGE 2018 was successfully held on June 25 - June 30, 2018, Seattle, USA. Part of the SCF 2019, EDGE 2019 was successfully held on June 25 - 30, 2019, San Diego, USA. Part of the SCF 2020 and SCF 2021, EDGE 2020 and EDGE 2021 were successfully held over the Internet. In 2022, we will celebrate our 2022 version of gathering, to strive to advance the largest international professional forum on edge computing.\r EDGE 2022 is a member of Services Conference Federation (SCF). SCF 2022 will have the following 10 collocated service-oriented sister conferences: 2022 International Conference on Web Services (ICWS 2022), 2022 International Conference on Cloud Computing (CLOUD 2022), 2022 International Conference on Services Computing (SCC 2022), 2022 International Conference on Big Data (BigData 2022), 2022 International Conference on AI & Mobile Services (AIMS 2022), and 2022 World Congress on Services (SERVICES 2022), 2022 International Conference on Internet of Things (ICIOT 2022), 2022 International Conference on Cognitive Computing (ICCC 2022), 2022 International Conference on Edge Computing (EDGE 2022), and 2022 International Conference on Blockchain (ICBC 2022).\r The technical program of EDGE 2022 will include a Research Track, an Application Track, and a Short Paper Track. The EDGE 2022 tracks seeks original, UNPUBLISHED research papers reporting substantive new work in various aspects of edge infrastructure and applications. Research Track papers MUST clearly indicate their contributions to the field of edge computing technologies, applications and solutions. All papers MUST properly cite related work in the field, such as those published in the proceedings of ICWS, SCC, CLOUD, AIMS, SERVICES, BigData, ICIOT, ICBC, EDGE, APSCC, ECOWS, and related journals including STBD, JWSR, STSC, STCC, STIOT and IJBPIM (see Literature Recommendations page).\r The major topics of the conference are as follows: \r- Edge Storage\r- Edge Connections\r- Edge Analytics\r- Edge AI\r- Edge Processing Engine\r- Industry-Specific Edges\r- Edge Application Innovations\r- 5G and Edge\r- 5G and Cloud\r All submitted manuscripts will be peer-reviewed by at least 3 program committee members. Accepted and presented papers from all EDGE tracks will appear in the conference proceedings. \r Submitted Research Track and Application Track manuscripts will be limited to 15 (LNCS Proceedings style) pages and REQUIRED to be formatted using the LNCS Proceedings template (WORD, Latex). Submitted Short Paper track manuscripts will be limited to 8 (LNCS Proceedings style) pages. The authors can extend a maximum of 2 pages for each paper but will have to pay extra fees for each extra page. Unformatted papers and papers beyond the maximum page limit may not be reviewed. Electronic submission of manuscripts (in PDF or Word format) is required. Detailed instructions for electronic paper preparation and submission, panel proposals, tutorial proposals, workshop proposals, and review process can be found at http://theedgecomputing.org/2022/. \r The Proceedings of EDGE 2022 will be published in the Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS) by Springer International Publishing AG. Currently the Abstracting and Indexing services covered by Springer\'s data feeds for LNCS proceedings include ISI Conference Proceedings Citation Index (included in Web of Science), Engineering Index EI (Compendex and Inspec databases), DBLP, Google Scholar, IO-Port, MathSciNet, Scopus, and ZBlMath. For all 10 collocated conferences of SCF 2022, the content of this proceedings volume will be made freely accessible to anyone in the Springer\'s digital library after four years upon publication. \r At least one author of each accepted paper is required to register to the conference and present the paper. One Best Paper award and one Best Student Paper award will be granted at EDGE 2022. The first author of the best student paper must be a full-time student. The Best Paper Awards will be sponsored by Springer, which is a leading global scientific, technical and medical portfolio, providing researchers in academia, scientific institutions and corporate R&D departments with quality content through innovative information, products and services. \r Manuscripts submitted to the Research Track focusing on application or solution descriptions may be recommended to the Application Track or other tracks for further consideration if the session slots are available.\r Author Guidelines and Templates\rSCF 2022 Guidelines & copyright forms\r Guidelines for proceedings authors (pdf)\rLNCS Copyright Form (pdf, 61kb)\rSCF 2022 Templates, sample files & useful links\r LaTeX2e Proceedings Templates (zip)\rMicrosoft Word Proceedings Templates (zip)\rMicrosoft Word 2003 Proceedings Templates (zip, 229kb)\rYour ORCID identifier\r Important Dates:\rResearch Track/Application Track/Short Paper Track:\rEarly-birds paper submission due: June 26, 2022\rReview comments to Early-birds paper submission: July 20, 2022\rRegular paper submission due: August 15, 2022\rReview comments to Regular paper submission: September 13, 2022\rCamera ready manuscripts due: September 20, 2022\rConference dates: December 10 - 14, 2022\r Submission System \r EDGE 2022 Research Track:\rhttps://www.edas.info/newPaper.php?c=29822&track=112954\r EDGE 2022 Application and Industry Track:\rhttps://www.edas.info/newPaper.php?c=29822&track=112952\r EDGE  2022 Short Paper Track:\rhttps://www.edas.info/newPaper.php?c=29822&track=112955\r SCF Policy\r Review Policy\r SCF Policy and professional ethics require that referees treat the contents of papers under review as privileged information not to be disclosed to others before publication. It is expected that no one with access to a paper under review will make any inappropriate use of the special knowledge, which that access provides. Contents of abstracts submitted to conference program committees should be regarded as privileged as well, and handled in the same manner. The Conference Publications Chair shall ensure that referees adhere to this practice.\r Organizers of SCF conferences are expected to provide an appropriate forum for the oral presentation and discussion of all accepted papers. An author, in offering a paper for presentation at a SCF conference, or accepting an invitation to present a paper, is expected to be present at the meeting to deliver the paper. In the event that circumstances unknown at the time of submission of a paper preclude its presentation by an author, the program chair should be informed on time, and appropriate substitute arrangements should be made. In some cases it may help reduce no-shows for the Conference to require advance registration together with the submission of the final manuscript.\r About the Services Society\r The Services Society (S2) is a non-profit professional organization that has been created to promote worldwide research and technical collaboration in services innovations among academia and industrial professionals. Its members are volunteers from industry and academia with common interests. S2 is registered in the USA as a "501(c) organization", which means that it is an American tax-exempt nonprofit organization. S2 collaborates with other professional organizations to sponsor or co-sponsor conferences and to promote an effective services curriculum in colleges and universities. The S2 initiates and promotes a "Services University" program worldwide to bridge the gap between industrial needs and university instruction. The Services Society has formed 10 Special Interest Groups (SIGs) to support technology and domain specific professional activities.\r SCF As A Platform\r As the founding member of the Services Conference Federation (SCF), the first International Conference on Web Services (ICWS) was held in June 2003 in Las Vegas, USA. Meanwhile, the First International Conference on Web Services - Europe 2003 (ICWS-Europe\'03) was held in Germany in Oct, 2003. ICWS-Europe\'03 is an extended event of the 2003 International Conference on Web Services (ICWS 2003) in Europe. In 2004, ICWS-Europe was changed to the European Conference on Web Services (ECOWS), which was held at Erfurt, Germany. SCF 2019 was held successfully in San Diego, USA. In 2020 and 2021, SCF were held as a fully virtual conference affected by the world-wide corona virus emergency. To celebrate its 20-year-old birthday, SCF 2022 will be held on December 10 - 14, 2022.\r The past 19 years, ICWS community has been expanded from Web engineering innovations to scientific research for the whole services industry. The service delivery platforms have been expanded to mobile platforms, Internet of Things, cloud computing, and edge computing. The services ecosystem is gradually enabled, value added, and intelligence embedded through enabling technologies such as big data, artificial intelligence, and cognitive computing. In the coming years, all the transactions with multiple parties involved will be transformed to blockchain.\r Based on the technology trends and best practices in the field, the Services Conference Federation (SCF) will continue serving as the conference umbrella\'s code name for all services-related conferences. SCF 2022 defines the future of New ABCDE (AI, Blockchain, Cloud, BigData & IOT) and Digital Transformation. We are very proud to announce that SCF 2022\'s 10 co-located theme topic conferences will all center around "services", while each focusing on exploring different themes (web-based services, cloud-based services, Big Data-based services, services innovation lifecycle, AI-driven ubiquitous services, blockchain driven trust service-ecosystems, industry-specific services and applications, and emerging service-oriented technologies).\r SCF 2022 Highlights:\r - Bigger Platform: The 10 collocated conferences (SCF 2022) get sponsorship from the Services Society which is the world-leading not-for-profits organization (501 c(3)) dedicated for serving more than 30,000 worldwide Services Computing researchers and practitioners. Bigger platform means bigger opportunities to all volunteers, authors and participants. Meanwhile, Springer provides sponsorship to best paper awards and other professional activities. All the 10 conference proceedings of SCF 2022 will be published by Springer and indexed in ISI Conference Proceedings Citation Index (included in Web of Science), Engineering Index EI (Compendex and Inspec databases), DBLP, Google Scholar, IO-Port, MathSciNet, Scopus, and ZBlMath.\r - Brighter Future: While celebrating 2022 version of ICWS, SCF 2022 highlights the 5th International Conference on Blockchain (ICBC 2022) to build the fundamental infrastructure for enabling secure and trusted services ecosystems. It will also lead our community members to create their own brighter future.\r - Better Model: SCF 2022 will continue to leverage the invented Conference Blockchain Model (CBM) to innovate the organizing practices for all the 10 theme conferences. Senior researchers in the field are welcome to submit proposals to serve as CBM Ambassador for an individual conference to start better interactions during your leadership practices for organizing SCF 2022.\r Look forward to your great contributions as a volunteer, author, and conference participant for the fast-growing worldwide services innovations community. If you would like to contribute to SCF 2022 as a leading volunteer or try the new Conference Blockchain Model. For other queries or questions, please feel free to visit our conference web sites and find contact information on SCF 2022.\r See you all on December 10 - 14, 2022.\r Contact Information\r If you have any questions or queries on EDGE 2022, please send email to edge AT ServicesSociety DOT org.\r ========================================================\r The Services Society Community Membership Program has been created to enhance its member\'s career as a services innovation professional.\r Please join the Services Society - Global Services Computing Community as a member at https://community.ServicesSociety.org for FREE. You can get access to the online community portal that supports community members to post messages, ask questions, answer questions, access online presentations by SCF 365 and conduct discussions, gain reputation scores, and grow membership grades (Member, Senior Member, Distinguished Member, Fellow, and Member of National Academy of Services (NASV)). Services Token Framework (Digital Currency) has been created for awarding Global Services Computing Community members for proactively participating in SCF as an organizing committee member, an author, a program committee member, a reviewer, a presenter, a conference participant, and a session chair as well as interacting with online community members through knowledge sharing. The Services Token can be used to redeem conference registration fees for SCF 2022. The goal of Services Society (S2) is to foster Building the Modern Services Industry through Services Computing technologies and business innovations.\r \n'

Call For Papers: b'\nICBC 2022 Call for Papers\r 2022 International Conference on Blockchain (ICBC 2022, http://blockchain1000.org/2022/)\r Theme: Blockchain for Digital Transformation\r ==================================================================\r ICBC 2022 program committee invites you to participate in 2022 edition of ICBC, to be held on December 10 - 14.\r From the invention of blockchain (BC) concepts in 2008, with the development of distributed data storage, point-to-point transmission, consensus mechanism, encryption algorithm and so on, the blockchain technology has been paid more and more attentions by all countries. At present, the application of blockchain has been extended from the financial field to the Internet of Things, intelligent manufacturing, supply chain management, and many other fields. The blockchain is creating a new technological innovation and industrial change on a global scale. We indeed need creative thinking, long-term visions, and innovative methodologies to respond to such a change.  The first International Conference on Blockchain (ICBC 2018) was created in 2018 to promote research and application innovations around the world in the field of blockchain. Part of the SCF 2018, ICBC 2018 was successfully held on June 25 - June 30, 2018, Seattle, USA. Part of the SCF 2019, ICBC 2019 was successfully held on June 25 - 30, 2019, San Diego, USA. Part of the SCF 2020 and SCF 2021, ICBC 2020 and ICBC 2021 were successfully held over the Internet. In 2022, we will celebrate our 2022 version of gathering, to strive to advance the largest international professional forum on blockchain.\r ICBC 2022 is a member of Services Conference Federation (SCF). SCF 2022 will have the following 10 collocated service-oriented sister conferences: 2022 International Conference on Web Services (ICWS 2022), 2022 International Conference on Cloud Computing (CLOUD 2022), 2022 International Conference on Services Computing (SCC 2022), 2022 International Conference on Big Data (BigData 2022), 2022 International Conference on AI & Mobile Services (AIMS 2022), and 2022 World Congress on Services (SERVICES 2022), 2022 International Conference on Internet of Things (ICIOT 2022), 2022 International Conference on Cognitive Computing (ICCC 2022), 2022 International Conference on Edge Computing (EDGE 2022), and 2022 International Conference on Blockchain (ICBC 2022). The 10 co-located theme topic conferences will all center around "services," while each focusing on exploring different themes (web-based services, cloud-based services, Big Data-based services, services innovation lifecycle, AI-driven ubiquitous services, and industry-specific services as well as emerging service-oriented technologies).\r ICBC 2022 covers state-of-the-art technologies and best practices of blockchain, as well as emerging standards and research topics which would define the future of blockchain. Topics of interest to include, but are not limited to, the following:\r - Development Platforms for Blockchain\r- Fundamental Research for Blockchain\r- Blockchain Standard Design\r- Blockchain and Cloud Computing\r- Blockchain and Big Data\r- Blockchain and Internet of Things\r- Blockchain and Next Generation Internet\r- Blockchain and Encryption Algorithm\r- Blockchain Platforms for Applications\r- Blockchain Application Reference Architectures and Instances\r- Blockchain Application in Financial Services: Digital currency, Asset digitization, Smart securities\r- Blockchain Application in Social Management: Digital Identity, Public Utilities, Public welfare, Government management\r- Blockchain Application in Supply Chain Management: Anti-fake and Traceability, Smart contract, Logistics management\r- Blockchain Application in Enterprise Management: Financial Management, Business management process, Data management\r- Blockchain Application in Intelligent Manufacturing: Industrial Internet of Things, Intelligent manufacture and management\r- Blockchain Application in Personal Service: Copyright protection, Legal service, Education service\r- Other Block Chain Applications and Solutions\r- Blockchain business models and innovations\r All submitted manuscripts will be peer-reviewed by at least 3 program committee members. All the 10 conference proceedings of SCF 2022 will be published by Springer and indexed in ISI Conference Proceedings Citation Index (included in Web of Science), Engineering Index EI (Compendex and Inspec databases), DBLP, Google Scholar, IO-Port, MathSciNet, Scopus, and ZBlMath.\r - Brighter Future: While celebrating 2022 version of ICWS, SCF 2022 highlights the 5th International Conference on Blockchain (ICBC 2022) to build the fundamental infrastructure for enabling secure and trusted services ecosystems. It will also lead our community members to create their own brighter future.\r - Better Model: SCF 2022 will continue to leverage the invented Conference Blockchain Model (CBM) to innovate the organizing practices for all the 10 theme conferences. Senior researchers in the field are welcome to submit proposals to serve as CBM Ambassador for an individual conference to start better interactions during your leadership practices for organizing SCF 2022.\r Look forward to your great contributions as a volunteer, author, and conference participant for the fast-growing worldwide services innovations community. If you would like to contribute to SCF 2022 as a leading volunteer or try the new Conference Blockchain Model. For other queries or questions, please feel free to visit our conference web sites and find contact information on SCF 2022.\r See you all on December 10 - 14, 2022.\r Contact Information\r If you have any questions or queries on ICBC 2022, please send email to icbc AT ServicesSociety DOT org.\r ========================================================\r The Services Society Community Membership Program has been created to enhance its member\'s career as a services innovation professional.\r Please join the Services Society - Global Services Computing Community as a member at https://community.ServicesSociety.org for FREE. You can get access to the online community portal that supports community members to post messages, ask questions, answer questions, access online presentations by SCF 365 and conduct discussions, gain reputation scores, and grow membership grades (Member, Senior Member, Distinguished Member, Fellow, and Member of National Academy of Services (NASV)). Services Token Framework (Digital Currency) has been created for awarding Global Services Computing Community members for proactively participating in SCF as an organizing committee member, an author, a program committee member, a reviewer, a presenter, a conference participant, and a session chair as well as interacting with online community members through knowledge sharing. The Services Token can be used to redeem conference registration fees for SCF 2022. The goal of Services Society (S2) is to foster Building the Modern Services Industry through Services Computing technologies and business innovations.\r\n'
