Categories: b'cognitive sensing' b'cognitive touch' b'cognitive solutions' b'cognitive models'
Call For Papers: b'\nICCC 2022 Call for Papers\r 2022 International Conference on Cognitive Computing (ICCC 2022, http://www.thecognitivecomputing.org/2022/)\r Theme: Cognitive Services for Digital Transformation\r ==================================================================\r ICCC 2022 organizing committee invites you to participate in 2022 edition of ICCC, to be held on December 10 - 14, 2022.\r The International Conference on Cognitive Computing combines technical aspects of cognitive computing with service computing, focusing on all of cognition, computation, and business to understand and engineer effective value-creation. ICCC aims to cover all acts or processes of knowing, perceiving, judging, reasoning, and associating based on computing platforms and algorithms. ICCC calls the entire services computing community to work toward realizing "Sensing Intelligence as a Service". Part of the SCF 2018, ICCC 2018 was successfully held on June 25 - June 30, 2018, Seattle, USA. Part of the SCF 2019, ICCC 2019 was successfully held on June 25 - 30, 2019, San Diego, USA. Part of the SCF 2020 and SCF 2021, ICCC 2020 and ICCC 2021 were successfully held over the Internet. In 2022, we will celebrate our 2022 version of gathering, to strive to advance the largest international professional forum on cognitive services.\r ICCC 2022 is a member of Services Conference Federation (SCF). SCF 2022 will have the following 10 collocated service-oriented sister conferences: 2022 International Conference on Web Services (ICWS 2022), 2022 International Conference on Cloud Computing (CLOUD 2022), 2022 International Conference on Services Computing (SCC 2022), 2022 International Conference on Big Data (BigData 2022), 2022 International Conference on AI & Mobile Services (AIMS 2022), and 2022 World Congress on Services (SERVICES 2022), 2022 International Conference on Internet of Things (ICIOT 2022), 2022 International Conference on Cognitive Computing (ICCC 2022), 2022 International Conference on Edge Computing (EDGE 2022), and 2022 International Conference on Blockchain (ICBC 2022).\r Topics of interest to include, but are not limited to, the following:\r - Cognitive Sensing\r- Cognitive Touch\r- Cognitive Models\r- Sensing Intelligence\r- Internet of Touch\r- Internet of Brain\r- Cognitive Memory\r- Cogntive Hardware\r- Cognitive Platforms\r- Cognitive Solutions\r- Cognitive 5G\r- Cognitive Cloud\r All submitted manuscripts will be peer-reviewed by at least 3 program committee members. Accepted and presented papers from all ICCC tracks will appear in the conference proceedings.\r Submitted Research Track and Application Track manuscripts will be limited to 15 (LNCS Proceedings style) pages and REQUIRED to be formatted using the LNCS Proceedings template (WORD, Latex). Submitted Short Paper track manuscripts will be limited to 8 (LNCS Proceedings style) pages. The authors can extend a maximum of 2 pages for each paper but will have to pay extra fees for each extra page. Unformatted papers and papers beyond the maximum page limit may not be reviewed. Electronic submission of manuscripts (in PDF or Word format) is required. Detailed instructions for electronic paper preparation and submission, panel proposals, tutorial proposals, workshop proposals, and review process can be found at http://www.thefogcomputing.org/2022/.\r The Proceedings of ICCC 2022 will be published in the Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS) by Springer International Publishing AG. Currently the Abstracting and Indexing services covered by Springer\'s data feeds for LNCS proceedings include ISI Conference Proceedings Citation Index (included in Web of Science), Engineering Index EI (Compendex and Inspec databases), DBLP, Google Scholar, IO-Port, MathSciNet, Scopus, and ZBlMath. For all 10 collocated conferences of SCF 2022, the content of this proceedings volume will be made freely accessible to anyone in the Springer\'s digital library after four years upon publication.\r At least one author of each accepted paper is required to register to the conference and present the paper. One Best Paper award and one Best Student Paper award will be granted at ICCC 2022. The first author of the best student paper must be a full-time student. The Best Paper Awards will be sponsored by Springer, which is a leading global scientific, technical and medical portfolio, providing researchers in academia, scientific institutions and corporate R&D departments with quality content through innovative information, products and services.\r Manuscripts submitted to the Research Track focusing on application or solution descriptions may be recommended to the Application Track or other tracks for further consideration if the session slots are available.\r Author Guidelines and Templates\rSCF 2022 Guidelines & copyright forms\r Guidelines for proceedings authors (pdf)\rLNCS Copyright Form (pdf, 61kb)\rSCF 2022 Templates, sample files & useful links\r LaTeX2e Proceedings Templates (zip)\rMicrosoft Word Proceedings Templates (zip)\rMicrosoft Word 2003 Proceedings Templates (zip, 229kb)\rYour ORCID identifier\r Important Dates:\rResearch Track/Application Track/Short Paper Track:\rEarly-birds paper submission due: June 26, 2022\rReview comments to Early-birds paper submission: July 20, 2022\rRegular paper submission due: August 15, 2022\rReview comments to Regular paper submission: September 13, 2022\rCamera ready manuscripts due: September 20, 2022\rConference dates: December 10 - 14, 2022\r Submission System\r ICCC 2022 Research Track:\rhttps://www.edas.info/newPaper.php?c=29824&track=112961\r ICCC 2022 Application and Industry Track:\rhttps://www.edas.info/newPaper.php?c=29824&track=112960\r ICCC  2022 Short Paper Track:\rhttps://www.edas.info/newPaper.php?c=29824&track=112962\r SCF Policy\r Review Policy\r SCF Policy and professional ethics require that referees treat the contents of papers under review as privileged information not to be disclosed to others before publication. It is expected that no one with access to a paper under review will make any inappropriate use of the special knowledge, which that access provides. Contents of abstracts submitted to conference program committees should be regarded as privileged as well, and handled in the same manner. The Conference Publications Chair shall ensure that referees adhere to this practice.\r Organizers of SCF conferences are expected to provide an appropriate forum for the oral presentation and discussion of all accepted papers. An author, in offering a paper for presentation at a SCF conference, or accepting an invitation to present a paper, is expected to be present at the meeting to deliver the paper. In the event that circumstances unknown at the time of submission of a paper preclude its presentation by an author, the program chair should be informed on time, and appropriate substitute arrangements should be made. In some cases it may help reduce no-shows for the Conference to require advance registration together with the submission of the final manuscript.\r About the Services Society\r The Services Society (S2) is a non-profit professional organization that has been created to promote worldwide research and technical collaboration in services innovations among academia and industrial professionals. Its members are volunteers from industry and academia with common interests. S2 is registered in the USA as a "501(c) organization", which means that it is an American tax-exempt nonprofit organization. S2 collaborates with other professional organizations to sponsor or co-sponsor conferences and to promote an effective services curriculum in colleges and universities. The S2 initiates and promotes a "Services University" program worldwide to bridge the gap between industrial needs and university instruction. The Services Society has formed 10 Special Interest Groups (SIGs) to support technology and domain specific professional activities.\r SCF As A Platform\r As the founding member of the Services Conference Federation (SCF), the first International Conference on Web Services (ICWS) was held in June 2003 in Las Vegas, USA. Meanwhile, the First International Conference on Web Services - Europe 2003 (ICWS-Europe\'03) was held in Germany in Oct, 2003. ICWS-Europe\'03 is an extended event of the 2003 International Conference on Web Services (ICWS 2003) in Europe. In 2004, ICWS-Europe was changed to the European Conference on Web Services (ECOWS), which was held at Erfurt, Germany. SCF 2019 was held successfully in San Diego, USA. In 2020 and 2021, SCF were held as a fully virtual conference affected by the world-wide corona virus emergency. To celebrate its 20-year-old birthday, SCF 2022 will be held on December 10 - 14, 2022.\r The past 19 years, ICWS community has been expanded from Web engineering innovations to scientific research for the whole services industry. The service delivery platforms have been expanded to mobile platforms, Internet of Things, cloud computing, and edge computing. The services ecosystem is gradually enabled, value added, and intelligence embedded through enabling technologies such as big data, artificial intelligence, and cognitive computing. In the coming years, all the transactions with multiple parties involved will be transformed to blockchain.\r Based on the technology trends and best practices in the field, the Services Conference Federation (SCF) will continue serving as the conference umbrella\'s code name for all services-related conferences. SCF 2022 defines the future of New ABCDE (AI, Blockchain, Cloud, BigData & IOT) and Digital Transformation. We are very proud to announce that SCF 2022\'s 10 co-located theme topic conferences will all center around "services", while each focusing on exploring different themes (web-based services, cloud-based services, Big Data-based services, services innovation lifecycle, AI-driven ubiquitous services, blockchain driven trust service-ecosystems, industry-specific services and applications, and emerging service-oriented technologies).\r SCF 2022 Highlights:\r - Bigger Platform: The 10 collocated conferences (SCF 2022) get sponsorship from the Services Society which is the world-leading not-for-profits organization (501 c(3)) dedicated for serving more than 30,000 worldwide Services Computing researchers and practitioners. Bigger platform means bigger opportunities to all volunteers, authors and participants. Meanwhile, Springer provides sponsorship to best paper awards and other professional activities. All the 10 conference proceedings of SCF 2022 will be published by Springer and indexed in ISI Conference Proceedings Citation Index (included in Web of Science), Engineering Index EI (Compendex and Inspec databases), DBLP, Google Scholar, IO-Port, MathSciNet, Scopus, and ZBlMath.\r - Brighter Future: While celebrating 2022 version of ICWS, SCF 2022 highlights the 5th International Conference on Blockchain (ICBC 2022) to build the fundamental infrastructure for enabling secure and trusted services ecosystems. It will also lead our community members to create their own brighter future.\r - Better Model: SCF 2022 will continue to leverage the invented Conference Blockchain Model (CBM) to innovate the organizing practices for all the 10 theme conferences. Senior researchers in the field are welcome to submit proposals to serve as CBM Ambassador for an individual conference to start better interactions during your leadership practices for organizing SCF 2022.\r Look forward to your great contributions as a volunteer, author, and conference participant for the fast-growing worldwide services innovations community. If you would like to contribute to SCF 2022 as a leading volunteer or try the new Conference Blockchain Model. For other queries or questions, please feel free to visit our conference web sites and find contact information on SCF 2022.\r See you all on December 10 - 14, 2022.\r Contact Information\r If you have any questions or queries on ICCC 2022, please send email to iccc AT ServicesSociety DOT org.\r ========================================================\r The Services Society Community Membership Program has been created to enhance its member\'s career as a services innovation professional.\r Please join the Services Society - Global Services Computing Community as a member at https://community.ServicesSociety.org for FREE. You can get access to the online community portal that supports community members to post messages, ask questions, answer questions, access online presentations by SCF 365 and conduct discussions, gain reputation scores, and grow membership grades (Member, Senior Member, Distinguished Member, Fellow, and Member of National Academy of Services (NASV)). Services Token Framework (Digital Currency) has been created for awarding Global Services Computing Community members for proactively participating in SCF as an organizing committee member, an author, a program committee member, a reviewer, a presenter, a conference participant, and a session chair as well as interacting with online community members through knowledge sharing. The Services Token can be used to redeem conference registration fees for SCF 2022. The goal of Services Society (S2) is to foster Building the Modern Services Industry through Services Computing technologies and business innovations.\r\n'

Call For Papers: b'\nICIOT 2022 Call for Papers\r 2022 International Conference on Internet of Things (ICIOT 2022, http://www.iciot.org/2022/)\r Theme: IOT Services for Digital Transformation\r ==================================================================\r ICIOT 2022 organizing committee invites you to participate in 2022 edition of ICIOT, to be held on December 10 - 14, 2022.\r With the rapid advancements of mobile Internet, cloud computing and big data, device-centric traditional Internet of Things (IoT) is now moving into a new era which is termed as Internet of Things Services (IOTS). In this era, sensors and other types of sensing devices, wired and wireless networks, platforms and tools, data processing/visualization/analysis and integration engines, and other components of traditional IoT are interconnected through innovative services to realize the value of connected things, people, and virtual Internet spaces. The way of building new IoT applications is changing. We indeed need creative thinking, long-term visions, and innovative methodologies to respond to such a change. The First International Conference on Internet of Things Services (ICIOT 2016) was created to continue promote research and application innovations in the field of internet of things around the world. Part of the SCF 2018, ICIOT 2018 was successfully held on June 25 - June 30, 2018, Seattle, USA. Part of the SCF 2019, ICIOT 2019 was successfully held on June 25 - 30, 2019, San Diego, USA. Part of the SCF 2020 and SCF 2021, ICIOT 2020 and ICIOT 2021 were successfully held on September 18 - 20, 2020 over the Internet. In 2022, we will celebrate our 2022 version of gathering, to strive to advance the largest international professional forum on IOT services.\r ICIOT 2022 is a member of Services Conference Federation (SCF). SCF 2022 will have the following 10 collocated service-oriented sister conferences: 2022 International Conference on Web Services (ICWS 2022), 2022 International Conference on Cloud Computing (CLOUD 2022), 2022 International Conference on Services Computing (SCC 2022), 2022 International Conference on Big Data (BigData 2022), 2022 International Conference on AI & Mobile Services (AIMS 2022), and 2022 World Congress on Services (SERVICES 2022), 2022 International Conference on Internet of Things (ICIOT 2022), 2022 International conference on Cognitive Computing (ICCC 2022), 2022 International Conference on Edge Computing (EDGE 2022), and 2022 International Conference on Blockchain (ICBC 2022). \r 2022 International Conference on Internet of Things (ICIOT 2022) covers state-of-the-art technologies and best practices of Internet of Things, as well as emerging standards and research topics which would define the future of Internet of Things.\r Topics of interest to include, but are not limited to, the following:\r - IoT Device Innovations\r- IoT Services\r- Industrial IoT\r- 5G for IoT\r- IFTTT Solutions for IoT\r- IoT Applications\r All submitted manuscripts will be peer-reviewed by at least 3 program committee members. Accepted and presented papers from all ICIOT tracks will appear in the conference proceedings.\r Submitted Research Track and Application Track manuscripts will be limited to 15 (LNCS Proceedings style) pages and REQUIRED to be formatted using the LNCS Proceedings template (WORD, Latex). Submitted Short Paper track manuscripts will be limited to 8 (LNCS Proceedings style) pages. The authors can extend a maximum of 2 pages for each paper but will have to pay extra fees for each extra page. Unformatted papers and papers beyond the maximum page limit may not be reviewed.\r The Proceedings of ICIOT 2022 will be published in the Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS) by Springer International Publishing AG. Currently the Abstracting and Indexing services covered by Springer\'s data feeds for LNCS proceedings include ISI Conference Proceedings Citation Index (included in Web of Science), Engineering Index EI (Compendex and Inspec databases), DBLP, Google Scholar, IO-Port, MathSciNet, Scopus, and ZBlMath. For all 10 collocated conferences of SCF 2022, the content of this proceedings volume will be made freely accessible to anyone in the Springer\'s digital library after four years upon publication of the Proceedings of ICIOT 2022.\r At least one author of each accepted paper is required to register to the conference and present the paper. One Best Paper award and one Best Student Paper award will be granted at ICIOT 2022. The first author of the best student paper must be a full-time student. The Best Paper Awards will be sponsored by Springer, which is a leading global scientific, technical and medical portfolio, providing researchers in academia, scientific institutions and corporate R&D departments with quality content through innovative information, products and services. Manuscripts submitted to the Research Track focusing on application or solution descriptions may be recommended to the Application Track or other tracks for further consideration if the session slots are available.\r Manuscripts submitted to the Research Track focusing on application or solution descriptions may be recommended to the Application Track or other tracks for further consideration if the session slots are available. \r Author Guidelines and Templates\rSCF 2022 Guidelines & copyright forms\r Guidelines for proceedings authors (pdf)\rLNCS Copyright Form (pdf, 61kb)\rSCF 2022 Templates, sample files & useful links\r LaTeX2e Proceedings Templates (zip)\rMicrosoft Word Proceedings Templates (zip)\rMicrosoft Word 2003 Proceedings Templates (zip, 229kb)\rYour ORCID identifier\r Important Dates:\rResearch Track/Application Track/Short Paper Track:\rEarly-birds paper submission due: June 26, 2022\rReview comments to Early-birds paper submission: July 20, 2022\rRegular paper submission due: August 15, 2022\rReview comments to Regular paper submission: September 13, 2022\rCamera ready manuscripts due: September 20, 2022\rConference dates: December 10 - 14, 2022\r Submission System\r ICIOT 2022 Research Track:\rhttps://www.edas.info/newPaper.php?c=29825&track=112966\r ICIOT 2022 Application and Industry Track:\rhttps://www.edas.info/newPaper.php?c=29825&track=112964\r ICIOT 2022 Short Paper Track:\rhttps://www.edas.info/newPaper.php?c=29825&track=112967\r SCF Policy\r Review Policy\r SCF Policy and professional ethics require that referees treat the contents of papers under review as privileged information not to be disclosed to others before publication. Call For Papers: b'\nFull name: ACM--2022 4th International Conference on E-Business and E-Commerce Engineering (EBEE 2022)\rAbbreviation: EBEE 2022\rTime: December 14-16, 2022\rPlace: University of Plymouth, Plymouth, UK\rConference Website: http://www.ebee.net/\r  The 2022 4th International Conference on E-Business and E-Commerce Engineering (EBEE 2022) will be held at the University of Plymouth, Plymouth, UK, during December 14-16, 2022. \rEBEE 2022 provides a forum for academic communication in E-Business and E-Commerce Engineering and related areas to share their emerging research findings and results.\rBased on the essential complexities in e-business, EBEE 2022 invites an extensive coverage of researchers in the fields of system, software, service, business and combinations of the aforementioned, etc.\rIf the COVID-19 is not effectively under control, the conference committee will reserve the right to convert the conference into a virtual event.\r Previous EBEE: \rEBEE conference papers have been published in the ACM conference proceedings, archived in ACM Digital Library, and indexed by Ei Compendex and Scopus for three consecutive years.\rEBEE 2021 - ACM ISBN: 978-1-4503-8739-2 | ACM Conference Proceedings | Ei Compendex & Scopus | Online\rEBEE 2020 - ACM ISBN: 978-1-4503-8892-4 | ACM Conference Proceedings | Ei Compendex & Scopus | Online\rEBEE 2019 - ACM ISBN: 978-1-4503-7672-3 | ACM Conference Proceedings | Ei Compendex & Scopus | Bali, Indonesia\r Paper Publishing and Indexing: \rAll accepted and registered papers will be published in the Conference Proceedings by ACM, archived in ACM Digital Library, indexed by Ei Compendex and Scopus, and submitted for indexing in CPCI.\r  Submission Methods:  \r1. Submit via the Online Submission System: \rhttps://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/EBEE2022\r2. Submit via e-mail: ebee@academic.net\rPaper Template Downloading: http://www.ebee.net/acm_submission_template.docx\r Call for Papers\rTopics of interest for submission include, but are not limited to: \rElectronic Commerce Research and Applications:\rAgent-based commerce\relectronic auctions\re-business models\rB2C and B2B EC\rconsumer behavior\rcustomer relationship management and data mining \rElectronic Commerce in the Artificial Intelligence Era:\rChatbots and voice assistants in eCommerce transaction and customer service\rPersonalization in marketing and sales using AI\rAI-based smart supply chain management\rAI-based financial technology\rAI for risk control and management in eCommerce\rFake information and social manipulation\rFor more topics, please visit: http://ebee.net/cfp.html\r Call for TPC:\rEBEE 2022 respectfully invite scholars and experts in E-Business, E-commerce Engineering, and their related fields to join the Technical Program Committee. If you are interested or if you have someone to recommend, please send your/their CV/s to ebee@academic.net. All received CVs will be carefully reviewed and discussed.\rTPC member information will be shown on the webpage for EBEE 2022 as well. Welcome to join us!\r Conference Agenda: \rDay 1 - December 14th, 2022: Sign in & Materials Collecting\rDay 2 - December 15th, 2022: Opening Ceremony, Keynote Speeches & Parallel Sessions\rDay 3 - December 16th, 2022: Academic Visiting\r Contact Us:\rConference Secretary: Ms. Phoebe Wang\rEmail: ebee@academic.net\rTel: +86-134-3897-9298 (China)\n\t'

title: b'ICWS 2022'
description: b'2022 International Conference on Web Services'
Categories: b'web-based systems' b'social networking services' b'web security and privacy' b'microservices'
Call For Papers: b'\nICWS 2022 Call for Papers\r 2022 International Conference on Web Services (ICWS 2022, http://www.icws.org/2022/)\r Theme: Web-based Services for Digital Transformation\r ==================================================================\r ICWS 2022 program committee invites you to participate in 2022 edition of ICWS, to be held on December 10 - 14, 2022.\r The International Conference on Web Services (ICWS) has been a prime international forum for researchers, academics, businesses, industry, and standard bodies to exchange the latest fundamental advances in the state of the art and practice of Web-based services, identify emerging research topics, and define the future of Web-based services. Internet/Web-based services are not limited to Web services. In 2022, we will strive to advance the largest international professional forum on Web-based services.\r ICWS 2022 is a member of Services Conference Federation (SCF). SCF 2022 will have the following 10 collocated service-oriented sister conferences: 2022 International Conference on Web Services (ICWS 2022), 2022 International Conference on Cloud Computing (CLOUD 2022), 2022 International Conference on Services Computing (SCC 2022), 2022 International Conference on Big Data (BigData 2022), 2022 International Conference on AI & Mobile Services (AIMS 2022), and 2022 World Congress on Services (SERVICES 2022), 2022 International Conference on Internet of Things (ICIOT 2022), 2022 International Conference on Cognitive Computing (ICCC 2022), 2022 International Conference on Edge Computing (EDGE 2022), and 2022 International Conference on Blockchain (ICBC 2022).\r From technology foundation perspective, Services Computing has become the default discipline in the modern services industry. As a major implementation technology for modernizing services industry, Web services are Internet-based programmable application components published using standard interface description languages and universally available via uniform communication protocols. The program of ICWS 2022 will continue to feature research papers with a wide range of topics, focusing on various aspects of Internet and web-based services . Some of the topics include Web services discovery and composition, Web services specifications and enhancements, Web services QoS (e.g., security, performance, reliability, fault tolerance, etc.), Web services standards and formalizations, Web services modeling, Web services engineering, Web services testing, Web services-based applications and solutions, Web services realizations, semantics in Web services, Web services supporting Cloud Computing, Web services lifecycle management, and all aspects of Service-Oriented Architecture (SOA) infrastructure and middleware.\r The technical program of ICWS 2022 will include a Research Track, an Application Track, and a Short Paper Track. The ICWS 2022 tracks seeks original, UNPUBLISHED research papers reporting substantive new work in various aspects of Web-based services. Research Track papers MUST clearly indicate their contributions to the field of web-based technologies, applications and solutions. All papers MUST properly cite related work in the field, such as those published in the proceedings of ICWS, SCC, CLOUD, SERVICES, BigData, ICIOT, ICBC, EDGE, APSCC, ECOWS, and related journals including STBD, JWSR, STSC, STCC, STIOT and IJBPIM (see Literature Recommendations page).\r All topics relevant to Internet/Web based services are of interest. ICWS 2022 will organize refereed paper reviews in 16 research areas (themes):\r - Web-based Systems\r- Web-based Services\r- Web Programming\r- Web Content Creation\r- Social Networking Services\r- Semantic Web\r- Web Protocols\r- Web Caching and Buffering\r- Web and XML\r- Industry Specific Site Building\r- Web Testing and Stagging\r- Web User Experience\r- Thin Client Programming\r- Rich Client Programming\r- 5G Web Technology\r- Web Security and Privacy\r All submitted manuscripts will be peer-reviewed by at least 3 program committee members. Accepted and presented papers from all ICWS tracks will appear in the conference proceedings.\r Submitted Research Track and Application Track manuscripts will be limited to 15 (LNCS Proceedings style) pages and REQUIRED to be formatted using the LNCS Proceedings template (WORD, Latex). Submitted Short Paper track manuscripts will be limited to 8 (LNCS Proceedings style) pages. The authors can extend a maximum of 2 pages for each paper but will have to pay extra fees for each extra page. Unformatted papers and papers beyond the maximum page limit may not be reviewed. Electronic submission of manuscripts (in PDF or Word format) is required. Detailed instructions for electronic paper preparation and submission, panel proposals, tutorial proposals, workshop proposals, and review process can be found at http://icws.org/2022/.\r The Proceedings of ICWS 2022 will be published in the Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS) by Springer International Publishing AG. Currently the Abstracting and Indexing services covered by Springer\'s data feeds for LNCS proceedings include ISI Conference Proceedings Citation Index (included in Web of Science), Engineering Index EI (Compendex and Inspec databases), DBLP, Google Scholar, IO-Port, MathSciNet, Scopus, and ZBlMath. For all 10 collocated conferences of SCF 2022, the content of this proceedings volume will be made freely accessible to anyone in the Springer\'s digital library after four years upon publication.\r At least one author of each accepted paper is required to register to the conference and present the paper. One Best Paper award and one Best Student Paper award will be granted at ICWS 2022. The first author of the best student paper must be a full-time student. The Best Paper Awards will be sponsored by Springer, which is a leading global scientific, technical and medical portfolio, providing researchers in academia, scientific institutions and corporate R&D departments with quality content through innovative information, products and services.\r Manuscripts submitted to the Research Track focusing on application or solution descriptions may be recommended to the Application Track or other tracks for further consideration if the session slots are available.\r Author Guidelines and Templates\rSCF 2022 Guidelines & copyright forms\r Guidelines for proceedings authors (pdf)\rLNCS Copyright Form (pdf, 61kb)\rSCF 2022 Templates, sample files & useful links\r LaTeX2e Proceedings Templates (zip)\rMicrosoft Word Proceedings Templates (zip)\rMicrosoft Word 2003 Proceedings Templates (zip, 229kb)\rYour ORCID identifier\r Important Dates:\rResearch Track/Application Track/Short Paper Track:\rEarly-birds paper submission due: June 26, 2022\rReview comments to Early-birds paper submission: July 20, 2022\rRegular paper submission due: August 15, 2022\rReview comments to Regular paper submission: September 13, 2022\rCamera ready manuscripts due: September 20, 2022\rConference dates: December 10 - 14, 2022\r Submission System\r ICWS 2022 Research Track:\rhttps://www.edas.info/newPaper.php?c=29818&track=112937\r ICWS 2022 Application and Industry Track:\rhttps://www.edas.info/newPaper.php?c=29818&track=112936\r ICWS 2022 Short Paper Track:\rhttps://www.edas.info/newPaper.php?c=29818&track=112938\r SCF Policy\r Review Policy\r SCF Policy and professional ethics require that referees treat the contents of papers under review as privileged information not to be disclosed to others before publication. It is expected that no one with access to a paper under review will make any inappropriate use of the special knowledge, which that access provides. Contents of abstracts submitted to conference program committees should be regarded as privileged as well, and handled in the same manner. The Conference Publications Chair shall ensure that referees adhere to this practice.\r Organizers of SCF conferences are expected to provide an appropriate forum for the oral presentation and discussion of all accepted papers. An author, in offering a paper for presentation at a SCF conference, or accepting an invitation to present a paper, is expected to be present at the meeting to deliver the paper. In the event that circumstances unknown at the time of submission of a paper preclude its presentation by an author, the program chair should be informed on time, and appropriate substitute arrangements should be made. In some cases it may help reduce no-shows for the Conference to require advance registration together with the submission of the final manuscript.\r About the Services Society\r The Services Society (S2) is a non-profit professional organization that has been created to promote worldwide research and technical collaboration in services innovations among academia and industrial professionals. Its members are volunteers from industry and academia with common interests. S2 is registered in the USA as a "501(c) organization", which means that it is an American tax-exempt nonprofit organization. S2 collaborates with other professional organizations to sponsor or co-sponsor conferences and to promote an effective services curriculum in colleges and universities. The S2 initiates and promotes a "Services University" program worldwide to bridge the gap between industrial needs and university instruction. The Services Society has formed 10 Special Interest Groups (SIGs) to support technology and domain specific professional activities.\r SCF As A Platform\r As the founding member of the Services Conference Federation (SCF), the first International Conference on Web Services (ICWS) was held in June 2003 in Las Vegas, USA. Meanwhile, the First International Conference on Web Services - Europe 2003 (ICWS-Europe\'03) was held in Germany in Oct, 2003. ICWS-Europe\'03 is an extended event of the 2003 International Conference on Web Services (ICWS 2003) in Europe. In 2004, ICWS-Europe was changed to the European Conference on Web Services (ECOWS), which was held at Erfurt, Germany. SCF 2019 was held successfully in San Diego, USA. In 2020 and 2021, SCF were held as a fully virtual conference affected by the world-wide corona virus emergency. To celebrate its 20-year-old birthday, SCF 2022 will be held on December 10 - 14, 2022.\r The past 19 years, ICWS community has been expanded from Web engineering innovations to scientific research for the whole services industry. The service delivery platforms have been expanded to mobile platforms, Internet of Things, cloud computing, and edge computing. The services ecosystem is gradually enabled, value added, and intelligence embedded through enabling technologies such as big data, artificial intelligence, and cognitive computing. In the coming years, all the transactions with multiple parties involved will be transformed to blockchain.\r Based on the technology trends and best practices in the field, the Services Conference Federation (SCF) will continue serving as the conference umbrella\'s code name for all services-related conferences. SCF 2022 defines the future of New ABCDE (AI, Blockchain, Cloud, BigData & IOT) and Digital Transformation. We are very proud to announce that SCF 2022\'s 10 co-located theme topic conferences will all center around "services", while each focusing on exploring different themes (web-based services, cloud-based services, Big Data-based services, services innovation lifecycle, AI-driven ubiquitous services, blockchain driven trust service-ecosystems, industry-specific services and applications, and emerging service-oriented technologies).\r SCF 2022 Highlights:\r - Bigger Platform: The 10 collocated conferences (SCF 2022) get sponsorship from the Services Society which is the world-leading not-for-profits organization (501 c(3)) dedicated for serving more than 30,000 worldwide Services Computing researchers and practitioners. Bigger platform means bigger opportunities to all volunteers, authors and participants. Meanwhile, Springer provides sponsorship to best paper awards and other professional activities. All the 10 conference proceedings of SCF 2022 will be published by Springer and indexed in ISI Conference Proceedings Citation Index (included in Web of Science), Engineering Index EI (Compendex and Inspec databases), DBLP, Google Scholar, IO-Port, MathSciNet, Scopus, and ZBlMath.\r - Brighter Future: While celebrating 2022 version of ICWS, SCF 2022 highlights the 5th International Conference on Blockchain (ICBC 2022) to build the fundamental infrastructure for enabling secure and trusted services ecosystems. It will also lead our community members to create their own brighter future.\r - Better Model: SCF 2022 will continue to leverage the invented Conference Blockchain Model (CBM) to innovate the organizing practices for all the 10 theme conferences. Senior researchers in the field are welcome to submit proposals to serve as CBM Ambassador for an individual conference to start better interactions during your leadership practices for organizing SCF 2022.\r Look forward to your great contributions as a volunteer, author, and conference participant for the fast-growing worldwide services innovations community. If you would like to contribute to SCF 2022 as a leading volunteer or try the new Conference Blockchain Model. For other queries or questions, please feel free to visit our conference web sites and find contact information on SCF 2022.\r See you all on December 10 - 14, 2022.\r Contact Information\r If you have any questions or queries on ICWS 2022, please send email to icws AT ServicesSociety DOT org.\r ========================================================\r The Services Society Community Membership Program has been created to enhance its member\'s career as a services innovation professional.\r Please join the Services Society - Global Services Computing Community as a member at https://community.ServicesSociety.org for FREE. You can get access to the online community portal that supports community members to post messages, ask questions, answer questions, access online presentations by SCF 365 and conduct discussions, gain reputation scores, and grow membership grades (Member, Senior Member, Distinguished Member, Fellow, and Member of National Academy of Services (NASV)). Services Token Framework (Digital Currency) has been created for awarding Global Services Computing Community members for proactively participating in SCF as an organizing committee member, an author, a program committee member, a reviewer, a presenter, a conference participant, and a session chair as well as interacting with online community members through knowledge sharing. The Services Token can be used to redeem conference registration fees for SCF 2022. The goal of Services Society (S2) is to foster Building the Modern Services Industry through Services Computing technologies and business innovations.\r\n'

Call For Papers: b'\nFull Name: 2022 The 9th International Conference on History and Culture (ICHC 2022)\rAbbreviation: ICHC 2022\rTime: December 14-16, 2022    \rPlace: University of Plymouth, Plymouth, UK\rWebsite of Conference: http://www.ichc.org/\r  The 9th International Conference on History and Culture (ICHC 2022) is the main annual research conference aimed at presenting current research being carried out. ICHC 2022 will be held in Plymouth, Plymouth University, UK on December 14-16, 2022. The success of prior ICHC conferences, demonstrated by the quality of research works presented by participating scholars in previous years, has made it an annual gathering and benchmark event for culture and history researchers. The annual conference aims to provide a premier international forum for industry practitioners, academia, and researchers to share and exchange knowledge and research findings, as well as to discuss recent advancements in the fields of history and culture.\r CALL For TPC\rICHC 2022 respectfully asks scholars and experts in Sociality and Humanities related fields to consider being a member of the Technical Program Committee. If you are interested or if you have someone to recommend, please send your/their CV/s to ichc@iedrc.org. All received CVs will be carefully reviewed and discussed. TPC member\xe2\x80\x99s name, affiliation and nationality will be shown on the webpage for ICHC 2022 as well. Welcome to join us.\r Journal Publication\rAll accepted excellent papers will be published on International Journal of Social Science and Humanity (IJSSH)\r International Journal of Social Science and Humanity (IJSSH)\rISSN: 2010-3646 (Online)\rFrequency: Quarterly (Since 2019)\rDOI: 10.18178/IJSSH\rIndexing:Google Scholar, Engineering & Technology Digital Library, Crossref, DOAJ, doi System and ProQuest.\rWord Template Download:http://www.ichc.org/IJSSH_template.doc\r Submission \r-Language: English is the official language of the conference. The paper should be written and presented only in English.\r -Publication & Presentation: Full paper submission is required if you consider publishing your paper.\r -Presentation Only: Abstract submission is acceptable for presentation only at ICHC 2022.\r Full Papers\xef\xbc\x9aLong Papers are limited to a total of 8 (at least 5 pages) pages, including all content and references, extra pages will be charged.\r -Full Paper (Presentation and Publication): Accepted full paper will be invited to give the oral presentation at the conference and be published in international journal.\r Abstract Papers: Short Papers are limited to a total of 1 (about 200-300 words) pages, including all content and references. \r -Abstract (Presentation only): Accepted abstract will be invited to give the oral presentation at the conference, which will not be published.\r To publish the full paper and give the oral presentation, please send us the full paper. \r*Please format your paper before submission, and the paper page will be within 5- 8 pages. The extra pages (from 9th page) will be charged with 50USD per page. \rTo give presentation only, please just send us the abstract.\r Submission Methods:\r1. Online Submission: http://confsys.iconf.org/submission/ichc2022\r2. Email:  ichc@iedrc.net\r  Call for Papers\rValue of cultural mechanisms (film, theatre, music, crafts, sport, art, architecture, cultural collections, museums, memorials, ceremonies, media, rituals and symbols) in post-conflict resolution.\rThe challenges of teaching history in post conflict societies \xe2\x80\x93 whose narrative?\rSupporting and financing justice delivery and social reconstruction through tribunals, truth commissions and other transitional justice mechanisms.\rPublic health work in Post-conflict peace building.\rWaging peace: road maps to peace; conflict resolution; election monitoring; peace keeping; constitution drafting; voter education; democracy programs.\rReducing societal polarization through subjective reporting by improving professional media practices, standards, and understanding.\rResolution of clashes over religion; and cultural, national or ethnic identity.\rContesting ownership of the peace process: creating spaces for post-conflict intercultural dialogue.\rThe safeguarding, return and restitution of cultural objects in Post-conflict societies.\rRe-integration of ex-combatants, including child soldiers, into society.\rMethodologies for conflict analysis \xe2\x80\x93 links between theory and practice in this field.\rThe vulnerability of women during and after conflict \xe2\x80\x93 gender based violence.\rCultural mediation of conflicts in history.\rPerforming conflicts and making peace in traditional societies. \rNew approaches and trends in cultural history.\rHistorical anthropology.\rAnthropology of Religion.\rFor more topics, please visit http://www.ichc.org/cfp.html\r \\\rConference Program:\r*Conference Schedule* \rDay 1 - Friday - December 14, 2022\r10:00-17:00 | Registration & Conference materials collection\r Day 2 - Saturday - December 15, 2022\r09:00 - 12:10 | Opening Remark & Keynote Speeches\r12:10 - 13:30 | Lunch\r13:30 - 18:30 | Parallel Sessions\r18:30 - 20:00 | Banquet\r Day 3 - Sunday - December 16, 2022\r09:30 - 17:00 | Parallel Sessions\r Contact Us\rConference Secretary: Ms. Joe Zhou\rEmail: ichc@iedrc.org\rTel : +86-13648043904 (China)\n\t'

title: b'SCC 2022'
description: b'2022 International Conference on Services Computing'
Categories: b'service innovation lifecycle' b'business process management' b'service composition' b'service management'
Call For Papers: b'\nSCC 2022 Call for Papers\r 2022 International Conference on Services Computing (SCC 2022, http://thescc.org/2022/)\r Theme: User-Centric Services for Digital Transformation\r ==================================================================\r SCC 2022 program committee invites you to contribute to 2022 edition of SCC, to be held on December 10 - 14, 2022.\r Services account for a major part of the IT industry today. Companies increasingly like to focus on their core expertise area and use IT services to address all their peripheral needs. Services Computing is a new science which aims to study and better understand the foundations of this highly popular industry. It covers the science and technology of leveraging computing and information technology to model, create, operate, and manage business services. The 2022 International Conference on Services Computing (SCC 2022) will contribute in building the pillars of this important science and shaping the future of Services Computing. Part of the SCF 2018, SCC 2018 was successfully held on June 25 - June 30, 2018, Seattle, USA. Part of the SCF 2019, SCC 2019 was successfully held on June 25 - 30, 2019, San Diego, USA. Part of the SCF 2020 and SCF 2021, SCC 2020 and SCC 2021 were successfully held over the Internet. In 2022, we will celebrate our 2022 version of gathering, to strive to advance the largest international professional forum on all kinds of user-centric services.\r SCC 2022 is a member of Services Conference Federation (SCF). SCF 2022 will have the following 10 collocated service-oriented sister conferences: 2022 International Conference on Web Services (ICWS 2022), 2022 International Conference on Cloud Computing (CLOUD 2022), 2022 International Conference on Services Computing (SCC 2022), 2022 International Conference on Big Data (BigData 2022), 2022 International Conference on AI & Mobile Services (AIMS 2022), and 2022 World Congress on Services (SERVICES 2022), 2022 International Conference on Internet of Things (ICIOT 2022), 2022 International Conference on Cognitive Computing (ICCC 2022), 2022 International Conference on Edge Computing (EDGE 2022), and 2022 International Conference on Blockchain (ICBC 2022).\r The International Conference on Services Computing (SCC) covers the whole lifecycle of innovation research and enabling technologies, which includes enterprise modeling, business consulting, solution creation, services delivery, services orchestration, services optimization, services management, services marketing, services delivery and cloud computing, service-oriented architecture (SOA), business process integration and management, and Web services technologies and standards.\r All topics relevant to Internet services lifecycle are of interest. SCC 2022 will organize refereed paperreviews in 12 research areas:\r - Service Innovation Lifecycle\r- Enterprise Architectures\r- Business Process Management\r- Microservices\r- Service Oriented Architecture (SOA)\r- Business Process Integration\r- Service Composition\r- Service Delivery\r- Service Operations\r- Service Management\r- Quality of Services (QoS)\r- 5G Application Architecture\r The technical program of SCC 2022 will include a research track, a application track, and a short paper track. The SCC 2022 will highlight foundational work that strives to push beyond the limits of existing business services platforms and products, including experimental efforts, innovative systems and investigations that identify weaknesses in the existing services computing technology.\r The SCC 2022 seeks original, UNPUBLISHED research papers reporting substantive new work in various aspects of services innovation lifecycle management. Submissions MUST clearly indicate their contributions to the field of services computing and properly cite related work in the field, such as those published in the proceedings of BigData, ICWS, SCC, CLOUD, SERVICES, APSCC, ECOWS, and related journals including JWSR, STSC and IJBPIM.\r Submitted Research Track and Application Track manuscripts will be limited to 15 (LNCS Proceedings style) pages and REQUIRED to be formatted using the LNCS Proceedings template (WORD, Latex). Submitted Short Paper track manuscripts will be limited to 8 (LNCS Proceedings style) pages. The authors can extend a maximum of 2 pages for each paper but will have to pay extra fees for each extra page. Unformatted papers and papers beyond the maximum page limit may not be reviewed.\r The Proceedings of SCC 2022 will be published in the Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS) by Springer International Publishing AG. Currently the Abstracting and Indexing services covered by Springer\'s data feeds for LNCS proceedings include ISI Conference Proceedings Citation Index (included in Web of Science), Engineering Index EI (Compendex and Inspec databases), DBLP, Google Scholar, IO-Port, MathSciNet, Scopus, and ZBlMath. For all 10 collocated conferences of SCF 2022, the content of this proceedings volume will be made freely accessible to anyone in the Springer\'s digital library after four years upon publication.\r At least one author of each accepted paper is required to register to the conference and present the paper. One Best Paper award and one Best Student Paper award will be granted at SCC 2022. The first author of the best student paper must be a full-time student. The Best Paper Awards will be sponsored by Springer, which is a leading global scientific, technical and medical portfolio, providing researchers in academia, scientific institutions and corporate R&D departments with quality content through innovative information, products and services.\r Manuscripts submitted to the Research Track focusing on application or solution descriptions may be recommended to the Application Track or other tracks for further consideration if the session slots are available. \r Author Guidelines and Templates\rSCF 2022 Guidelines & copyright forms\r Guidelines for proceedings authors (pdf)\rLNCS Copyright Form (pdf, 61kb)\rSCF 2022 Templates, sample files & useful links\r LaTeX2e Proceedings Templates (zip)\rMicrosoft Word Proceedings Templates (zip)\rMicrosoft Word 2003 Proceedings Templates (zip, 229kb)\rYour ORCID identifier\r Important Dates:\rResearch Track/Application Track/Short Paper Track:\rEarly-birds paper submission due: June 26, 2022\rReview comments to Early-birds paper submission: July 20, 2022\rRegular paper submission due: August 15, 2022\rReview comments to Regular paper submission: September 13, 2022\rCamera ready manuscripts due: September 20, 2022\rConference dates: December 10 - 14, 2022\r Submission System\r SCC 2022 Research Track:\rhttps://www.edas.info/newPaper.php?c=29826&track=112969\r SCC 2022 Application and Industry Track:\rhttps://www.edas.info/newPaper.php?c=29826&track=112968\r SCC 2022 Short Paper Track:\rhttps://www.edas.info/newPaper.php?c=29826&track=112970\r SCF Policy\r Review Policy\r SCF Policy and professional ethics require that referees treat the contents of papers under review as privileged information not to be disclosed to others before publication. It is expected that no one with access to a paper under review will make any inappropriate use of the special knowledge, which that access provides. Contents of abstracts submitted to conference program committees should be regarded as privileged as well, and handled in the same manner. The Conference Publications Chair shall ensure that referees adhere to this practice.\r Organizers of SCF conferences are expected to provide an appropriate forum for the oral presentation and discussion of all accepted papers. An author, in offering a paper for presentation at a SCF conference, or accepting an invitation to present a paper, is expected to be present at the meeting to deliver the paper. In the event that circumstances unknown at the time of submission of a paper preclude its presentation by an author, the program chair should be informed on time, and appropriate substitute arrangements should be made. In some cases it may help reduce no-shows for the Conference to require advance registration together with the submission of the final manuscript.\r About the Services Society\r The Services Society (S2) is a non-profit professional organization that has been created to promote worldwide research and technical collaboration in services innovations among academia and industrial professionals. Its members are volunteers from industry and academia with common interests. S2 is registered in the USA as a "501(c) organization", which means that it is an American tax-exempt nonprofit organization. S2 collaborates with other professional organizations to sponsor or co-sponsor conferences and to promote an effective services curriculum in colleges and universities. The S2 initiates and promotes a "Services University" program worldwide to bridge the gap between industrial needs and university instruction. The Services Society has formed 10 Special Interest Groups (SIGs) to support technology and domain specific professional activities.\r SCF As A Platform\r As the founding member of the Services Conference Federation (SCF), the first International Conference on Web Services (ICWS) was held in June 2003 in Las Vegas, USA. Meanwhile, the First International Conference on Web Services - Europe 2003 (ICWS-Europe\'03) was held in Germany in Oct, 2003. ICWS-Europe\'03 is an extended event of the 2003 International Conference on Web Services (ICWS 2003) in Europe. In 2004, ICWS-Europe was changed to the European Conference on Web Services (ECOWS), which was held at Erfurt, Germany. SCF 2019 was held successfully in San Diego, USA. In 2020 and 2021, SCF were held as a fully virtual conference affected by the world-wide corona virus emergency. To celebrate its 20-year-old birthday, SCF 2022 will be held on December 10 - 14, 2022.\r The past 19 years, ICWS community has been expanded from Web engineering innovations to scientific research for the whole services industry. The service delivery platforms have been expanded to mobile platforms, Internet of Things, cloud computing, and edge computing. The services ecosystem is gradually enabled, value added, and intelligence embedded through enabling technologies such as big data, artificial intelligence, and cognitive computing. In the coming years, all the transactions with multiple parties involved will be transformed to blockchain.\r Based on the technology trends and best practices in the field, the Services Conference Federation (SCF) will continue serving as the conference umbrella\'s code name for all services-related conferences. SCF 2022 defines the future of New ABCDE (AI, Blockchain, Cloud, BigData & IOT) and Digital Transformation. We are very proud to announce that SCF 2022\'s 10 co-located theme topic conferences will all center around "services", while each focusing on exploring different themes (web-based services, cloud-based services, Big Data-based services, services innovation lifecycle, AI-driven ubiquitous services, blockchain driven trust service-ecosystems, industry-specific services and applications, and emerging service-oriented technologies).\r SCF 2022 Highlights:\r - Bigger Platform: The 10 collocated conferences (SCF 2022) get sponsorship from the Services Society which is the world-leading not-for-profits organization (501 c(3)) dedicated for serving more than 30,000 worldwide Services Computing researchers and practitioners. Bigger platform means bigger opportunities to all volunteers, authors and participants. Meanwhile, Springer provides sponsorship to best paper awards and other professional activities. All the 10 conference proceedings of SCF 2022 will be published by Springer and indexed in ISI Conference Proceedings Citation Index (included in Web of Science), Engineering Index EI (Compendex and Inspec databases), DBLP, Google Scholar, IO-Port, MathSciNet, Scopus, and ZBlMath.\r - Brighter Future: While celebrating 2022 version of ICWS, SCF 2022 highlights the 5th International Conference on Blockchain (ICBC 2022) to build the fundamental infrastructure for enabling secure and trusted services ecosystems. It will also lead our community members to create their own brighter future.\r - Better Model: SCF 2022 will continue to leverage the invented Conference Blockchain Model (CBM) to innovate the organizing practices for all the 10 theme conferences. Senior researchers in the field are welcome to submit proposals to serve as CBM Ambassador for an individual conference to start better interactions during your leadership practices for organizing SCF 2022.\r Look forward to your great contributions as a volunteer, author, and conference participant for the fast-growing worldwide services innovations community. If you would like to contribute to SCF 2022 as a leading volunteer or try the new Conference Blockchain Model. For other queries or questions, please feel free to visit our conference web sites and find contact information on SCF 2022.\r See you all on December 10 - 14, 2022.\r Contact Information\r If you have any questions or queries on SCC 2022, please send email to scc AT ServicesSociety DOT org.\r ========================================================\r The Services Society Community Membership Program has been created to enhance its member\'s career as a services innovation professional.\r Please join the Services Society - Global Services Computing Community as a member at https://community.ServicesSociety.org for FREE. You can get access to the online community portal that supports community members to post messages, ask questions, answer questions, access online presentations by SCF 365 and conduct discussions, gain reputation scores, and grow membership grades (Member, Senior Member, Distinguished Member, Fellow, and Member of National Academy of Services (NASV)). Services Token Framework (Digital Currency) has been created for awarding Global Services Computing Community members for proactively participating in SCF as an organizing committee member, an author, a program committee member, a reviewer, a presenter, a conference participant, and a session chair as well as interacting with online community members through knowledge sharing. The Services Token can be used to redeem conference registration fees for SCF 2022. The goal of Services Society (S2) is to foster Building the Modern Services Industry through Services Computing technologies and business innovations.\r\n'

description: b'2022 5th International Conference on Hot Information-Centric Networking (HotICN 2022)'
Categories: b'networking' b'information technology' b'big data' b'information management'
Call For Papers: b'\n\xe2\x98\x85Full Name: 2022 5th International Conference on Hot Information-Centric Networking (HotICN 2022)\r\xe2\x98\x85Abbreviation: HotICN 2022\r Date: 24-26 November, 2022\rWebsite: http://2022.hoticn.com/\rVenue: Guangzhou, China\r 2022 5th International Conference on Hot Information-Centric Networking (HotICN 2022) will be held in Guangzhou, China on November 24th-26th, 2022.\rThe International Conference on Hot Information-Centric Networking (HotICN) aims to gather experts and scholars from home and abroad in this field to discuss the architecture, key technologies, innovative ideas, future development trends and industry prospects of information centric networks and its related fields such as blockchain, Cloud Network Integration, etc. The conference committee invites submissions of applied or theoretical research as well as of application-oriented papers on all the topics of HotICN 2022. Accepted and presented papers of HotICN 2022 will be published in international conference proceedings.\r \xe2\x98\x85Organized by\rGuangdong University of Technology\r \xe2\x98\x85Co-organized by\rPurple Mountain Laboratories\rBeijing University of Posts and Telecommunications\rJiangsu Future Networks Innovation Institute\r  \xe2\x98\x85Organizing Committee\r*Honorary Chairs\rYunjie Liu, Academician of China Academy of Engineering, Jiangsu Future Networks Innovation Institute, China\rF. Committee Chairs\rRuidong Li, Kanazawa University, Japan\rDondning Liu, Guangdong University of Technology, China\rMing Li, The University of Texas at Arlington, USA\rShengrong Bu, Brock University, Call For Papers: b'\n23th Industrial Conference on Data Mining ICDM 2023\rJuly 12 - 16, 2023, New York, USA\rwww.data-mining-forum.de\r Aim of the Conference\rThe aim of the conference is to bring together researchers from all over the world who deal with machine learning and data mining in order to discuss the recent status of the research and to direct further developments. Basic research papers as well as application papers are welcome.\r Chair\t\rPetra Perner\t      Institute of Computer Vision and Applied Computer Sciences IBaI, \r                      Germany\r Program Committee\t\rPlamen Angelov\t      Lancaster University, United Kingdom\rAntonio Dourado\t      University of Coimbra, Portugal\rStefano Ferilli\t      University of Bari, Italy\rWarwick Graco\t      Analytics Shed, Australia\rAleksandra Gruca      Silesian University of Technology, Poland\rPedro Isaias\t      The University of New South Wales, Australia\rPiotr Jedrzejowicz    Gdynia Maritime University, Poland\rMartti Juhola\t      University of Tampere, Finland\rEduardo F. Morales    National Institute of Astrophysics, Optics, and Electronics, \r                      Mexico\rWieslaw Paja\t      University of Rzeszow, Poland\rVictor Sheng\t      University of Central Arkansas, USA\rIren Todorova Valova  University of Massachusetts Dartmouth, USA\rYun Zhao\t      University of California, USA\rand more to be announced...\r Topics of the conference\rPaper submissions should be related but not limited to any of the following topics:\r Applications of Data Mining in ...\r     Marketing\r    Medicine\r    Civil Engineering\r    E-Commerce (Mining Logfiles)\r    Biotechnology\r    Quality Management\r    Multimedia Data (Image, Video, Text, Signals)\r    Web-Mining\r    Intrusion Detection in Networks\r    Criminology\r    Telecommunications\r    Social Sciences\r    Forensic Data Analysis\r    Drug Discovery\r    Agriculture\r    Smart Maintenance\r    Legal Court Cases\r    Energy Industries\r    Logistics and Supply Chain Management\r    Finance and Stock Markets\r    Meterology, Blockchain and more ...\r       Theoretical and Application-oriented Topics in ...\r        Big Data and Algorithm for Big Data\r        Case-Based Reasoning and Similarity-Based Reasoning\r        Clustering\r        Classification & Prediction\r        Statistical Learning\r        Association Rules\r        Deviation and Novelty Detection\r        Control Charts\r        Conceptional Learning\r        Goodness Measures and Evaluation (e.g. false discovery rates)\r        Inductive Learning Including Decision Tree and Rule Induction Learning\r        Organisational Learning and Evolutional Learning\r        Sampling Methods\r        Similarity Measures and Learning of Similarity\r        Statistical Learning and Neural Net Based Learning\r        Visualization and Data Mining\r        Deviation and Novelty Detection\r        Feature Grouping, Discretization, Selection and Transformation\r        Feature Learning\r        Frequent Pattern Mining\r        Learning and Adaptive Control\r        Learning/Adaption of Recognition and Perception\r        Learning for Handwriting Recognition\r        Learning in Image Pre-Processing and Segmentation\r        Mining Financial or Stockmarket Data\r        Mining Motion from Sequence\r        Subspace Methods\r        Support Vector Machines\r        Time Series and Sequential Pattern Mining\r        Desirabilities\r        Graph Mining\r        Agent Data Mining\r        Applications in Software Testing\r        Knowledge Management\r        Mining Social Media\r        Online Targeting & Controlling\r        Behavioral Targeting\r        Meteorological Data Mining\r        Data Mining in Energy Industry\r        Design of Experiment\r        Strategy of Experimentation\r        Capability Indices\r        Business Intelligence and Data Mining\r        Legal Informatics and Data Mining\r        Data Mining for Logistic and Supply Chain Management\r Authors can submit their paper in long paper or short paper version.\r Long Paper\rThe paper must be formatted in the Springer LNCS format. They should have at most 15 pages. The papers will be reviewed by the program committee. Papers will published in the conference proceedings.\r Please submit your Long Paper to the CMS-System.\r A special issue will be set up for the Intern. Journal Transactions on Machine Learning and Data Mining.\r Short Paper\rShort papers are also welcome and can be used to describe work in progress or project ideas. They can have 5 to max. 15 pages, formatted in Springer LNCS format. Accepted short papers will be presented as poster in the poster session. They will be published in a special poster proceedings book.\r Please submit your Short Paper to the CMS-System.\r Industry Papers\rWe encourage industrial people to show their applications and projects for data mining. This work can be presented as poster during the poster session in the special industry track. Please submit a one page abstract including title, name and affilation.\r Please submit your Industry Paper to the CMS-System.\r \n'

title: b'WSES 2022'

Call For Papers: b'\nFull Name: 2022 The 3rd World Symposium on Electrical Systems (WSES 2022)--Ei Compendex, Scopus\rAbbreviation: WSES 2022\r Sanya, Hainan, China\rDecember 09-11, 2022\rhttp://www.wses.net/\r As a workshop of ICPE 2022, The 3rd World Symposium on Electrical Systems is co-sponsored by University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Science and Engineering Institute, technically supported by Guangxi University, etc. WSES 2022 aims at providing an international platform for researchers and technologies from industry and academia to present their latest research results in fields where computer, Electrical Systems can be applied. title: b'CCY 2022'
description: b'The 4th World Conference on Children and Youth (CCY 2022)'
Categories: b'children and youth'
Call For Papers: b"\nAll the researchers, academicians, scholars and activists are invited to submit abstracts for the 4th World Conference on Child and Youth 2022 (CCY 2022) which will be held on 07th \xe2\x80\x93 08th July under the theme of \xe2\x80\x9cThe Pandemic, Climate Change and Adaptation to a World in Transition: Challenges for Children and Youth\xe2\x80\x9d  \r The reality is that children and youth develop and flourish under widely varying social, cultural and material circumstances both within and across societies. This reality has become increasingly more complex in recent decades due to unprecedented changes that are occurring on a global scale. Increasingly people and families have shown greater mobility, moving across internal divisions (e.g., internal migration) and national borders either voluntarily or involuntarily. \r The resulting interactions and exchanges across societies and levels of society that result from movement and from modern communication channels have made the life circumstances of children and youth highly variable and dynamic. Such interactions influence and are in turn influenced by the social location of children, youth and families both within their own societies and the world at large. These consequent changes undoubtedly have significant implications for parenting, socialization, growing up and life opportunities afforded to children and youth around the world. \r Theme of the CCY 2022 Conference\r\xe2\x80\x9cThe Pandemic, Climate Change and Adaptation to a World in Transition: Challenges for Children and Youth\xe2\x80\x9d\r Purpose of the Conference\rCCY 2022 is designed with the purpose of serving the educational and social policy environment for Child Development and Youth Empowerment. The Conference connects researchers, academicians, activists, practitioners and policymakers around the world to a single platform to interact with each other and share knowledge for the betterment of Children and Youth.\r We invite you to submit an abstract in the range of the following tracks but not limited to:\r Conference Tracks\r IMPACT ON COVID 19 PANDEMIC ON CHILDREN\rEarly Childhood Development and the Pandemic\rHome-Based Learning\rParent Child Relationship during the Pandemic\rParenting Practices during Pandemic\rMental Health of the Children during the Pandemic\rMitigating the risks of the COVID-19 on children\rChild maltreatment during the pandemic\r CHILD PROTECTION\rChild Protection Practice\rChildren and Homelessness\rReduce risk in child Protection\rChallenges of the Child Protection\rChildren with Refugee Status\rChild poverty and deprivation\rChildhood statelessness\rChild Care and Child Development\r IMPACTS OF THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC ON YOUTH\rYouth anxiety and depression\rYouth Mental Health during the Pandemic\rYouth Challenges and Opportunities\rThe Challenge of youth unemployment\rVulnerable youth and the COVID-19 pandemic\r PARENTING AND CHILD DEVELOPMENT\rCulture and parenting\rParenting stress\rChild development and personality\rParenting: An ecological perspective\rParenting science\rChild development: Principles and perspectives\rChild development and the physical environment\rThe role of the father\r YOUTH EDUCATION\rE-Learning\rGlobalization and Education-Challenges and Opportunities\rRefugees, Education and Development\rThe Economic Value of youth higher Education Trends and perspectives\rQuality and power in higher education\rDigital higher education\r EARLY CHILD EDUCATION\rEffective practices\rEthics and politics\rCritical issues\rPublic Education: Children with disabilities\rDiversities in Early Child Education\rAlternative perspectives on early childhood education\r CHILDREN AND YOUTH IN THE ERA OF title: b'Open-SOFOS 2022'
description: b'Open Data Science for Food Security'
Categories: b'food security' b'data science' b'machine learning' b'open data'
Call For Papers: b'\nOpen-SOFOS: Open Data Science fOr FOod Security  (online workshop @ECML/PKDD2022)\r Website: https://sites.google.com/view/open-sofos\r  KEY DATES\r Paper submission deadline: 20 June 2022\rPaper acceptance notification: 13 July 2022\rWorkshop date: Monday, Septembre 19th, 2022 (to be confirmed)\r CONTEXT\r After many years of decline, the number and severity of food insecurity situations is growing again in recent years all over the world. Multiple and interrelated reasons can be identified for this generalized rise in hunger situations, that make it challenging to monitor an extremely complex phenomenon such as food security. While great quantities of open data are available, that are related at different levels with food security, there is a urgent need to develop advanced data science techniques able to process this data in order to produce effective answers to food security related problems.\r The goal of the Open-SOFOS workshop, to be held in conjunction with ECML/PKDD 2022, is to bring together researchers and practitioners from around the world interested in developing data science techniques for food security related problems, preferably using open access data. Even though the focus is on computer science, the themes of the workshop also encourage interdisciplinary discussion about topics touching different fields such social science, humanities and geography.\rThis will allow to get an insight in the current status of research in data science for food security, showing how the possibility to exploit massive quantities of open data in this context can make it possible to improve solutions to classic tasks (e.g., the ones addressed by the existing Food Security Systems), but also to focus on research questions and practical problems that have not been deeply investigated so far.\r  TOPICS \r Topics of interest include, but are not limited to:\r \xe2\x80\x93\tPrediction of Food Security Indicators\r\xe2\x80\x93\tPoverty Prediction\r\xe2\x80\x93\tAgricultural Monitoring\r\xe2\x80\x93\tPrediction of Economical Indicators\r\xe2\x80\x93\tSocial Media Analysis\r\xe2\x80\x93\tEvolutionary Systems\r\xe2\x80\x93\tLandscape Analysis\r\xe2\x80\x93\tModeling of Spatial and Social Dynamics\r\xe2\x80\x93\tMobility Problems\r\xe2\x80\x93\tComplex Network Models for Food Security\r\xe2\x80\x93\tMachine and Deep Learning methods for Food Security\r\xe2\x80\x93\tText Mining Methods for Food Security\r\xe2\x80\x93\tHeterogeneous Data Integration Methods for Food Security\r\xe2\x80\x93\tKMS for Food Security\r SUBMISSION\r We welcome original contributions, either theoretical or empirical, describing ongoing projects or completed work.\rContributions can be of two types: either short position papers (up to 6 pages including references) or full research papers (up to 10 pages including references). Papers must be written in LNCS format, i.e., accordingly to the ECML-PKDD 2022 submission format. \rAccepted contributions will be made available electronically through the CEUR Workshop Proceedings platform (http://ceur-ws.org).\r  SUBMISSION WEBSITE:\r https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=opensofos2022\r PC-CHAIRS\r Roberto Interdonato, CIRAD, UMR Tetis, Montpellier, France, roberto.interdonato@cirad.fr\rMathieu Roche, CIRAD, UMR Tetis, Montpellier, France, mathieu.roche@cirad.fr \rGiulia Martini, World Food Programme (WFP), Rome, Italy, giulia.martini@wfp.org\rSabrina Gaito, Computer Science Department, University of Milan, Milan, Italy, sabrina.gaito@unimi.it\n\t'

title: b'MLIOB 2023'

Call For Papers: b'\n4th International Conference on Machine Learning, IOT and Blockchain (MLIOB 2023)  January 02 ~ 03, 2023, Zurich, Switzerland Due to the current COVID-19 pandemic, registered authors are now able to present their work through our online platforms.Scope & Topics4th International Conference on Machine Learning, IOT and Blockchain (MLIOB 2023)    will provide an excellent international forum for sharing knowledge and results in theory, methodology and applications of Machine Learning, IoT and Blockchain. Authors are solicited to contribute to the conference by submitting articles that illustrate research results, projects, surveying works and industrial experiences that describe significant advances in the areas of Machine Learning, Internet of Things and Blockchain. Topics of Interest Machine Learning Applications\rLearning in knowledge-intensive systems\rLearning Methods and analysis\rLearning Problems\rDeep Learning\rAI for IoT\rBlockchain and IoT\rElectronics and Signal processing for IoT\rEnergy Efficiency and Sustainability in IoT\rHuman Interaction with IoT\rInteroperability in IoT\rIoT Applications and Industry 4.0\rIoT Communication Technologies\rIoT Edge and Cloud Architectures\rIOT Experimental Results and Deployment Scenarios\rIoT enabled Innovation and Entrepreneurship\rMachine learning and IoT\rRobotic IoT Systems\rSecurity and Privacy for IoT\rSelf-adaptation for IoT Systems\rSoftware Engineering for IoT\rWeb of Things\rBlock Chain issues and trends\rBlockchain Attacks on Existing Systems\rBlockchain Consensus Algorithms\rBlockchain Foundations\rBlockchain New Design\rBlockchain Privacy\rBlockchain Scalability\rBlockchain-based security for the IoT\rBlockchain, Bigdata and IOT advancesPaper SubmissionAuthors are invited to submit papers through the conference Submission System by September 03, 2022. Submissions must be original and should not have been published previously or be under consideration for publication while being evaluated for this conference. The proceedings of the conference will be published by Computer Science Conference Proceedings (H index 31) in Computer Science & Information Technology (CS & IT) series (Confirmed).Selected papers from  MLIOB 2023, after further revisions, will be published in the special issue of the following journalsMachine Learning and Applications: An International Journal (MLAIJ) International Journal of UbiComp (IJU) The International Journal of Ambient Systems and Applications (IJASA)International Journal of Network Security & Its Applications (IJNSA) - ERA Indexed, WJCI IndexedInternational Journal of Artificial Intelligence & Applications (IJAIA)Information Technology in Industry (ITII)Important Dates  Submission Deadline:September 03, 2022Authors Notification: October 22, 2022Final Manuscript Due:  October 30, 2022'

Call For Papers: b'\nAdvances in Materials Science and Engineering: An International Journal (MSEJ)Scope and TopicsAdvances in Materials Science and Engineering: An International Journal (MSEJ) is a quarterly open access peer-reviewed journal that publishes articles which contribute new results in all areas of the Materials Science and Engineering. The journal is devoted to the publication of high quality papers on theoretical and practical aspects of Materials Science and Engineering.The goal of this journal is to bring together researchers and practitioners from academia and industry to focus on Materials Science and Engineering advancements, and establishing new collaborations in these areas. Original research papers, state-of-the-art reviews are invited for publication in all areas of Materials Science and Engineering.Topics of interest include but are not limited to, the following Art Conservation Science Biomaterials, tissue engineering Ceramics Composites Corrosion Diffraction studies Energy Fracture of materials Magnetic Materials Materials for Electronics and Photonics Materials Synthesis & Processing Materials Theory, Computation, and Design Mechanical properties Metals and alloys Nanomaterials, Nanoparticulates and nanocomposites Polymers Self-Assembly Solar energy Surfaces and InterfacesPaper SubmissionAuthors are invited to submit papers for this journal through E-mail msejjournal@airccse.com. Submissions must be original and should not have been published previously or be under consideration for publication while being evaluated for this Journal.Important DatesSubmission Deadline:August 27, 2022  Authors Notification: September 25, 2022Final Manuscript Due: September 28, 2022 Publication Date:Determined by the Editor-in-Chief\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Editorial Board Members Donnie Maclurcan, Southern Oregon University, USAPaolo Colombo, University of Padua, ItalyJiabao Yi, University of New South Wales, AustraliaAbhi Ray, University of Technology, AustraliaAlexandra Navrotsky, University of California at Davis, USAJan Seidel, University of New South Wales, AustraliaKantesh Balani, Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur, IndiaRavi Kumar N V, Indian Ins\n\t'

description: b'45th European Conference on Information Retrieval'
Categories: b'information retrieval' b'machine learning'
Call For Papers: b'\nThe 45th European Conference on Information Retrieval (ECIR) is the annual premier European forum for the presentation of new research results in the broadly conceived area of Information Retrieval. ECIR provides an opportunity for both young and established researchers to present research papers reporting new, unpublished, and innovative research results. ECIR has traditionally had a strong student focus and papers whose sole or main author is a postgraduate student or postdoctoral researcher are especially welcome. ECIR 2023 is planned to be held as a physical conference (with support for remote attendance) from the 2nd to the 6th of April 2023 in Dublin, Ireland.\n\t'
