title: b'RCRA 2022'
description: b'29th RCRA workshop on Experimental evaluation of algorithms for solving problems with combinatorial explosion'
Call For Papers: b'\n [APOLOGIES FOR MULTIPLE POSTINGS]\r *  ______________________________________________________________________  *\r      The RCRA group (Knowledge Representation & Automated Reasoning) of     \r         the AI*IA (Italian Association for Artificial Intelligence)        \r                               organizes the                                 \r                            29th RCRA workshop on                            \r              Experimental evaluation of algorithms for solving             \r              problems with combinatorial explosion (RCRA 2022)             \r          affiliated to the 16th International Conference on Logic           \r            Programming and Non-monotonic Reasoning (LPNMR 2022)            \r                  https://sites.google.com/view/lpnmr2022                   \r                    September, 5th, 2022; Genova, Italy                     \r      RCRA group web site: http://rcra.aixia.it/\r    Workshop web site:   TBA\r    e-mail:              marco@dibris.unige.it, M.Vallati@hud.ac.uk\r *  ______________________________________________________________________  *\r     This event follows the series of the RCRA (Knowledge\r    Representation and Automated Reasoning) annual meetings, held\r    since 1994.  The success of the previous events shows that RCRA is\r    becoming a major forum for exchanging ideas and proposing\r    experimentation methodologies for algorithms in Artificial\r    Intelligence.\r *  ______________________________________________________________________  *\r  IMPORTANT DATES \r Paper submission deadline: July 10th, 2022\rNotification of acceptance: August 1st, 2022\rFinal version of accepted original papers: August 22nd, 2022\rRCRA workshop:  September 5th, 2022\r AIMS AND SCOPE\r   Many problems in Artificial Intelligence show an exponential\r  explosion of the search space.  Although stemming from different\r  research areas in AI, such problems are often addressed with\r  algorithms that have a common goal: the effective exploration of\r  huge state spaces.  Many algorithms developed in one research area\r  are applicable to other problems, or can be hybridized with\r  techniques in other areas. Artificial Intelligence tools often\r  exploit or hybridize techniques developed by other research\r  communities, such as Operations Research.  In recent years, research\r  in Artificial Intelligence has more and more focused on experimental\r  evaluation of algorithms, the development of suitable methodologies\r  for experimentation and analysis, the study of languages and the\r  implementation of systems for the definition and solution of\r  problems.\r   Scope of the workshop is fostering the cross-fertilization of ideas\r  stemming from different areas, proposing benchmarks for new\r  challenging problems, comparing models and algorithms from an\r  experimental viewpoint, and, in general, comparing different\r  approaches with respect to efficiency, problem modeling, and ease of\r  development.\r   Topics of interest include, but are not limited to:\r  * Experimental evaluation of algorithms for\r       o knowledge representation\r       o automated reasoning\r       o planning\r       o scheduling\r       o machine learning\r       o model checking\r       o boolean satisfiability (SAT)\r       o constraint programming\r       o argumentation\r       o temporal reasoning\r       o combinatorial optimization\r       o quantified boolean formulae and quantified constraints\r       o modal logics\r       o logic programming\r       o answer set programming \r       o ontological reasoning       \r  * Definition and construction of benchmarks\r  * Experimentation methodologies\r  * Metaheuristics\r  * Algorithm hybridization\r  * Static analysis of combinatorial problems\r  * Languages and systems for definition and solution of problems\r  * Comparisons between systems and algorithms\r  * Application experiences (visualization, graphics, security, transports,...)\r  WORKSHOP CHAIRS\r\t Marco Maratea         University of Genova, Italy\r\t Mauro Vallati         University of Huddersfield, UK\r  HOST ORGANIZATION AND VENUE\r  University of Genova, Italy\r   The workshop will take place in Genova Nervi, Italy, in the \r  Collegio Emiliani (http://www.collegioemiliani.it/), which is a college \r  directly situated on the see.\r   Of course, we will continuously monitor the pandemic situation in \r  order to evaluate whether the conference can be indeed held as an \r  in-person event, or we will need to switch to a hybrid event, if not \r  completely on-line.\r SUBMISSIONS\r   Authors are invited to submit either original and non-original papers. \r   Publications showing negative results are welcome, provided that the\r  approach was original and very promising in principle, the\r  experimentation was well-conducted, the results obtained were\r  unforeseeable and gave important hints in the comprehension of the\r  target problem, helping other researchers to avoid unsuccessful\r  paths.\r   Workshop submissions must be in PDF format, do not exceed 15 (for\r  full papers) or 8 (for short papers) pages, and should be written in\r  LaTeX, using the LNCS style.\r   RCRA 2022 uses EasyChair for the submission of contributions.\r   Contributions must be submitted through this page:\r       https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=rcra2022\r   All submissions will be reviewed by at least three members of the\r  program committee (TBD).\r   CONTACT\r  In case of need, the workshop co-chairs can be contacted by sending\r  an email to:\r                   marco@dibris.unige.it, M.Vallati@hud.ac.uk\r  PROCEEDINGS\r CEUR-WS Proceedings:\rAccepted original papers will be published in the AIxIA series of \rCEUR-WS AI*IA Series on CEUR-WS.org (upon authors confirmation)\r Moreover, as in some previous editions (http://rcra.aixia.it/publications),\rwe are considering the possibility of having a special issue of an \rinternational journal, provided that a sufficient amount of high quality \rpapers is collected. All technical papers, original and non-original, \rwill be eligible.\r  HISTORY OF THE RECENT WORKSHOP SERIES\r   * RCRA 2021 as a workshop of AI*IA 2021, Virtual\r    https://rcra2020.wordpress.com/  \r  * RCRA 2020 as a workshop of AI*IA 2020, Virtual\r    https://rcra2020.wordpress.com/  \r  * RCRA 2018 as a workshop of FLoC 2018, Oxford, UK\r    http://rcra.aixia.it/rcra~2018   \r    Extended versions of the best papers will appear in a special\r    issue of Fundamenta Informaticae\r  * RCRA 2017 as a workshop of AI*IA 2017, Bari, Italy\r    http://rcra.aixia.it/rcra2017   \r    Extended versions of the best papers will appear in a special\r    issue of Fundamenta Informaticae\r  * RCRA 2016 as a workshop of AI*IA 2016, Genova, Italy\r    http://rcra.aixia.it/rcra2016    \r    Extended versions of the best papers will appear in a special\r    issue of JETAI\r  * RCRA 2015 as a workshop of AI*IA 2015, Ferrara, Italy\r    http://rcra.aixia.it/rcra2015\r    Extended versions of the best papers will appear in a special\r    issue of Fundamenta Informaticae\r  * RCRA 2014 as a workshop of SAT 2014, IJCAR 2014 and ICLP 2014,\r    Vienna, Austria - http://rcra.aixia.it/rcra2014\r    Extended versions of the best papers will appear in a special\r    issue of AI Communications\r  * Previous editions: http://rcra.aixia.it/workshops\r  \n'

title: b'FAVPQC 2022'
description: b'International Workshop on Formal Analysis and Verification of Post-Quantum Cryptographic Protocols'
Categories: b'computer science' b'cryptography' b'security' b'verification'
Call For Papers: b'\nINTERNATIONAL WORKSHOP ON FORMAL ANALYSIS AND VERIFICATION OF POST-QUANTUM CRYPTOGRAPHIC PROTOCOLS 2022\r This workshop will be held as an ICFEM 2022 (http://maude.ucm.es/ICFEM22/) satellite workshop, Madrid, Spain, October 24, 2022.\r It is known that the most popular public-key cryptosystems used today will become insecure once sufficient strong quantum computers become available. To prepare for information security in the quantum computing era, post-quantum cryptosystems that are resistant to attacks from quantum computers have been built as replacements for the classical ones. Security verification of those post-quantum cryptographic protocols has got extensive attention from cryptography and security research groups in recent years.\rNote that due to Covid-19, the workshop may be held in a hybrid style or completely virtual.\r TOPICS OF INTEREST\rAuthors are invited to submit papers describing original and unpublished work somehow related to formal analysis and verification of post-quantum cryptographic protocols. Topics of interest include, but are not limited to:\r- Post-quantum cryptsystems\r- Post-quantum cryptographic protocols\r- Logics of quantum computing/algorithms/programs\r- Formal analysis/verification of those related to the above-mentioned\r PUBLICATION\rProceedings shall be submitted to CEUR-WS.org (http://ceur-ws.org/) for online publication. Therefore, authors are supposed to use the CEUR-ART template style for preparing papers. In addition to regular papers (12 - 16 pages), authors are also recommended to submit short papers (6 - 8 pages), such as work-in-progress ones and tool demonstration ones. Papers submitted as regular papers may be accepted as short papers. We plan a joint special issue of a reputable journal together with International Conference on Practical and Theoretical Aspects of Logic, Cyber Security and Cryptography 2022 (https://cs.omu.edu.tr/blacksea2022/). The authors of a selected subset of accepted papers will be invited to submit extended versions of their papers to the special issue.\r PAPER SUBMISSIONS\rSubmissions must be uploaded to the following EasyChair website:\rhttps://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=favpqc2022\r- Paper submission due: September 15, 2022 (AoE)\r- Notification: September 30, 2022\r- Camera-ready: October 14, 2022\r CONTACT US\rDuong Dinh Tran\rEmail: duongtd@jaist.ac.jp\r  \n'

title: b'RTSS 2022'
description: b'Real-Time Systems Symposium'
Call For Papers: b'\nScope of the Conference\r The IEEE Real-Time Systems Symposium (RTSS) is the premier conference in the field of real-time systems, and is a venue for researchers and practitioners to showcase innovations covering all aspects of real-time systems including theory, design, analysis, implementation, evaluation and experience. RTSS\xe2\x80\x9922, celebrating the 43rd anniversary of the event, continues the trend of making RTSS an expansive and inclusive event, striving to embrace new and emerging areas of real-time systems research.\r RTSS\xe2\x80\x9922 welcomes submissions of high-quality, original research papers related to both real-time systems\xe2\x80\x99 theory and practice. Submissions can go to either the real-time systems track (Track 1) or the design and applications track (Track 2) which covers Cyber-Physical Systems, HW-SW integration and system-level design, and Internet of Things (IoT). To be in scope, ALL submissions must address some form of real-time requirements such as deadlines, response times or delay/latency. All accepted papers will appear in the main program and proceedings.\r RTSS especially welcomes new and emerging topics provided that they address some aspects of real-time requirements as stated above. Such topics may include machine learning techniques for the design and analysis of real-time systems, system design approaches for achieving real-time machine learning, resource management in autonomous systems, system-level solutions for real-time applications exploiting domain-specific accelerators, etc.\r Note the above list of topics is intended only as a rough guide and should not be understood as an exclusive list. Papers breaking new ground, departing from established subfields, or challenging the status quo are most welcome and are encouraged.\r Empirical survey-based research focused on the real-time systems field is also welcome. This type of research uses surveys, questionnaires, interviews, use-cases or other empirical techniques to obtain information about the past / current / future state of play in the research, design, development, verification, validation, and deployment of real-time systems. (Note literature surveys that classify, review, and summarize existing research papers are not considered empirical research and are not in scope of the conference).\r All accepted papers will appear in the main program and proceedings. A selection of papers will receive recognition as outstanding papers, and will be highlighted as such in the proceedings. Best paper and best student paper awards will be presented at the conference, along with an award for the best presentation. (Note that submissions are eligible for the best student paper award provided that the first author is a student as of the submission deadline).\r Track 1: Real-Time Systems Track\r The objective of this track is to promote cutting-edge research in real-time systems, especially new and emerging topics. Areas of interest include, but are not limited to the following: operating systems, networks, middleware, compilers, tools, scheduling, QoS support, resource management, testing and debugging, design and verification, modeling, WCET analysis, performance analysis, fault tolerance, security, and system experimentation and deployment experiences.\r Track 2: Design and Applications Track\r This track aims to highlight the newest research achievements in designs, implementations and applications that must attend to some aspects of real-time requirements. Continuing with the success in previous years, the track will particularly focus on four specialized areas:\r Cyber-Physical Systems\r CPS applications (such as transportation, healthcare, industrial control, etc.) interact with the physical worlds. Hence, they do possess real-time requirements. Papers that identify scientific foundations and technologies that advance the state-of-the-art for CPS are welcome. Topics of interest include (but are not limited to) foundations of CPS, design methods, simulation/emulation for CPS, tool chains, CPS architectures, security and privacy, hardware/software compositions that include physical components, performance analysis, robustness and safety, and analysis techniques and tools especially those with multiple temporal and spatial scales.\r HW-SW Integration and System\xe2\x80\x93Level Design\r This area focuses on design methodologies and tools for hardware/software integration and co-design of modern embedded systems for real-time applications. Topics include (but are not limited to) architecture description languages and tools, hardware architectures, design space exploration, synthesis and optimization. Of special interest are SoC design for real-time applications, special-purpose functional units, specialized memory structures, multi-core chips and communication aspects, FPGA simulation and prototyping, software simulation and compilation for novel architectures and applications, as well as power, thermal, timing and predictability analyses.\r Internet of Things (IoT)\r Grand challenges in IoT include extremely constrained resources (energy supply, storage and computational power) in IoT devices, unprecedented scalability requirements as well as uncertain dynamics in their operating environments. Submissions that build on solid theoretical foundations, present empirical development, and experimental evaluations for empowering IoT applications with real-time requirements are welcome.\r Paper Submissions\r Submitted papers must describe original work not previously published or concurrently submitted elsewhere. Papers based on previous work presented at workshops are eligible for submission \xe2\x80\x93 if the workshop paper has a digital object identifier (DOI) then the submission must contain at least 30% new material. All submitted papers must comply with the double-blind submission requirements. The main body of each submitted paper is limited to 11 pages of technical content with additional pages permitted for bibliography only. Submissions must be formatted according to IEEE conference paper guidelines.\r To submit a paper please visit: http://2022.rtss.org/submission/\r \n'

title: b'UPCON 2022'
description: b'9th IEEE UP SECTION INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ELECTRICAL, ELECTRONICS AND COMPUTER ENGINEERING'
Categories: b'computer science' b'electrical' b'electronics'
Call For Papers: b'\nCALL FOR PAPERS\r 9th IEEE UP SECTION INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ELECTRICAL, ELECTRONICS AND COMPUTER ENGINEERING (UPCON-2022)\rDecember 02-04, 2022\rIndian Institute of Information Technology Allahabad\rPrayagraj, Uttar Pradesh, India\r Webpage: https://upcon2022.iiita.ac.in/\r Greetings from IIIT Allahabad.\r It is a matter of immense pleasure to inform you that the Indian Institute of Information Technology, Allahabad (IIIT Allahabad), is going to organize the 9th IEEE UP SECTION INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ELECTRICAL, ELECTRONICS AND COMPUTER ENGINEERING (UPCON-2022) during December 02-04, 2022. The amount of Research and Development activities across the globe has been drastically scaled up from the past one decade, specifically, in the research areas of Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering. The UPCON-2022 aims to provide an excellent platform for researchers to present their research findings. The UPCON-2022 conference will feature Expert Talks by Eminent Researchers, Technical Sessions, and Workshops/ Tutorials/ Ph.D. Colloquiums. The conference is technically and financially sponsored by IEEE UP Section. \r The conference website is available at: https://upcon2022.iiita.ac.in/\r Following are some broad tracks of the Conference\r    1. Electronics Devices, Circuits and Systems\r    2. Network Technologies and Systems\r    3. Signal Processing\r    4. Data Mining and Big Data Analysis\r    5. Communication Technologies and Systems\r    6. Bioinformatics and Machine Learning Algorithms\r    7. Multimedia Processing Technologies and Systems\r    8. Power Systems\r    9. Language Technologies and Information Retrieval\r    10. Machines and Instrumentation\r    11. Robotics and Artificial Intelligence\r    12. Power Electronics and Control Engineering \r We request you to please submit your work and kindly encourage your colleagues and research scholars to share their research findings at UPCON-2022.\r The deadline for paper submission is July 31, 2022 @11.59 PM.\r Submission portal: https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/UPCON2022\r We look forward to your participation and support.\r With regards\r On behalf of UPCON-2022Organizing Committee\r Dr. Satish K. Singh, IIIT Allahabad, General Chair\rDr. Mohammed Javed, IIIT Allahabad, Organizing Chair\rDr. Navjot Singh, IIIT Allahabad, Organizing Chair\rContact Email: upcon2022@iiita.ac.in\rWebpage: https://upcon2022.iiita.ac.in\r \n'

Call For Papers: b'\nAIM: Advances in Image Manipulation workshop and challenges 2022\rIn conjunction with ECCV 2022\r Website: https://data.vision.ee.ethz.ch/cvl/aim22/\rContact: radu.timofte [at] uni-wuerzburg.de\r SCOPE\r  Image manipulation is a key computer vision task, aiming at the restoration of degraded image content, the filling in of missing information, or the needed transformation and/or manipulation to achieve a desired target (with respect to perceptual quality, contents, or performance of apps working on such images). Recent years have witnessed an increased interest from the vision and graphics communities in these fundamental topics of research. Not only has there been a constantly growing flow of related papers, but also substantial progress has been achieved.\r Each step forward eases the use of images by people or computers for the fulfillment of further tasks, as image manipulation serves as an important frontend. Not surprisingly then, there is an ever growing range of applications in fields such as surveillance, the automotive industry, electronics, remote sensing, or medical image analysis etc. The emergence and ubiquitous use of mobile and wearable devices offer another fertile ground for additional applications and faster methods.\r This workshop aims to provide an overview of the new trends and advances in those areas. Moreover, it will offer an opportunity for academic and industrial attendees to interact and explore collaborations.\r This workshop builds upon the success of the Advances in Image Manipulation (AIM) workshop at ICCV 2019, 2021 and ECCV 2020, the Mobile AI (MAI) workshop at CVPR 2021, 2022, the Perceptual Image Restoration and Manipulation (PIRM) workshop at ECCV 2018, the workshop and Challenge on Learned Image Compression (CLIC) editions at CVPR 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021 and 2022 and the New Trends in Image Restoration and Enhancement (NTIRE) editions: at CVPR 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021 and 2022 and at ACCV 2016. Moreover, it relies on the people associated with the PIRM, MAI, CLIC, and NTIRE events such as organizers, PC members, distinguished speakers, authors of published papers, challenge participants and winning teams.\r  TOPICS\r Papers addressing topics related to image/video manipulation, restoration and enhancement are invited. The topics include, but are not limited to:\r \xe2\x97\x8f    Image-to-image translation\r\xe2\x97\x8f    Video-to-video translation\r\xe2\x97\x8f    Image/video manipulation\r\xe2\x97\x8f    Perceptual manipulation\r\xe2\x97\x8f    Image/video generation and hallucination\r\xe2\x97\x8f    Image/video quality assessment\r\xe2\x97\x8f    Image/video semantic segmentation\r\xe2\x97\x8f    Perceptual enhancement\r\xe2\x97\x8f    Multimodal translation\r\xe2\x97\x8f    Depth estimation\r\xe2\x97\x8f    Image/video inpainting\r\xe2\x97\x8f    Image/video deblurring\r\xe2\x97\x8f    Image/video denoising\r\xe2\x97\x8f    Image/video upsampling and super-resolution\r\xe2\x97\x8f    Image/video filtering\r\xe2\x97\x8f    Image/video de-hazing, de-raining, de-snowing, etc.\r\xe2\x97\x8f    Demosaicing\r\xe2\x97\x8f    Image/video compression\r\xe2\x97\x8f    Removal of artifacts, shadows, glare and reflections, etc.\r\xe2\x97\x8f    Image/video enhancement: brightening, color adjustment, sharpening, etc.\r\xe2\x97\x8f    Style transfer\r\xe2\x97\x8f    Hyperspectral imaging\r\xe2\x97\x8f    Underwater imaging\r\xe2\x97\x8f    Aerial and satellite imaging\r\xe2\x97\x8f    Methods robust to changing weather conditions / adverse outdoor conditions\r\xe2\x97\x8f    Image/video manipulation on mobile devices\r\xe2\x97\x8f    Image/video restoration and enhancement on mobile devices\r\xe2\x97\x8f    Studies and applications of the above.\r  SUBMISSION\r  A paper submission has to be in English, in pdf format, and at most 14 pages (excluding references) in single-column, ECCV style. The paper format must follow the same guidelines as for all ECCV 2022 submissions.\r The review process is double blind. Authors do not know the names of the chair/reviewers of their papers. Reviewers do not know the names of the authors.\r Dual submission is not allowed. If a paper is submitted also to ECCV and accepted, the paper cannot be published both at the ECCV and the workshop.\r For the paper submissions, please go to the online submission site \rhttps://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/AIMWC2022/\r   WORKSHOP DATES\r \xe2\x97\x8f Submission Deadline: July 25, 2022\r\xe2\x97\x8f Decisions: August 15, 2022\r\xe2\x97\x8f Camera Ready Deadline: August 22, 2022\r  AIM 2022 has the following associated challenges (ONGOING!):\r \xe2\x97\x8f Compressed Input Super-Resolution\r\xe2\x97\x8f Reversed ISP\r\xe2\x97\x8f Instagram Filter Removal\r\xe2\x97\x8f Video Super-Resolution (Evaluation platform: MediaTek Dimensity APU) - Powered by MediaTek\r\xe2\x97\x8f Image Super-Resolution (Eval. platform: Synaptics Dolphin NPU) - Powered by Synaptics\r\xe2\x97\x8f Learned Smartphone ISP (Eval. platform: Snapdragon Adreno GPU) - Powered by OPPO\r\xe2\x97\x8f Bokeh Effect Rendering (Eval. platform: ARM Mali GPU) - Powered by Huawei\r\xe2\x97\x8f Depth Estimation (Eval. platform: Raspberry Pi 4) - Powered by Raspberry Pi \r  PARTICIPATION\r To learn more:\rhttps://data.vision.ee.ethz.ch/cvl/aim22/\r   ORGANIZERS (to be announced)\r     \xe2\x97\x8f Radu Timofte (University of W\xc3\xbcrzburg, Germany and ETH Z\xc3\xbcrich, Switzerland)\r   SPEAKERS (to be announced)\r  SPONSORS (to be announced)\r     JMU Wurzburg / CAIDAS\r    ETH Zurich / CVL\r  CONTACT\r Email: radu.timofte [at] uni-wuerzburg.de\rWebsite: https://data.vision.ee.ethz.ch/cvl/aim22/\r \n'

title: b'Computer SI on SE4RAI 2023'
description: b'Computer: Special Issue on Software Engineering for Responsible AI'
Categories: b'software engineering' b'responsible ai' b'artificial intelligence' b'machine learning'
Call For Papers: b'\nArtificial intelligence (AI) continues demonstrating its positive impact on society and successful adoptions in data-rich domains. The global AI market was valued at USD $62.35 billion in 2020 and is expected to grow with an annual growth rate of 40.2% from 2021 to 2028. Although AI is solving real-world challenges and transforming industries, there are serious concerns about its ability to make decisions in a responsible way, touching on lives and human values. Responsible AI is one of the greatest scientific challenges of our time and societies.\r In addition to existing and emerging regulations, many ethical principles and guidelines for responsible AI have also been issued by governments, research organizations, and enterprises. However, high-level regulations and ethical principles are far from ensuring the trustworthiness of AI systems. The issues go beyond traditional software code \xe2\x80\x9cbugs\xe2\x80\x9d and theoretical guarantees for algorithms. They require full lifecycle operationalized quality, regulatory compliance and ethical assurances from a software-engineering perspective. And even for a highly trustworthy AI system, gaining the trust from individuals, domain experts, and wider communities is another challenge that must be addressed carefully for the AI system to be widely accepted.\r In this special issue, we are looking for cutting-edge software-engineering methods, techniques, tools, and real-world case studies that can help operationalize responsible AI. Topics of interests include, but are not limited to:\r Requirement engineering for responsible AI\r - Software architecture and design of responsible AI systems\r- Software verification and validation for responsible AI systems\r- DevOps, AIOps, and MLOps for responsible AI systems\r- Development processes for responsible AI systems\r- Governance of responsible AI\r- Software engineering for explainable AI\r- Reproducibility and traceability of AI\r- Trust and trustworthiness of AI systems\r- Human-centric AI systems and human values in AI systems\r Submission Guidelines\r For author information and guidelines on submission criteria, please visit the Author Information page. Please submit papers through the ScholarOne system, and be sure to select the special-issue name. Manuscripts should not be published or currently submitted for publication elsewhere. Please submit only full papers intended for review, not abstracts, to the ScholarOne portal.\r Questions?\r Contact the guest editors at co4-23@computer.org.\r Guest editors:\r Dr. Qinghua Lu, CSIRO\xe2\x80\x99s Data61, Australia\rProf. Liming Zhu, CSIRO\xe2\x80\x99s Data61, Australia\rProf. Jon Whittle, CSIRO\xe2\x80\x99s Data61, Australia\rProf. Bret Michael, Naval Postgraduate School, USA\n\t'

title: b'MDA AI&PR 2023'
description: b'MDA AI&PR 2023 : 18th International Conference on Mass Data Analysis of Images and Signals with Applications in Medicine, r/g/b Biotechnology, Food Industries and Dietetics, Biomet'
Categories: b'signal\xe2\x84\x91 processing' b'pattern recognition' b'2d/3d image analysis' b'signal\xe2\x84\x91 interpretation'
Call For Papers: b'\nMDA AI&PR 2023\r18th International Conference on Mass Data Analysis of Images and Signals with Applications in Medicine, r/g/b Biotechnology, Food Industries and Dietetics, Biometry and Security, Agriculture, Drug Discover, and System Biology\rJuly 8 - 11, 2023, New York, USA\rwww.mda-signals.de\r Chair\t\rPetra Perner\tInstitute of Computer Vision and applied Computer Sciences IBaI, Germany\r Program Committee\rto be announced...\r The Scope of the Conference\r The automatic analysis of images and signals in medicine, biotechnology, System Biology, chemistry, biometry, drug discovery and information robots is a challenging and demanding field. Signal-producing procedures by microscopes, spectrometers and other sensors have found their way into wide fields of medicine, biotechnology, economy and environmental analysis. With this arises the problem of the automatic mass analysis of signal information. Signal-interpreting systems which generate automatically the desired target statements from the signals are therefore of compelling necessity. The continuation of mass analyses on the basis of the classical procedures leads to investments of proportions that are not feasible. New procedures and system architectures are therefore required. The scope of conference is to bring together researcher, praticioners and industry people who are dealing with mass analysis of images and signals to present and discuss recent research in these fields. \r The goals of this conference are to:\r * provide a forum for identifying important contributions and opportunities for research    \r  on mass data analysis of signals and images,\r* promote the systematic study of how to apply automatic signal/image analysis and \r  interpretation procedures to that field\r* show case applications of mass data analysis in biology, medicine, and chemistry.\r Topics of interest include (but are not limited to):\r     Applications in Medicine, r/g/b Biotechnology, Food Industries and Dietetics, \r    Biometry and Agriculture\r    Techniques and developments of signal and image producing procedures\r    Object matching and object tracking in microscopic and video microscopic images\r    1D, 2D and 3D shape analysis and description\r    1D, 2D and 3D feature extraction of texture, structure and location\r    Algorithms for 1D, 2D and 3D signal analysis and interpretation\r    Image segmentation algorithms\r    Parallelization of image analysis and interpretation algorithms\r    Semantic tagging of microscopic images\r    Applications in medicine, biotechnology, chemistry and others\r    Applications in crystallography\r    Applications in proteomics\r    Applications in 2D and 3D cell images analysis\r    Image Acquisition procedures for mass data analysis\r    Methods and solutions for biometrical systems (Face-, Iris and Fingerprint \r    Recognition)\r    Recognition methods for moving objects (face, iris, body)\r    Methods for data encryption (e.g. crypotographic methods, watermarking)\r Important Dates\rDeadline for paper submission: February 15, 2023\rNotification of acceptance: March 18, 2023\rSubmission of camera-ready copy: April 05, 2023\r Authors can submit their papers via an on-line reviewing system.: Please submit the PDF-File of your camera-ready paper through the COMMENCE conference management system (http://www.mda-signals.de/CMS/). If you have any problems with the system please do not hesitate to contact info@mda-signals.de. Papers must be formatted in the Springer LNCS format. They should have at most 15 pages. Papers will be reviewed by the program committee.\r Publications\rAccepted papers will appear in the proceeding book.Extended versions of selected papers will be published in a special issue of the Intern. Journal Transactions on Mass-Data Analysis of Images and Signals (ISSN: 1868-6451) after the conference.\n\t'

title: b'Breaking the Hold of Tradition 2022'
description: b'Breaking the Hold of Tradition'
Categories: b'poetry' b'literature' b'feminism'
Call For Papers: b'\nThis panel welcomes proposals about the lives and works of post-modern and contemporary American women poets (1950\xe2\x80\x99s to present), potentially expanding on how the medium of poetry aids in establishing a voice for women who have historically been silenced and marginalized. Panelists might explore how post-modern and contemporary American women poets were and are in conversation with other poets who wrote before them and how these new feminist voices (particularly from the Women\xe2\x80\x99s Movement), still echoed in poets writing today, changed the landscape of American poetry. As Adrienne Rich said, \xe2\x80\x9cWe need to know the writing of the past and know it differently than we have ever known it, not to pass on a tradition but to break its hold over us.\xe2\x80\x9d Submissions might also include thoughts on the construction of female identity, sexism, and societal inequities. Papers should focus on one particular poet and the historical context within which she was (or is) writing. Please submit a 250-word abstract and a brief bio by July 25th to didi.jackson@vanderbilt.edu.\n\t'

title: b'SAMLA 2022'
description: b'White Supremacist Revisions of the American Narrative '
Categories: b'american studies' b'race & ethnicity' b'cultural studies'
Call For Papers: b'\nWhite Supremacist Revisions of the American Narrative \r National narratives are iterative projects that can never quite arrive at the truth, and public understandings of American history and culture have always been destabilized by white supremacist perspectives and the misappropriation of information. As white supremacist voices are (re)mainstreamed and elevated, the fracturing of the American text only accelerates. In keeping with this year\'s SAMLA conference theme of "Change," this session invites submissions related to the ways white supremacist and ethno-nationalist ideologues attempt to overwrite, erase, or reinterpret some component of the American narrative. \r Depending on the level of response, priority will be given to relatively recent or ongoing activity. Consideration of the roles of academic research, journalism, and other forms of public discourse in countering these textual revisions is especially welcome. By July 10, please submit an abstract of 250 words, a brief bio, and any A/V or scheduling requests to Laura Jeffries, Florida State College at Jacksonville, at jeffries@fscj.edu.\n\t'

title: b'BESC(IEPCE) 2022'
description: b'Special Session of The 9th International Conference on Behavioral and Social Computing: Intelligent E-learning at Post-COVID19 Era'
Categories: b'e-learning ' b'education technology' b'online education' b'MOOC'
Call For Papers: b'\nAIMS AND SCOPE OF IEPCE SPECIAL SESSION\r---------------------------------------\rThe COVID-19 pandemic has accelerated the development of e-learning and the evolution of education. Multiple online, blended, and hybrid delivery modes have become the norm, with wide-ranging resources being allocated and infrastructure being established to enable learners to access online learning activities and promote instructor-learner and learner-learner interaction when learning online. With greater accessibility to e-learning, there is a clear route for the next generation of e-learners. In the post COVID-19 era, one can expect an increasing need for pedagogically sound and adaptive e-learning environments with high capacity and maneuverability to supplement the resumed learning after the pandemic. In the near future, the integration of information and communication technologies, artificial intelligence, augmented and virtual reality, and gamification into instruction and learning will be further enhanced, making e-learning a vital component of school learning. Traditional offline learning and e-learning would go hand in hand, improving the learning experiences for learners of all ages.\r This special session, Intelligent E-learning at Post-COVID19 Era (IEPCE), aims to discuss the development and implementation of intelligent e-learning models with high scalability and adaptability in the post-COVID era. We also call on investigating e-learning adaptation and learning environment optimization for effective and rapid response to future pandemics like the COVID19 pandemic. Topics of interest in the special issue of IEPCE include but are not limited to the following:\r AI, AR/VR, and gamification for intelligent e-learning.\rOnline education in the post COVID-19 era.\rMOOC\xe2\x80\x99s innovative development in the post-COVID-19 era.\rDeep neural networks for smart e-learning.\rHybrid or blended e-learning.\rTeaching and learning evaluation in the post COVID-19 era.\rIntegration of offline learning and e-learning in the post COVID-19 era.\rTechnology proficiency development.\rScalable and easily adaptable e-learning models.\rCollaborative and inclusive e-learning.\rStudent modeling for intelligent e-learning.\rChallenges and opportunities for e-learning in the post COVID-19 era.\rE-learning adaptation and optimization to unexpected crises.\r   REVIEW PROCESS AND INDEX\r--------------------------\rEach paper will be reviewed by at least two programme committee members, and final decisions are given by the guest editorial board based on the scores given by the reviewers of this special issue. Submissions to accepted special sessions will be 6 pages in IEEE two-column style. The page count above excludes the references.\r All papers will be reviewed by the Program Committee on the basis of technical quality, relevance to BESC 2022, originality, significance and clarity. Please note:\r All Special Session paper submissions should use IEEE two-column style. Templates are available from http://www.ieee.org/conferences_events/conferences/publishing/templates.html.\rAll Special Session papers must be submitted electronically through the paper submission system in PDF format only.\rSubmitted papers must not substantially overlap with papers that have been published or that are simultaneously submitted to a journal or a conference with proceedings.\rPapers must be clearly submitted in English and will be selected based on their originality, timeliness, significance, relevance, and clarity of presentation.\rSubmission of a paper should be regarded as a commitment that, should the paper be accepted, at least one of the authors will register and attend the conference to present the work.\rPaper submission system is available at: https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=besc2022\r All accepted papers will be included in IEEE Xplore and indexed by EI. Top-quality papers after presented in the conference will be selected for extension and publication in several special issues of international journals, e.g., World Wide Web Journal (Springer), Web Intelligence, and Social Network Analysis and Mining (Springer)\r   LIST OF SPECIAL SESSION CHAIR\r-----------------------------\rGeneral Chair\rXieling Chen, The Education University of Hong Kong\r Technical Programme Co-Chairs\rZongxi Li, Hong Kong Metropolitan University, Hong Kong\rGuangliang Chen, Monash University, Australia\rWei Chen, Chinese Academy of Agricultural Sciences, China\r Steering Committee Co-Chairs\rGary Cheng, The Education University of Hong Kong, Hong Kong\rTak-Lam Wong, Douglas College, Canada\rHaoran Xie, Lingnan University, Hong Kong\rDi Zou, The Education University of Hong Kong\r Honorary Co-Chairs\rGwo-Jen Hwang, National Taiwan University of Science and Technology, Taiwan\rFu Lee Wang, Hong Kong Metropolitan University, Hong Kong\r Program Committee Members\rSudeng Hu, Apple Inc., USA\rXudong Mao, Sun Yat-sen University, China\rYanghui Rao, Sun Yat-sen University, China\rTao Wang, Southampton University, UK\rQingyuan Wu, Beijing Normal University, China\rBishenghui Tao, Macau University of Science and Technology, Macau\rYalin Liu, Macau University of Science and Technology, Macau\rHan Zhang, Chinese University of Hong Kong, Hong Kong\rSu Fan, The Education University of Hong Kong, Hong Kong\rRuofei Zhang, The Education University of Hong Kong, Hong Kong\r CONTACTS\r-------------\rAll inquiries about the conference, including submissions, can be directed to the organising committee: ieee.besc@gmail.com and zongxili2@gmail.com\n\t'

title: b'IEEE PriComp 2022'
description: b'The 2022 IEEE International Conference on Privacy Computing'

Call For Papers: b'\nCFP IEEE PriComp 2022\rThe 2022 IEEE International Conference on Privacy Computing\rDec. 15-18, Haikou, China\r[Submission Deadline: Sep. 1]\r http://pricomp2022.privacycomputing.net\r PriComp 2022 is the 8th in this series of conferences started in 2015 that are devoted to algorithms and architectures for Privacy Computing. PriComp conference provides a forum for academics and practitioners from countries around the world to exchange ideas for improving the efficiency, performance, reliability, security and interoperability of Privacy Computing systems and applications.\r Following the traditions of the previous successful PriComp conferences held in Fuzhou, China (2015); Qingdao, China (2016); Melbourne, Australia (2017); Boppard, Germany (2018); Canterbury, UK (2019); Hainan, China (2020) and Xi\xe2\x80\x99an, Shanghai, China (online, 2021); PriComp 2022 will be held in Haikou, China. PriComp 2022 will focus on an evolving pathway from privacy protection to privacy computing, by serving as an international premier forum for engineers and scientists in academia, industry, and government to address the resulting profound challenges and to present and discuss their new ideas, research results, applications and experience on all aspects of privacy computing. The conference of PriComp 2022 is co-organized by Chinese Information Processing Society of China, Institute of Information Engineering, CAS, and Hainan University.\r    ================== \rImportant Dates\r==================\rWorkshop Proposal: July 15, 2022\rPaper Submission: September 01, 2022\rAuthor Notification: October 01, 2022\rCamera-Ready Submission: October 31, 2022\rConference Date: Decemeber 15-18, 2022\r  ================== \rTopics of interest include, but are not limited to\r==================\r- Theories and foundations for privacy computing\r- Programming languages and compilers for privacy computing\r- Privacy computing models\r- Privacy metrics and formalization\r- Privacy taxonomies and ontologies\r- Privacy information management and engineering  \r- Privacy operation and modeling\r- Data utility and privacy loss\r- Cryptography for privacy protection\r- Privacy protection based information hiding and sharing\r- Data analytics oriented privacy control and protection\r- Privacy-aware information collection\r- Privacy sensing and distribution\r- Combined and comprehensive privacy protection\r- Privacy-preserving data publishing\r- Private information storage\r- Private integration and synergy\r- Private information exchange and sharing\r- Privacy inference and reasoning\r- Internet and web privacy\r- Cloud privacy\r- Social media privacy\r- Mobile privacy\r- Location privacy\r- IoT privacy\r- Behavioral advertising\r- Privacy in large ecosystems such as smart cities\r- Privacy of AI models and systems\r- AI for privacy computing\r- Privacy and blockchain\r- User-centric privacy protection solutions\r- Human factors in privacy computing\r- Privacy nudging\r- Automated solutions for privacy policies and notices\r- Legal issues in privacy computing and other interdisciplinary topics\r  ================== \rPaper Submission\r==================\rAll papers need to be submitted electronically through the conference submission website (http://pricomp2022.privacycomputing.net) with PDF format. At least one of the authors of any accepted paper is requested to register the paper at the conference.\r  ================== \rOrganizing Committee\r==================\rGeneral Chairs\r- Fenghua Li,  Institute of Information Engineering, CAS, China\r- Laurence T. Workshops aim at examining an area in a less formal, open environment for the free exchange of views, and possibly in a more focused way than in the main track of the conference itself. title: b'IEEE CCNC 2023'
description: b'20th IEEE Consumer Communications & Networking Conference'
Call For Papers: b"\nCALL FOR TECHNICAL PAPERS\rIEEE CCNC 2023\r The IEEE Consumer Communications and Networking Conference (CCNC), sponsored by the IEEE Communications Society, is a major annual international conference. Taking advantage of its co-location with the International Consumer Electronics Show (CES), which is the world's largest tradeshow on consumer technology, CCNC is organized with the objective of bringing together researchers, developers, and practitioners from academia and industry working in all areas of consumer communications and networking technologies. CCNC 2023 will feature high-quality keynotes, plenary talks, technical and industry papers, panels, tutorials, and demonstrations. In addition, the CCNC 2023 Organization Committee invites members of the research, development, and practitioner communities to submit Workshop and Special Session proposals. Workshops provide a forum for people to discuss areas of special interest with like-minded researchers and practitioners. Special Sessions complement the main program with new or emerging topics that are of particular interest to the consumer communications and networking community and may also cut across and beyond disciplines traditionally represented at CCNC. Research contributions are welcome in all areas pertinent to consumer communications and networking, including:\r\xe2\x97\x8f\tEdge/Cloud Computing and Networking\r\xe2\x97\x8f\tNetworking Solutions for Social Applications, Multimedia, and Games\r\xe2\x97\x8f\tNext Generation Wireless Protocols: MAC and Above\r\xe2\x97\x8f\tWireless Communications: Fundamentals and PHY\r\xe2\x97\x8f\tBeyond 5G and Towards 6G\r\xe2\x97\x8f\tIoT: From Sensors to Vertical Applications\r\xe2\x97\x8f\tSecurity, Privacy, and Content Protection\r\xe2\x97\x8f\tWearable Computing Systems: Devices,  Applications, and Analytics\r\xe2\x97\x8f\tCommunications and Applications for Connected and Autonomous Vehicles on Land, Water, and Sky\r\xe2\x97\x8f\tAI/ML for Communications and Networking\r Prospective authors are invited to submit high-quality original technical papers to the appropriate track(s) listed below.  All accepted technical papers are required to be presented at the conference and will be published in the IEEE CCNC 2023 Conference Proceedings and submitted to IEEE Xplore\xc2\xae as well as other Abstracting and Indexing (A&I) databases.  In addition, authors that have a demonstration component in their work are highly encouraged to also submit proposals to the Demonstration Session as soon as the call opens.\r  All papers for the technical tracks should be submitted via EDAS, and please make sure to follow the Submission Guidelines. All submissions should be written in English with a maximum paper length of six pages (10-point font) including figures.\rAny questions should be submitted to the respective Track Co-chairs.\rTrack 1 \xe2\x80\x93 Edge/Cloud Computing and Networking\rTrack Chairs: \rKyunghan Lee, Seoul National University, South Korea (email: kyunghanlee@snu.ac.kr)\rBerk Canberk, Instanbul Technology University, Turkey (email: canberk@itu.edu.tr)\r Track 2 \xe2\x80\x93 Networking Solutions for Social Applications, Multimedia, and Games\rTrack Chairs: \rOmbretta Gaggi, University of Padua, Italy (email: gaggi@math.unipd.it)\rMarco Furini, University of Modena and Reggio Emilia, Italy (email: marco.furini@unimore.it)\r Track 3 \xe2\x80\x93 Next Generation Wireless Protocols: MAC and Above\rHu Jin, Hanyang University, South Korea (email: hjin@hanyang.ac.kr)\rShiwen Mao, Auburn University, USA (email: shiwen.mao@gmail.com)\r Track 4 \xe2\x80\x93 Wireless Communications: Fundamentals and PHY\rKoji Ishibashi, The University of Electro-Communications, Japan (email: koji@ieee.org)\rSwades De, Indian Institute of Technology Delhi, India (email: swadesd@ee.iitd.ac.in)\r Track 5 \xe2\x80\x93 Beyond 5G and Towards 6G\rTrack Chairs: \rJosep M. Jornet, Northeastern University, USA (email: jmjornet@buffalo.edu)\rJohann M. Marquez-Barja, University of Antwerp, Belgium (email: johann@marquez-barja.com)\r Track 6 \xe2\x80\x93 IoT: From Sensors to Vertical Applications\rTrack Chairs:\rPrem Prakash Jayaraman, Swinburne University of Technology, Australia (email: pjayaraman@swin.edu.au)\rRaffaele Gravina, University of Calabria, Italy (email: r.gravina@dimes.unical.it)\r Track 7 \xe2\x80\x93 Security, Privacy, and Content Protection\rTrack Chairs:\rKiho Lim, William Paterson University of New Jersey, USA (email: limk2@wpunj.edu)\rShamik Sengupta, University of Nevada, Reno, USA (email: ssengupta@unr.edu)\r Track 8 \xe2\x80\x93 Wearable Computing Systems: Devices, Applications, and Analytics\rTrack Chairs: \rJoongheon Kim, Korea University, Republic of Korea (email: joongheon@korea.ac.kr)\rHassan Ghasemzadeh, Washington State University, USA (email: hassan.ghasemzadeh@wsu.edu)\r Track 9 \xe2\x80\x93 Communications and Applications for Connected and Autonomous\rVehicles on Land, Water, and Sky\rTrack Chairs:\rChristoph Sommer, TU Dresden, Germany (email: sommer@ccs-labs.org)\rYacine Ghamri-Doudane, University of la Rochelle, France (email: yacine.ghamri@univ-mlv.fr)\r Track 10 \xe2\x80\x93 AI/ML for Communications and Networking\rTrack Chairs: \rHyun Jong Yang, POSTECH, South Korea (email: hyunyang@postech.ac.kr)\rMelike Erol-Kantarci, University of Ottawa, Canada (email: melike.erolkantarci@uottawa.ca)\r \n"

title: b' Postdoctoral Program 2022'
description: b' Postdoctoral Program:  Social Sciences and Humanities in a Post-Crisis Period'
Categories: b'social sciences'
Call For Papers: b'\n This program is designed to advance the academic and professional careers of Ph.D. holders through collaboration with experienced research advisers and participation in multidisciplinary and international research groups together with other post-doctoral fellows.\rThe language of the program is English and Spanish.\r Every selected fellow will deal with a specific societal challenge through attending lectures, courses, and scientific conferences while leaving time for guided research.\rThe ESI postdoctoral program facilitates the process of academic mobility. Each candidate would be part of a research visit in Spain, Italy, Poland, the Czech Republic, Latvia, Georgia, India, Indonesia, Turkey, Cuba, or China at one of the partner Universities. During the research visit, the candidate will participate in the ESI annual conference, working group meetings, workshops and may deliver guest lectures at the host University.\rIn times full of challenges with the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, the world, more than ever, needs further academic advancement. The selected fellows will work on selected topics in the area of social sciences and humanities (Pedagogy, economics, education, law, sociology, philosophy, psychology, history, geography, political science, health care, tourism, music, anthropology, and related fields and their subdomains).\r postdoc@euinstitute.net\r\n'

title: b'EEG-BCI 2022'
description: b'Real-Life Wearable EEG-Based BCI: Open Challenges'
Categories: b'BCI' b'EEG' b'AI' b'human machine interaction'
Call For Papers: b'\nThe evolution from clinical EEG devices to wearable ones has opened a new field of brain\xe2\x80\x93computer interface (BCI) applications in real-life scenarios that require multidisciplinary competencies. Recent advances in wearable sensing technology are enabling new methods for data acquisition and collection, moving BCIs from research labs to home and making them more pervasive in real-life scenarios. \r This Special Issue aims to highlight the current challenges and future perspectives that arise in the field of wearable EEG-based BCIs, especially when considering in-home and real-life healthcare and wellbeing applications.\r Possible topics include but are not limited to:\r Innovative wearable devices in terms of technological solutions (e.g., peculiar caps, new sensors, efficient communication devices);\rEfficient, reliable, and secure communication protocols and data protection tools (e.g., cloud-based data collection, Bluetooth);\rMultimodal approaches to support wearable EEG-based BCIs (e.g., multiple sensor data acquisition, integration with IoT devices);\rReal-time data processing (e.g., signal processing, feature engineering, machine learning methodologies);\rSignal quality in terms of reliability and accuracy of the collected data (e.g., electrode number and typology, artifacts, comparisons between signals obtained through clinical devices and consumer-grade sensors);\rHuman\xe2\x80\x93machine interaction (e.g., ergonomics, user acceptance, protocols);\rApplication fields closely related to healthcare and wellbeing, especially in real-life and in-home scenarios (e.g., applications that guarantee a continuous assistance in patients\xe2\x80\x99 follow-up treatment, patient-self-managed treatment at home, general wellbeing monitoring);\rNeurosecurity and neuroethics (e.g., data protection, possible exploits, data usage).\r Dr. Silvia Elena Corchs\rProf. Francesca Gasparini\rDr. Aurora Saibene\rGuest Editors\n\t'

title: b'INMIC 2022'
description: b'24th IEEE International Multitopic Conference'
Categories: b'computer science' b'business analytics' b'data science' b'networks and systems'
Call For Papers: b'\nOverview\rIEEE International Multi Topic Conference, INMIC (International Conference on Emerging Technologies) is the flagship annual conference of IEEE in Pakistan. The conference is a prestigious venue where top-of-the-line researchers and scientists come together to present their novel research contributions and to disseminate the results. It also presents an excellent opportunity to graduate students and PhD scholars to publish their research work in various computing disciplines. The 24th version of the conference is to be organized by National University of Computer and Emerging Sciences, NU FAST, Islamabad, Pakistan.\r Topics\rINMIC is recognized as a prestigious technical conference with a scope covering new and exciting technologies and research areas, thereby inviting the interest of a large audience. The conference covers a diverse range of topics related to emerging technologies in diverse emerging fields. It provides an opportunity for researchers working in diverse topics to meet, present, and discuss their ideas and research. The scope of the conference includes the following tracks, but are not limited to:\r Track 1. Data Science and Applications \r\xe2\x80\xa2 Mathematics and statistics for data science and analytics\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Data Science and Advanced Analytic Methods: active learning, classification, clustering, dimensionality reduction, feature selection, missing data imputation, multi-label and multi-dimensional classification, multi-output regression, online learning, reinforcement learning, regularization, semi-supervised learning, spatial statistics, statistical learning theory, time series analysis, autoML, transfer learning.\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Domain-driven data science and analytics practice.\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Deep Learning: architectures, convolutional neural: networks, deep reinforcement learning, generative models, tensor deep stacking networks.\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Social Network Analysis and Mining\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge graphs, Computational models and representation for data science\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Data Mining and Knowledge Discovery Approaches\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Machine Learning Techniques for Big Data\r Track 2. Business Analytics\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Accounting analytics\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Financial analytics\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Supply chain and logistics analytics\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Marketing & HR analytics\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Building analysis models and simulations\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Business financing & investments\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Consumer analytics and marketing strategy\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Decision analysis and support systems\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Business planning\r Track 3. Software & Systems Engineering\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Artificial intelligence and machine learning for software engineering\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Automated Software Engineering\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Evidence-based Software Engineering (EBSE)\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Model-driven software engineering (MDE)\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Requirements engineering\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Software architectures\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Service-oriented architectures, microservices and Cloud services\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Software evolution and maintenance\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Software processes and project organization\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Mobile applications and Web-based systems\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Software Testing and Analysis\r Track 4. Wireless and Cyber Security\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Information, network and applications security\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Internet-of-Thing, fog computing and cloud security and privacy\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Security and privacy for wireless applications\r\xe2\x80\xa2 AI-based Security and Privacy\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Cryptographic Methods and Toolkits\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Security and privacy for smart devices\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Data Protection\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Malware Detection and Analysis\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Privacy, Traceability, and Anonymity\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Software security and secure coding\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Blockchain and distributed ledger security\r Track 7. b'

4th International Conference on Natural Language Computing and AI (NLCAI 2023)

March 18 ~ 19, 2023, Vienna, Austria

Scope & Topics

4th International Conference on Natural Language Computing and AI (NLCAI 2023) will provide an excellent international forum for sharing knowledge and results in theory, methodology and applications of Computer Science and Information Technology. The Conference looks for significant contributions to all major fields of the Computer Science and Information Technology in theoretical and practical aspects. The aim of the conference is to provide a platform to the researchers and practitioners from both academia as well as industry to meet and share cutting-edge development in the field.

Authors are solicited to contribute to the conference by submitting articles that illustrate research results, projects, surveying works and industrial experiences that describe significant advances in the areas of Natural Language Computing and AI.

Topics of interest include, but are not limited to, the following

  • Artificial Intelligence, Deep Learning\r
  • Big Data and Data Mining\r
  • Chunking/Shallow Parsing\r
  • Dialog Systems\r
  • Discourse\r
  • Information Extraction / Retrieval\r
  • Lexical Semantics\r
  • Linguistic Resources\r
  • Machine Learning for NLP\r
  • Machine Translation, Cross lingual and Multilingual applications\r
  • Natural Language Processing\r
  • Ontology\r
  • Paraphrasing/Entailment/Generation\r
  • Phonology, Morphology\r
  • POS Tagging\r
  • Question Answering\r
  • Semantic Processing\r
  • Social Media and Social Network Analysis\r
  • Spoken Language Processing Speech Generation and Recognition\r
  • Statistical and Knowledge based Methods\r
  • Text Mining

Paper Submission

Authors are invited to submit papers through the conference Submission System by October 20, 2022 . Submissions must be original and should not have been published previously or be under consideration for publication while being evaluated for this conference. The proceedings of the conference will be published by Computer Science Conference Proceedings in Computer Science & Information Technology (CS & IT) series (Confirmed).

Selected papers from NLCAI 2023, after further revisions, will be published in the special issue of the following journals.

  • International Journal on Natural Language Computing (IJNLC)
  • International Journal of Web & Semantic Technology (IJWesT)
  • Machine Learning and Applications: An International Journal (MLAIJ)
  • International Journal of Computer Science & Information Technology (IJCSIT) \xe2\x80\x93 INSPEC, WJCI Indexed
  • International Journal of Artificial Intelligence & Applications (IJAIA)

Important Dates

Submission Deadline: October 20, 2022
Authors Notification: December 20, 2022
Final Manuscript Due: December 28, 2022
'

title: b'GBL-HICSS 2023'
description: b'Game-based Learning Minitrack - Hawaii International Conference on System Sciences'
Categories: b'game-based learning' b'educational games' b'gamification'
Call For Papers: b'\nGame-based learning (GBL) broadly refers to learning and education that involves characteristics of games and play in their design, pedagogy, praxis, culture or teacher and learner experience. Game-based learning is a broad field of research and practice and contains under its umbrella for example the following key concepts: educational games, serious games, gamification of learning, games-with-a-purpose, science games, simulation games, and smart toys.\r Gamefulness has increasingly become an integral part of any learning and education, and its rise is based on the premise that games are able to invoke beneficial engagement, interest, and motivation as well as cognitive, emotional, and social skill development.\r To advance the literature on GBL, this minitrack encourages submissions from any disciplinary background reporting different kinds of studies: e.g., empirical studies, case studies, methods and techniques, conceptual frameworks, and literature reviews. Beyond the title of the minitrack, the minitrack covers research and practice framed as related to neighboring concepts such as educational games, serious games, gamified learning, single- and multiplayer games for learning, simulation, and training games, gameful design, etc. Studies should cover, but are not limited to, the following issues:\r - Users: e.g., studies on the effects of GBL on usability, engagement, experience, motivations, user/player types, individual differences, user modeling, etc.\r- Educational science: educational effectiveness of GBL, educational theories and their application in GBL, games as assessment tools, games as educational research tools, pedagogical models for GBL, instructional design of GBL, learning mechanisms in GBL, emotions and affective interaction.\r- Computing: Computational aspects involving GBL, e.g., tangible and physical computing, artificial intelligence / data-driven approaches, algorithms, frameworks, architectures, etc.\r- Technology: e.g., GBL in mobile games, procedural content generation, etc.\r- Arts & Design: e.g., user interface design, emotional design, design of learning mechanics, mapping instructional methods to game mechanics, inclusive design and accessibility issues, narratives, media, and & languages in GBL, localization in GBL, .\r- Culture: e.g., socio-cultural relations involving GBL, Anthropology, and poetics in GBL, bodies, gender, and politics in GBL, etc.\r- Pedagogy: pedagogical aspects (e.g., personalization, collaborative learning, blended learning, cognitive process, intellectual skills, edutainment, etc) in GBL.\r- Learning analytics: e.g., adaptivity and personalization in GBL, studies involving GBL in the learning analytics process, game-mechanics adaptation based on learning data.\r- Health: GBL for health, effects of GBL in health, health literacy, behavioral change..\r- Theories/concepts/methods: e.g., contributions to science around GBL\r- Ethics: i.e., general ethical aspects involving GBL.\r Authors of accepted papers have the option to fast-track extended versions of their HICSS papers to:\r - Smart Learning Environments\r- Internet Research\r- AIS Transactions on Human-Computer Interaction\r- Frontiers in AI for Human Learning and Behavior Change\r Minitrack Co-Chairs:\r Wilk Oliveira (Primary Contact)\rTampere University\rwilk.oliveira@tuni.fi\r Juho Hamari\rTampere University\rjuho.hamari@tuni.fi\r Kristian Kiili\rTampere University\rkristian.kiili@tuni.fi\r Julita Vassileva\rUniversity of Saskatchewan\rjiv@cs.usask.ca\n\t'

title: b'EAI BlockTEA  2022'
description: b'EAI BlockTEA 2022 - 2nd EAI International Conference on Blockchain Technology and Emerging Applications'
Categories: b'networks & communications'
Call For Papers: b'\nEAI BlockTEA 2022 will be held as a fully-fledged online conference.\r Scope\rMotivated by the success of cryptocurrency, blockchain technology has been emerging as a potential technology to be applied in various domains, including finance, computer science, electronic engineering, agriculture, healthcare and more. The blockchain-based emerging applications are able to aid the current systems and networks by leveraging the benefits provided by blockchain technology, such as a decentralized, immutable, and cryptographically secured ledger. The aim of BlockTEA is to bring together researchers and practitioners from different disciplines and discuss the recent advancement in blockchain and its emerging applications. BlockTEA is sponsored by EAI and selected papers based on the peer review outcomes will be invited to submit an extended version to a special issue.\r ***\r General Chair\rWeizhi Meng\rTechnical University of Denmark, Denmark\r General Co-Chairs\rJiannong Cao\rThe Hong Kong Polytechnic University\r Abderrahim Benslimane\rUniversity of Avignon, France\r Technical Program Committee Chairs\rWeizhi Meng\rTechnical University of Denmark, Denmark\r Wenjuan Li\rThe Hong Kong Polytechnic University, China\r ***\r Publication\rAll registered papers will be submitted for publishing by Springer and made available through SpringerLink Digital Library.\r Proceedings will be submitted for inclusion in leading indexing services, such as Web of Science, Compendex, Scopus, DBLP, EU Digital Library, Google Scholar, IO-Port, MathSciNet, Inspec, and Zentralblatt MATH.\r All accepted authors are eligible to submit an extended version in a fast track of:\r EAI Endorsed Transactions on Scalable Information Systems (Open Access) \xe2\x80\x93 indexed in ESCI & Ei Compendex  & Scopus\rEAI Endorsed Transactions on Security and Safety (Open Access)\rAdditional publication opportunities:\r EAI/Springer Innovations in Communications and Computing Book Series\r(titles in this series are indexed in Ei Compendex, Web of Science & Scopus)\r ***\r Topics\rTopics of interest include, but are not limited to, the following:\r - Theories of blockchain and distributed ledger technology\r- Distributed consensus and fault tolerance mechanisms\r- Security, privacy and trust of blockchain and distributed ledger technology\r- Blockchain data management and provenance\r- Blockchain Performance analysis and optimization\r- Simulation and performance evaluation techniques\r- Smart contract and chain code\r- Applications and services based on blockchain\r- Protocols and algorithms based on blockchain\r- Blockchain in the Internet of things (IoT) and cyber physical systems\r- Blockchain and information retrieval\r- Blockchain and data mining\r- Blockchain and artificial intelligence\r- Blockchain in connected and autonomous vehicles\r- Cross-blockchain algorithms\r- Blockchain storage management\r- Blockchain benchmark\r- Blockchain consensus mechanisms\r- Blockchain and Cryptocurrency\r ***\r This event is organized by EAI (www.eai.eu).\r EAI \xe2\x80\x93 European Alliance for Innovation is a non-profit organization and a professional community established in cooperation with the European Commission to empower global research and innovation, and to promote cooperation between European and International ICT communities.\n\t'

title: b'EAI AICON 2022'
description: b'EAI AICON 2022 - 4th EAI International Conference on Artificial Intelligence for Communications and Networks'
Categories: b'intelligent systems'
Call For Papers: b'\nEAI AICON 2022 will be held as an on-site conference and if needed, Accepted Authors who are unable to attend the event in person will be given an option to present remotely.\r Scope\rThe purpose of the International Conference on Artificial Intelligence for Communications and Networks is to bring together researchers, engineers and practitioners interested in the theory and applications in the areas of Artificial Intelligence and Communication Systems.  This conference focuses on Artificial Intelligence, Knowledge Representation, Planning, Learning, Scheduling, Perception Reactive AI Systems, and Evolutionary Computing and other topics related to Intelligent Systems and Computational Intelligence for Communication and Networks.  AI in economic and financial systems as well as social aspects of AI are also very welcome.This conference also focuses on narrower fields of applications of AI to communication systems such as mobile ad-hoc networks, delay-tolerable networks as well as mobile multi-agents.  In ad-hoc network systems, communication protocols and route selection strategies are very important where AI-related technologies demonstrate their ability.  When we say \xe2\x80\x9ccommunication\xe2\x80\x9d, we do not mean only communication technologies, but also humanity and social aspects of communication.  Therefore, we expect researchers and practitioners from social science fields including economists to come and participate in our interdisciplinary discussions.A substantial amount of research work is ongoing in these areas, in an attempt to discover appropriate theories and paradigms to use in real-world applications.  Communication systems are important areas of Artificial Intelligence and Distributed AI, including Multi-Agent Systems.  Papers describing advanced prototypes, systems, tools and techniques and general survey papers indicating future directions as well as describing original works are welcome.\r ***\rGeneral Chair\rYasushi Kambayashi\rNippon Institute of Technology\r General Co-Chair\rPetre Dini\rIARIA, USA\r Technical Program Committee Chairs\rNgoc Thanh Nguyen\rWroclaw University of Science and Technology\r Shu-Heng Chen\rNational Chengchi University\r Technical Program Committee Co-Chair\rMunehiro Takimoto\rTokyo University of Science\r ***\r Publication\rAll registered papers will be submitted for publishing by Springer and made available through SpringerLink Digital Library: AICON Conference Proceedings\r Proceedings will be submitted for inclusion in leading indexing services, such as Web of Science, Compendex, Scopus, DBLP, EU Digital Library, Google Scholar, IO-Port, MathSciNet, Inspec, and Zentralblatt MATH.\r Authors of selected best accepted and presented papers will be invited to submit an extended version to\r Wireless Networks (WINET) Journal [IF: 2.602 (2020)]\rAll accepted authors are eligible to submit an extended version in a fast track of:\r EAI Endorsed Transactions on Scalable Information Systems (Indexed in Scopus, Web of Science and Ei Compendex)\rEAI Endorsed Transactions on Mobile Communications and Applications\rEAI Endorsed Transactions on AI and Robotics\rAdditional publication opportunities:\r Journal of Information and Telecommunication\rAI, Computer Science and Robotics Technology\rJournal of Advanced Computational Intelligence and Intelligent Informatics\rElectronics\rEAI/Springer Innovations in Communications and Computing Book Series\r(titles in this series are indexed in Ei Compendex, Web of Science & Scopus)\r ***\r Topics\rWe seek novel, innovative, and exciting work in areas including but not limited to:\r - AI and Creativity\r- Ambient Intelligence\r- Bayesian Networks for Communication Systems\r- Case-Based Reasoning for Communication Networks\r- Deep Learning for Communication Networks\r- Evolutionary Computing for Communication Networks\r- Explainable Artificial Intelligence\r- Hybrid Intelligent Systems\r- Industrial Applications of AI and Communication Systems\r- Intelligence and Cybersecurity\r- Intelligent User Interfaces\r- Legal Technologies for Communication Systems\r- AI in Economics\r- Financial Applications of AI\r- Healthcare Applications of AI\r- AI in Mobile Robots\r- Machine Learning for Communication Systems\r- Natural Language Processing\r- Neural Networks for Communication Systems\r- Planning and Scheduling for Communication Systems\r- Social Network Analysis\r- Soft Computing for Communication Systems\r- Ethical AI\r- Moral Aspects of AI\r- Emotion AI\r- AI in Music\r- Visualization for Communication Systems\r- Novel Communication Protocols\r- AI-enabled Mobile Networks Design\r- AI in Wireless Communications and Networking\r- AI-based Network Intelligence\r- AI-enabled Reliable and Low-Latency Communications\r- AI-enabled Network Softwarization and Virtualization\r- Low-power Architecture for Wireless Communications\r- Machine Learning Algorithms for Wireless Networks\r- AI-based Adaptive and Dynamic Network Slicing\r- The Design of AI-enabled Hardware for Communications Systems\r ***\r This event is organized by EAI (www.eai.eu).\r EAI \xe2\x80\x93 European Alliance for Innovation is a non-profit organization and a professional community established in cooperation with the European Commission to empower global research and innovation, and to promote cooperation between European and International ICT communities.\n\t'

title: b'NFTBC 2022'
description: b'The First International Workshop on NFT in Blockchain: Systems Perspective (NFTBC2022)'
Categories: b'blockchain' b'NFT' b'digital asset' b'ERC-721/1155'
Call For Papers: b"\nNon-Fungible Tokens (NFTs) are a revolutionized form of digital assets. Digital assets are anything that are digitally unique items or objects such as digital arts, videos, in-game items, music, documents, and signatures. The public and media's attention to the NFTs has been exploding and the NFT marketplace has been expanding in both volume and value tremendously. Blockchain network provides an underlying technology to secure only one official ownership at a time and trading interface to prevent illegal copying and downloads through smart contracts on blockchain networks such as Ethereum. Any assets either digital or physical, theoretically, can be digitized in such a way not to be replicated as a proof of the uniqueness and for protection of the ownership. NFT technology ultimately provides a solution to the issues of internet of assets with respect to illegal copying and distribution of items or objects violating required security and privacy protocols. From the systems perspective, the standards for NFT such as ERC-721 and ERC-1155 have been developed and exercised in the market such that NFT for digital items and objects are minted through smart contracts in a unique way in terms of ownership, copyright, reproduction right and ownership transfer, to mention a few. Minting an NFT is conforming to the token standards ERC-721 and/or ERC-1155 interfacing through smart contracts that prove ownership transferring. As the NFT market is expanding, NFT technology is expected to be more extensively employed to prove the scarcity of creating an NFT, the transparency of trading an NFT, and the uniqueness of the ownership of an NFT. Also, NFT can be exercised to ensure ownerships of full or some sectors of the digitized and secure documents such as Intellectual Property, Patent, and License.\r The workshop welcomes original research, related idea, and innovative solutions and focus on either fundamental methodological studies or use cases and application demonstrations. Authors are invited to submit original research contributions that fall into or are related topic areas listed below:\r -Modeling and assurance of performance of NFT-based systems\r-Ensurance of ownership in NFT systems\r-Security and privacy in NFT systems\r-Tracking and assurance of digital assets\xe2\x80\x99 copyright and reproduction right in NFT systems\r-NFT Internet Frameworks\r-Intellectual Property (IP) in NFT systems\r-NFT-based Patent and License\n\t"

title: b'COCOLE 2022'
description: b'The First International Conference on Computing, Communication and Learning'

Call For Papers: b"\nThe 1st International Conference on Computing, Communication and Learning (COCOLE)-2022 will be organized by National Institute of Technology, Warangal, Telangana, India during Sep 29th - Oct 01st, 2022.\r COCOLE conference series is a global platform for computer science researchers to exchange research results and ideas on the foundations and applications of Computing, Communication and Learning. These technologies are increasingly relevant to individuals and organizations who engage in the production, processing and dissemination of knowledge.\r Prospective authors are invited to submit manuscripts reporting original unpublished research and recent developments in the topics related to the conference. These technologies are changing constantly as a result of the large research and technical effort being undertaken in both universities and businesses. The exchange of ideas between scientists and technicians from both academic and business areas is essential to facilitate the development of systems that meet the demands of today's society. The technology transfer in this field is still a challenge and for that reason, this type of contributions will be specially considered in this conference .\r This conference is the forum in which to present the application of innovative techniques to complex problems.\r The scope of this conference has been kept wide and following are the topics covered (But not limited to):\r A) COMPUTING\r  Autonomic, adaptive, dependable computing, Quantum computing, Parallel computing, Distributed computing, Services computing and cloud computing, Fog and edge computing, Osmotic Computing, Green computing, High performance computing, Graphics and Immersive computing, Pervasive computing, Internet computing, Scientific computing, Business process computing, Spatial computing, Supercomputing systems, Software evolution and mining, Architectural concepts for systems, Network science, social networks, collective intelligence\r B) COMMUNICATION\r  Emerging technologies for next generation network, LAN/WAN/MAN, Future Internet architecture, protocols and services, Content- and service-centric architecture, Mobile and ubiquitous networks, Self organizing/autonomic networking, Green networking, Internet content search, QoS and multimedia networking, Opportunistic networking, On-line social networks, Internet of things, Public safety communication networks, Network applications (web, multimedia streaming, VoIP, gaming, etc.), Trust, security and privacy in computer and communication networks, Modeling, measurement and simulation, Complex network models, Internet socio-economic models, Experimental test-beds and research platforms, Algorithmic aspects of communication networks, Network scaling and limits\r C) LEARNING (PROBLEMS & METHODS)\r I) Learning Problems: Classification, Regression, Recognition, and prediction, Problem solving and planning, Reasoning and inference, Data mining, Web mining, Information retrieval, Natural language processing, Design and diagnosis, Vision and speech perception, Robotics and control, Combinatorial optimization, Game playing, Industrial, financial, and scientific applications of all kinds\r II) Learning Methods: Supervised and unsupervised learning methods, Reinforcement learning, Evolution-based methods, Explanation-based learning, Analogical learning methods, Automated knowledge acquisition, Learning from instruction, Visualization of patterns in data, Learning in integrated architectures, Multistrategy learning, Multi-agent learning\r Paper Submission Link:
