title: b'ACM EnergyDLT 2022'
description: b'ACM SIGEnergy Workshop on Energy, Blockchain & Distributed Ledger Technology'
Categories: b'energy' b'blockchain' b'distributed ledger technology' b'smart grid'
Call For Papers: b'\nCall for Participation:\r Blockchain and DLT are a disruptive paradigm to enable trustless decentralized verifiable applications. There are an increasing number of applications of blockchain technology to energy systems. For example, micro-payment for peer-to-peer EV charging, microgrid exchange and wholesale energy markets, renewable energy credits and emissions trading, and energy resource sharing and management. Besides their popularity, blockchain platforms (particularly, Bitcoin) suffer from significant energy consumption (overtaking all other areas in the IT sector). In this workshop, we aim to explore the potential applications of blockchain and DLT to energy systems, as well as to address its energy efficiency issue. \r This workshop will feature the following keynote speakers: \r - Zhao Yang Dong (NTU): Blockchain-enabled Security Systems for Smart Grids\r- \xc3\x9cmit Cali (NTNU): DLT Meets Energy - Current & Future Perspectives\r- Srinivasan Keshav (Univ. Cambridge): Bringing Trust to Carbon Credits Through Computer Science\r- Jos R\xc3\xb6ling (IBM Consulting): Programmable Energy \r There will also be panel discussions of hot topics, such as \xe2\x80\x9cShall we ban Proof-of-Work?\xe2\x80\x9d, \xe2\x80\x9cIs DLT a practical solution for the energy sector?\xe2\x80\x9d\r **Free Registration** The zoom link for participation can be found at https://EnergyDLT.github.io/\r For any questions, please contact the Host: Sid Chi-Kin Chau (Australian National University)\r  Please find more information on the Workshop Website: https://EnergyDLT.github.io/\n\t'

title: b'OCIT 2022'
description: b'20th OITS International Conference on Information Technology'
Categories: b'information technology' b'ai, ml, networking' b'security, power,iot' b'distributed & cloud computing'
Call For Papers: b'\nThe OITS International Conference on Information Technology (OCIT) is a premier international forum for high quality research in the areas of Information Technology. OCIT 2022 is being jointly organized by the Orissa Information Technology Society (www.oits.org) and Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology, Bhubaneswar, India (www.kiit.ac.in). Researchers, developers, and practitioners from academia and industry are invited to present their research findings on various topics of IT and its applications. The proceedings of this conference will be published by IEEE (Approval pending- Conference Record #56763).\rOCIT 2022 encourages submissions in all the areas of information technology. However, the papers in the following 6 tracks will be the primary focus of OCIT 2022:\r Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning (AMD)\r\t\tCognitive Science, Image Processing, Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing, Machine Translation, Convolutional Neural Network, Recurrent Neural Network, Explainable Machine Learning, Probabilistic Machine Learning, Reinforcement Learning, Sentiment Analysis, Collaborative Filtering. \rData Science (DSC)\r\t\tData Analytics, Soft Computing, Pattern Recognition. Mining Spatial and Temporal Data, Metadata and Meta Modeling especially focused in the domains of Social Networks, Social Media including blogs and Online Collaborative Environments. Text Mining, Information Retrieval, Visual Data Mining, Privacy Sensitive Data Mining, and Graph Data mining. Big Data Analytics, Computational Finance, Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, Information Science including Multi-Agent Systems and Intelligent Systems, Biomedical Informatics.\rNetworking and Information Security (NIS)\r\t\tMultimedia Communications Networks, Wireless Ad hoc/ Sensor/ IoT Networks, Mobile and Personal Area Networks. Information Technology Networks, Vehicular Ad-hoc network, Body Area Networks, Optical Fiber Networks, SDN, Peer-to-peer, Overlay, Content Distribution Networks, Cognitive Radio Networks and DNA Inter Networks.  Information Security, Content Protection, and Digital Rights Management. Watermarking, Steganography, Cryptography, Biometrics, Digital Libraries, Network Security, Computer Security, Cyber Security.\rSequential, Parallel, Distributed and Cloud Computing (PDC)\r\t\tDesign and Analysis of Algorithms, Parallel and Distributed Computing, Load balancing and Partitioning. Multi-cores, Memory Hierarchy, Multiprocessor Synchronization and Debugging, Concurrent Programming, High Performance Computing. OS Virtualization, Modeling and Simulation, Load Balancing and Partitioning, Compiler Techniques. Cloud Computing, PaaS, SaaS, AaaS, IaaS, EaaS Modeling, Performance Analysis and Security Provisioning in Cloud Computing.\rMultimedia, Signal Processing, Embedded Systems (MSE)\r\t\tOntology and Reasoning, Applications of Semantic Web and Linked Data, Semantic Web Architecture, Social Semantic Web. IP Core Design, Multi Media Audio and Video Streaming, Algorithms for IP Core Protection, Algorithms for Security Aware Behavioral Synthesis, Fault Aware Computing, CAD Algorithms for Smart Devices, Algorithms for Biometric Security.\rPower, Smart Grid and Internet of Things (PSI)\r\t\tPower Systems, Smart Grid, Smart Grid Applications, Grid Computing, Internet of Things, Low Power/ Energy-Aware Computing, IT Intervention in  Power Distribution System Management,  Power System Security Management through Advanced Information Technology Application, Computer-Aided Design (CAD) for Behavioral/High-Level Synthesis and Optimization, High-level synthesis algorithms and methodology.\r PAPER SUBMISSION\rManuscripts offering high quality original and unpublished research, case studies and implementations are solicited. The manuscripts need to be formatted as IEEE double column conference format. The maximum length of the manuscript needs to be of 6-pages. All submitted papers will undergo a DOUBLE-blind-review by the program committee. Authors need to prevent identity disclosure by: (1) not listing names and affiliations of the authors on the manuscript, (2) not saying \xe2\x80\x9cmy work\xe2\x80\x9d or \xe2\x80\x9cour work\xe2\x80\x9d in the text while citing self-references, and (3) not writing acknowledgments in such a way that identity of authors are implied. Author information should only be included in the submission form. Manuscripts not following this requirement or exceeding 6-page length will be rejected without review. Authors need to submit a single pdf file of their manuscripts at: (https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/OCIT2022). OCIT 2022 will follow no-show policy, i.e., accepted papers are to be registered and presented, otherwise the paper will be removed from the proceedings.\r Best Paper Awards\rThree awards will be conferred with due recommendations from the program committee from the papers presented in the conference. Each award will carry a cash prize and certificate. One student best paper prize will be awarded from the papers where the students are the leading authors. \r\n'

title: b'CAMLIS 2022'
description: b'Conference on Applied Machine Learning for Information Security'
Categories: b'AI' b'machine learning' b'information security' b'cybersecurity'
Call For Papers: b'\nThe Conference on Applied Machine Learning in Information Security (CAMLIS) is a venue that gathers researchers and practitioners to discuss applied and fundamental research on machine learning in information security. The 2022 version is planned to be in person at the Offices of Sands Capital Management in Arlington, VA. We will require all attendees to be vaccinated and masked when not actively eating or presenting. \r We invite paper and/or extended abstract submissions on the direct application or adaptation of statistics, machine learning, deep learning, and data science to infosec relevant areas including:\r\xc2\xb7Insider threat detection\r\xc2\xb7Network and endpoint forensics\r\xc2\xb7Governance, compliance and exfiltration detection\r\xc2\xb7Detection of script-based and malware-less attacks\r\xc2\xb7Automated malware detection and classification\r\xc2\xb7Vulnerability assessment\r\xc2\xb7Open-source software security\r\xc2\xb7Dark web analytics\r\xc2\xb7Cyber threat intelligence applications\r\xc2\xb7Cybersecurity risk management\r\xc2\xb7Machine learning models as attack surface\r\xc2\xb7Political disinformation and computational propaganda\r\xc2\xb7Adversarial attack generation to robustify cyber-defenses\r\xc2\xb7Zero-trust security\r We encourage submissions that include analytic or predictive themes:\r\xc2\xb7Statistical analysis on large and small datasets\r\xc2\xb7Unique considerations of base-rate fallacy for data science in information security\r\xc2\xb7Infosec data sources and exploratory data analysis\r\xc2\xb7Unique approaches to dataset visualization\r\xc2\xb7Adversarial machine learning in the context of infosec\r\xc2\xb7Original or cross-domain deep learning architectures applied to information security data\r\xc2\xb7Natural language processing, image analysis, signal analysis\r\xc2\xb7Reinforcement learning for automating security tasks\r\xc2\xb7Multi-agent solutions\r\xc2\xb7Unsupervised and semi-supervised approaches\r\xc2\xb7Explainable ML for Infosec\r\xc2\xb7Multi-view, multi-task, and multi-source learning\r\xc2\xb7Deep Bayesian Learning\r\xc2\xb7Knowledge distillation and transfer learning paradigms\r\xc2\xb7Graph embedding (node, edge, graph-level)\r We invite both original submissions and presentations submitted very recently at other venues (since January 2022). Similar to last year, accepted papers will be included into proceedings that will be indexable by major academic search engines (e.g., Google Scholar). \r Submitted papers should be formatted in a single column format in 12-point format, single spaced. While there is no \xe2\x80\x9chard\xe2\x80\x9d limit to the length of the papers, we encourage authors not to exceed 12 pages (preferred length 6-10 pages). The presentation of the content should be concise and precise to help reviewers judge papers on their methodological novelty and contributions to a particular application of security. Each paper will undergo a double-blind review and will be considered for publication in the proceedings and as a talk or as a poster. A full paper is not required. Authors are also welcome to submit a two-page extended abstract that would be considered for inclusion in the program as a talk or as a poster (the latter option is in the same manner as prior years of CAMLIS). \rThe data, representations, model settings, evaluation set up, and performance metrics should all be clearly described in the submissions. While not required, authors are strongly encouraged to provide the code, documentation, and data from their research in a publicly accessible format or repository (e.g., GitHub). This will help to facilitate scientific reproducibility of impactful research within our community and help to generate innovative research in a timelier and streamlined manner. \r Accepted talks will be presented as talks of 20 minutes in length with up to 10 minutes of discussion period after each talk. Talks will also be recorded and made publicly available after the conference. The poster session will be held live and in person during the CAMLIS event. \r We encourage participation from academics working in information security, government research labs, national laboratories, and FFRDCs, and information security data scientists in industry.\r Important dates are:\r\xc2\xb7Friday, August 5, 2022: Submission deadline\r\xc2\xb7Friday, September 9, 2022: Speakers notified\r\xc2\xb7Thursday \xe2\x80\x93 Friday, October 20 \xe2\x80\x93 21, 2022: Conference\rImportant websites are:\r\xc2\xb7Conference website: https://www.camlis.org/ \r\xc2\xb7Submission link: https://openreview.net/group?id=camlis.org/CAMLIS/2022/Conference  \r Venue: Sands Capital Management, 1000 Wilson Boulevard, 30th Floor, Arlington, VA 22209\r\n'

title: b'ICA3PP 2022'
description: b'The 22nd International Conference on Algorithms and Architectures for Parallel Processing'
Call For Papers: b'\nAbout ICA3PP 2022\rICA3PP 2022 is the 22nd in this series of conferences started in 1995 that are devoted to algorithms and architectures for parallel processing and computing. ICA3PP is now one of the most famous events of the world that covers the many dimensions of parallel algorithms and architectures, encompassing fundamental theoretical approaches, practical experimental projects, and commercial components and systems. With the emerging demands of the computing systems and applications, the power of computing systems has been challenging all the time. In recent years, various of computing solutions such as parallel computing algorithms and architectures are proposed. ICA3PP aims to bring international academics and practitioners to exchange ideas and present research works for improving the efficiency, performance, reliability, security and interoperability of computing systems and applications.\r Following the traditions of the previous successful ICA3PP conferences held in Xiamen, Hangzhou, Brisbane, Singapore, Melbourne, Hong Kong, Beijing, Cyprus, Taipei, Busan, Melbourne, Fukuoka, Vietri sul Mare, Dalian, Japan, Zhangjiajie, Granada, Helsinki, and Guangzhou. The main objective of ICA3PP is to bring together researchers and practitioners from academia, industry and governments to advance the theories and technologies in parallel and distributed computing. ICA3PP will focus on two broad areas of parallel and distributed computing, i.e. architectures, algorithms and networks, and systems and applications.\r In this year, ICA3PP 2022 will be organized by Technical University of Denmark, Denmark.\r Important Dates\rPaper Submission Due 30 June 2022 (Firm!)\rAuthor Notification 15 August 2022\rCamera-ready Paper Due 30 August 2022\rAuthor Registration Due 25 September 2022\rConference Date 10-12 Oct. 2022\r----------------------------------------------------------\r Topics of Interest\rWe invite submissions from academia, government, and industry presenting novel research on all aspects of information security and privacy primitives or protocols. Topics of ICA3PP include but are not limited to the following areas:\r Track 1: Parallel and Distributed Architectures\rParallel Architectures\rParallel Programming Paradigms\rHeterogeneous Systems\rService-Oriented Architectures\r Track 2: Software Systems and Programming Models\rCluster, Distributed & Parallel Operating Systems and Middleware\rProgramming Models for Compute and Storage\rParallel File Systems and Storage\rParallel and Distributed Databases\rTools for Programming and Analysis of System Software\r Track 3: Distributed and Network-based Computing\rMobile and Wireless Computing\rCloud, Grid, and Services Computing\rWeb and Internet Computing\rInterconnection Networks\rNetwork Simulations\r Track 4: Big Data and its Applications\rArchitecture, Networks and Systems of Big Data\rBig Data Applications, Algorithms and Data Structures\rResearch and Development Trends of Big Data\rBig Data Benchmarking, Interoperability, Monitoring, Security, Privacy and Management\rDistributed Data Analytics and Feature Extraction\rBig Data Interoperability and Orchestration\rParallel Processing for Big Data\r Track 5: Parallel and Distributed Algorithms\rReliability and Fault-tolerant Computing\rHigh-performance Scientific Computing\rParallel and Distributed Algorithms\rResource Management and Scheduling\r Track 6: Applications of Parallel and Distributed Computing\rMultimedia in Parallel Computing\rParallel Computing in Bioinformatics\rParallel Machine Learning Algorithms\rIndustrial Applications\r Track 7: Service Dependability and Security in Distributed and Parallel Systems\rDependability Issues in Computer Networks and Communications\rDependability Issues in Distributed and Parallel Systems\rDependability of Software Defined Networks\rSelf-healing, Self-protecting and Fault-tolerant Systems\rNetwork and Information Security\rTrust, Security and Privacy in Cloud computing, Social Networks, and Internet of Things\r Track 8: Internet of Things and Cyber-Physical-Social Computing\rSocial Computing and Analytics on Cyber-Physical Data\rSmart Communities with Cyber-Physical Systems\rUbiquitous Sensing in Social Networks\rBuilding Social Life Networks\rPervasive/Ubiquitous Control, Computing and Networking\rCyber-Physical Systems and Networks\rCyber-Physical Social Applications and Case Studies\r Track 9: description: b'EAI AISCOVID-19 2022 - 3rd EAI International Conference on AI-assisted Solutions for COVID-19 and Biomedical Applications in Smart-Cities'
Categories: b'ehealth'
Call For Papers: b'\nEAI AISCOVID-19 2022 will be held as an on-site conference and if needed, Accepted Authors who are unable to attend the event in person will be given an option to present remotely.\r SCOPE\rCOVID-19, also known as Corona Virus Disease 19, is a disease that has had a substantial impact on the\rglobal population since its discovery in 2019. Furthermore, there is a great deal of confusion about how the\rdisease is transmitted, detected, and treated. More research and tests are needed to determine how it\rspreads, as well as preventative and immunization difficulties. Many effective and efficient solutions can be\rachieved using Artificial Intelligence (AI) and computer-assisted paradigms. Smart cities infrastructure\rcurrently contains multiple smart devices with sensing and data routing capabilities that connect with one\ranother using various protocols, allowing disease updates to be obtained at any time and from any\rlocation. These devices have the ability to provide novel services that would not otherwise be possible.\rInnovative research should offer light on how mobile Internet, big data, artificial intelligence, cloud\rcomputing, and other modern information technology can be used to create the necessary online and cost-effective medical service platforms. Indeed, Decision Support Systems (DSS) and Healthcare Information\rTechnology are undeniably hot areas that will require in-depth study and research, as well as the scientific\rcommunity\xe2\x80\x99s attention.\r  ***\rGeneral Chair\rJos\xc3\xa9 Machado\rCentro Algoritmi, University of Minho\r General Co-Chair\rHugo Peixoto\rUniversity of Minho\r Technical Program Committee Chairs\rJos\xc3\xa9 Luis Calvo Rolle\rUniversity of A Coru\xc3\xb1a\r Gianni Vercelli\rDIBRIS \xe2\x80\x93 Universit\xc3\xa0 di Genova\r Technical Program Committee Co-Chairs\rDeden Jacob\rTelkom University\r Ichiro Satoh\rNational Institute of Informatics, Japan\r ***\r PUBLICATION\r All registered papers will be submitted for publishing by Springer and made available through SpringerLink Digital Library.\r Proceedings will be submitted for inclusion in leading indexing services, such as Web of Science, Compendex, Scopus, DBLP, EU Digital Library, Google Scholar, IO-Port, MathSciNet, Inspec, and Zentralblatt MATH.\r Publication opportunities:\r EAI Transactions series (Open Access)\rEAI/Springer Innovations in Communications and Computing Book Series\r(titles in this series are indexed in Ei Compendex, Web of Science & Scopus)\r ***\r TOPICS:\r - AI in the Internet of Medical Things (IoMT)\r- AI in IoT-oriented medical applications\r- AI and IoT paradigms in sustainable education systems\r- AI/IoT solutions in smart cities traffic systems\r- Deep Learning for COVID-19 and alike diagnosis\r- Neural Network for medical diagnosis\r- AI-oriented in hospital and online diagnosis\r- Collaboration of Image Progressing and ML for COVID-19 and alike diagnosis\r- Collaboration of Computer Communication and ML for COVID-19 and alike diagnosis\r- Use cases of computer-assisted COVID-19 and alike detection systems\r- COVID-19 Patient Care and Treatment using ML-oriented systems\r- Emerging Networks solutions for improved medical diagnosis results\r- Intelligent Hardware solutions for COVID-19 and alike diagnosis\r- Effective use of computer communication and ML for solving open medical problems\r- Healthcare standards and onthologies for effective information systems implementation such as OpenEHR,\r- Snomed and FHIR\r- Next Generation Networks (NGNs) and ML solutions for medical diagnosis\r- Security and privacy aspects in medical diagnosis\r ***\r This event is organized by EAI (www.eai.eu).\r EAI \xe2\x80\x93 European Alliance for Innovation is a non-profit organization and a professional community established in cooperation with the European Commission to empower global research and innovation, and to promote cooperation between European and International ICT communities.\n\t'

title: b'CFP - CONCEPTUAL PERSONAE IN ONTOLOGY (S 2022'
description: b'Reminder: CFP - CONCEPTUAL PERSONAE IN ONTOLOGY (SECOND CALL)'
Categories: b'philosophy' b'ontology' b'personae' b'post-continental'
Call For Papers: b'\nCALL FOR PAPERS\rfor a topical issue of Open Philosophy\rCONCEPTUAL PERSONAE IN ONTOLOGY\r(second call)\r Open Philosophy (https://www.degruyter.com/OPPHIL) invites submissions for the topical issue \xe2\x80\x9cConceptual Personae in Ontology", edited by Carlos A. Segovia (Saint Louis University, Madrid Campus, Spain).\r DESCRIPTION\r As Gilles Deleuze writes, through conceptual personae concepts are not only thought but also perceived and felt. They are philosophical sensibilia which often play a part in the production and the definition of new concepts. Mythical figures, science-fiction motifs, landscape impersonations\xe2\x80\xa6 Conceptual personae are polymorphous and pervasive. Think, for example, in Nietzsche\xe2\x80\x99s take on Apollo and Dionysus as meta-philosophical images; in Ihab Hassan\xe2\x80\x99s reuse of the myth of Orpheus\xe2\x80\x99s dismemberment to define postmodernism; or, more recently, in Haraway\xe2\x80\x99s reuse of the Lovecraftian Cthulhu to mark the return of the chthonic in the limes of the Anthropocece, and in Povinelli\xe2\x80\x99s triangulation of the Desert, the Animist, and the Virus to map the open renegotiation of what is life and non-life today. In short conceptual personae can function as icons, indexes, or symbols for thinking, and thus can also play a major role in the making of an ontology of the present and its margins, that is, in helping to figure out what the present is and what it can eventually become, in the short and the long run, under the sign of the Otherwise. Papers exploring existing conceptual personae and/or proposing new ones in any territory relevant to the philosophical analysis of the present and its futurability are thus welcome.\r  Authors publishing their articles in the special issue will benefit from:\r \xc2\xb7 transparent, comprehensive and fast peer review,\r \xc2\xb7 efficient route to fast-track publication and full advantage of De Gruyter\'s e-technology,\r \xc2\xb7 free language assistance for authors from non-English speaking regions.\r Because Open Philosophy is published under an Open Access model, as a rule, publication costs should be covered by so called Article Publishing Charges (APC), paid by authors, their affiliated institutions, funders or sponsors.\r Authors without access to publishing funds are encouraged to discuss potential discounts or waivers with Managing Editor of the journal Katarzyna Tempczyk (katarzyna.tempczyk@degruyter.com) before submitting their manuscripts.\r  HOW TO SUBMIT\r Submissions will be collected by June 15, 2022. There are no specific length limitations.\r To submit an article for the special issue of Open Philosophy, authors are asked to access the online submission system at: \r http://www.editorialmanager.com/opphil/\r Please choose as article type: Conceptual Personae.\r Before submission the authors should carefully read over the Instruction for Authors, available\rat: https://www.degruyter.com/publication/journal_key/OPPHIL/downloadAsset/OPPHIL_Instruction%20for%20Authors.pdf\r All contributions will undergo critical review before being accepted for publication.\r Further questions about this thematic issue can be addressed to Carlos A. Segovia at segoviamail@icloud.com. In case of technical or financial questions, please contact Managing Editor of the journal Katarzyna Tempczyk at katarzyna.tempczyk@degruyter.com.\r  Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/DGOpenPhilosophy\n\t'

title: b'EAI INTETAIN 2022'
description: b'EAI INTETAIN 2022 - 14th EAI International Conference on Intelligent Technologies for Interactive Entertainment'
Categories: b'arts, education & media'
Call For Papers: b'\nEAI INTETAIN 2022 will be held as an on-site conference and if needed, Accepted Authors who are unable to attend the event in person will be given an option to present remotely.\r SCOPE\rThis year\xe2\x80\x99s edition of EAI INTETAIN 2022 put emphasis on the future of Technologies for Interactive Entertainment looking towards the Metaverse. INTETAIN aims to bring together worldwide researchers and professionals working in the field of intelligent technologies for interactive systems. The conference\xe2\x80\x99s main goal is to create a friendly environment to present novel results and achievements, to discuss and present new ideas.\rThe conference seeks novel, innovative, and exciting work in areas including art, science, design, education, training, and engineering that provide trustworthy human interaction or entertainment experience.\rINTETAIN accepts papers describing research, applications, user evaluation studies, work-in-progress, achievements of initial research, projects in early stages of development, and case studies. Papers submitted to INTETAIN 2022 must not have been previously published and must not be currently under consideration for publication elsewhere.\r ***\rGeneral Chairs\rManuela Chessa\rUniversity of Genoa, Italy\r General Co-Chair\rFabio Solari\rUniversity of Genoa, Italy\r Program Chairs\rHui-Yin Wu\rResearch scientist \xe2\x80\x93 Inria \xe2\x80\x93 Biovision Team Centre Inria d\xe2\x80\x99Universit\xc3\xa9 C\xc3\xb4te d\xe2\x80\x99Azur\r Alberto Cannavo\rPolitecnico di Torino, Italy\r ***\r PUBLICATION\rProceedings will be submitted for inclusion in leading indexing services, Ei Compendex, ISI Web of Science, Scopus, CrossRef, Google Scholar, DBLP, as well as EAI\xe2\x80\x99s own EU Digital Library (EUDL).\r Authors of selected best accepted and presented papers will be invited to submit an extended version to Mobile Networks and Applications (MONET) Journal (IF=2.602)\r All accepted authors are eligible to submit an extended version in a fast track of:\r EAI Endorsed Transactions on Pervasive Health and Technology.\r Additional publication opportunities:\r EAI Transactions series (Open Access)\rEAI/Springer Innovations in Communications and Computing Book Series\r(titles in this series are indexed in Ei Compendex, Web of Science & Scopus)\r ***\r TOPICS\rThe works that will be presented at the conference will focus on the following topics\r - Virtual, Augmented, Mixed, and Extended Reality\r- Intelligent Systems and Artificial Intelligence\r- Human-Computer Interaction\r- Perception and Evaluation of interactive systems\r- Serious Game, Exergames or Applied Game\r- Haptic Feedback\r- Automatic Speech Recognition\r- Spatial and Visual Effects\r- Trusted Digital Assets\r- Digital Twins Interaction\r- Digital Twins Entertainment\r- Entertainment Equipment based on the Internet of Things\r- Blockchain-based Secure Entertainment and Digital Twins\r- Digital Twins in Smart City/Smart Factory/ Smart Everything\r- VR/AR/MR for Education and Training\r- VR/AR/MR for the Metaverse\r ***\rThis event is organized by EAI (www.eai.eu).\r EAI \xe2\x80\x93 European Alliance for Innovation is a non-profit organization and a professional community established in cooperation with the European Commission to empower global research and innovation, and to promote cooperation between European and International ICT communities.\r\n'

July 2022\rWebsite: https://sites.google.com/view/cosimcps2022/home\rCategories: simulation, formal methods, modeling, systems engineering, \rand development of \rsoftware for Cyber-Physical Systems.\r Topics of interest include, but are not limited to:\r- Development of new co-simulation methods and tools\r- Integration of formal methods technologies in co-simulation methods\rand tools\r- Experience reports on using existing co-simulation methods and tools\r- Emerging standards for co-simulation\r- Modeling and analysis of safety properties of cyber-physical systems \rthrough co-simulation\r- Modeling and analysis of human-machine interfaces in cyber-physical \rsystems through co-simulation\r- Modeling and analysis of security aspects of cyber-physical systems \rthrough co-simulation\r- Co-simulation of the next-generation cyber-physical systems\r- Co-simulation in self-adaptive and digital twin systems\r SUBMISSION title: b'INMIC 2022'
description: b'24th IEEE International Multitopic Conference (INMIC 2022)'
Categories: b'data science and applications' b'software & systems engineering' b'parallel, distributed, cloud' b'wireless and cyber security'
Call For Papers: b'\nOverview\r********\rIEEE International Multi Topic Conference, INMIC (International Conference on Emerging Technologies) is the flag ship annual conference of IEEE in Pakistan. The conference is a prestigious venue where top of the line researchers and scientist come together to present their novel research contributions and to disseminate the results. The 24th version of the conference is to be organized by National University of Computer and Emerging Sciences, NU FAST, Islamabad, Pakistan.\r Topics\r******\rThe conference covers a range of topics related to emerging technologies in diverse emerging fields. The scope of the conference includes following tracks, but are not limited to:\r Track 1. Software and Systems Engineering\r*****************************************\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning for Software Engineering\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Automated Software Engineering\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Model-Driven Software Engineering (MDSE)\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Requirements Engineering & Software Architectures\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Service-Oriented Software Engineering\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Software Testing and Analysis\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Evidence-based Software Engineering (EBSE)\r Track 4. Parallel, Distributed, and Cloud Computing\r***************************************************\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Scheduling Algorithms for Clusters, Cloud, and Fog Platforms\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Cloud and Bigdata Storage Architectures\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Batch and Stream Processing\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Fault Tolerance, Resilience, and Self-Stabilizing Systems\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Performance Modeling & Visualization\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Algorithms of Parallel and Distributed Computing using GPUs\r Track 6. Analog & Digital Sensor, Circuits and Systems\r******************************************************\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Microwave and Radio Frequency Circuits, Sensors, and Systems\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Biomedical Devices, Circuits, and Systems\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Digital Integrated Circuits and Hardware Security\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Energy Harvesting, DC-DC Converter, and Low Power Electronics\r\xe2\x80\xa2 Efficient Digital Circuits & Systems\r  All the accepted papers will appear in the proceedings published by IEEE and will be fully indexed by IEEE Xplore.\r Important dates\r***************\rPaper submission: August 1, 2022\rNotification of authors: September 10, 2022\rCamera-ready version: September 30, 2022\rRegistration due: October 10, 2022\rConference October 21-22, 2022\r Submissions\r***********\rManuscripts should be submitted using EasyChair. title: b'SPIRE 2022'
description: b'29th International Symposium on String Processing and Information Retrieval'
Categories: b'string processing' b'information retrieval' b'computational biology'
Call For Papers: b"\nSPIRE 2022 - 29th International Symposium on String Processing and Information Retrieval\r November 8-10th, 2022, Concepci\xc3\xb3n, Chile\r http://spire2022.inf.udec.cl/\r  Paper deadline [EXTENDED]: June 24, 2022 (anywhere on Earth)\r Notification: August 19, 2022\r Camera-ready due: August 29, 2020\r Early bird registration: TBA\r The Workshop on Compression, Text and Algorithms (WCTA) will be held on November 11th.\r This year, SPIRE will also feature a tutorial on graph databases, see details below.\r  **********************************************\r LOCATION\r **********************************************\r SPIRE 2022 will be held in the Faculty of Engineering of the Universidad de Concepci\xc3\xb3n, in the city of Concepci\xc3\xb3n, located next to the BioBio river and the Pacific ocean. Concepci\xc3\xb3n is the second largest city in Chile and can be reached via direct flight from Santiago (about 45 minutes). Universidad de Concepci\xc3\xb3n is the largest educational institution in the city, being also one of the most traditional and prestigious universities in Chile. Its beautiful campus is a touristic attraction by itself, with its famous campanil overlooking both the University and the city. The University hosts more than 20 thousand students in its three campuses, and it has become a symbol of pride for the city. Concepci\xc3\xb3n is a vibrant city with many universities, shopping centers, and surrounded by beautiful nature and picturesque locations such as the Dichato beach (for swimming and seafood eating), Caleta Tumbes (with numerous seafood restaurants), Chifl\xc3\xb3n del Diablo (a former underground coal mine). Many touristic areas are also relatively close to Concepci\xc3\xb3n, such as Termas de Chill\xc3\xa1n (a hot spring facility close to the Andes), Puc\xc3\xb3n (a city surrounded by several National Parks, lakes like Villarrica and Caburgua, hot springs, and the magnificent Villarrica Volcano), and Valdivia (a historical city, close to the sea and surrounded by rivers and a breathtaking natural scenery). Other touristic places in Chile (like San Pedro de Atacama, in northern Chile) can be reached via direct flight from Concepci\xc3\xb3n. The conference will have a hybrid format (on-site + on-line), yet it can change to a full on-line format depending on the pandemic situation in November.\r  **********************************************\rSCOPE\r**********************************************\r All aspects of string processing,  information retrieval, computational biology, and related applications are covered.  Typical topics of interest include (but are not limited to):\r String Processing: string pattern matching, text indexing, data  structures for string processing, text compression, compressed data  structures, compressed string processing, text mining, 2D pattern matching, automata based string processing.\r Information Retrieval (IR): retrieval models, indexing, evaluation, algorithms and data structures for IR, efficient implementation of IR systems, interface design, text classification and clustering, text analysis and mining, collaborative and content-based filtering, topic modeling for IR, search tasks (Web search, enterprise search, desktop search, legal search, cross-lingual retrieval, federated search, (micro) blog search, XML retrieval, multimedia retrieval), digital libraries.\r Computational Biology: high-throughput DNA sequencing (assembly, read alignment, read error correction, metagenomics, transcriptomics, proteomics), evolution and phylogenetics, gene and regulatory element recognition, motif finding, protein structure prediction.\r  **********************************************\rINVITED SPEAKERS\r**********************************************\r TBD\r  **********************************************\rSUBMISSION\r**********************************************\r SPIRE\xe2\x80\x99 22 invites submissions of long papers (up to 12 pages, excluding references and optional appendices) and short papers (up to 12 pages, excluding references). The reviewing process will be single-blind, namely each submission should be non-anonymous. The submission server will be EasyChair (https://easychair.org/my/conference?conf=spire2022). The proceedings will be published in the LNCS series of Springer-Verlag. The use of either LaTeX or Word LNCS templates is mandatory.  Suitable templates are available at the Springer Website (https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines) and at Overleaf (https://www.overleaf.com/latex/templates/springer-lecture-notes-in-computer-science/kzwwpvhwnvfj#.WsdHOy5uZpg). Do not change the margin size or the font, do not make a separate title page, etc.: use the LNCS style file as given. Simultaneous submission to other conferences with published proceedings is not permitted.\r  **********************************************\rBEST PAPER\r**********************************************\r A Best Paper Award (1000EUR prize supported by Springer) will be given to the author(s) of the most outstanding work presented at the conference.\r  **********************************************\rCOMMITTEES\r**********************************************\r Program Committee Chairs:\r Diego Arroyuelo (Universidad T\xc3\xa9cnica Federico Santa Mar\xc3\xada and Millennium Institute for Foundational Research on Data, Chile)\rBarbara Poblete (University of Chile and Amazon, USA)\r  Program Committee:\r Amihood Amir, Bar-Ilan University\rRicardo Baeza-Yates, Northeastern University, Universitat Pompeu Fabra and University of Chile\rHideo Bannai, Tokyo Medical and Dental University\rAltigran da Silva, Universidade Federal do Amazonas\rAntonio Fari\xc3\xb1a, University of A Coru\xc3\xb1a\rGabriele Fici, University of Palermo\rTravis Gagie, Dalhousie University\rPawel Gawrychowski, University of Wroclaw\rMarcos Goncalves, Federal University of Minas Gerais\rInge Li G\xc3\xb8rtz, Technical University of Denmark\rMeng He, Dalhousie University\rWing-Kai Hon, National Tsing Hua University\rShunsuke Inenaga, Kyushu University\rDominik K\xc3\xb6ppl, Tokyo Medical and Dental University\rThierry Lecroq, University of Rouen Normandy\rZsuzsanna Lipt\xc3\xa1k, University of Verona\rFelipe A. Louza, Universidade Federal de Uberl\xc3\xa2ndia\rGiovanni Manzini, University of Pisa\rJoao Meidanis, University of Campinas and Scylla Bioinformatics\rAlistair Moffat, The University of Melbourne\rViviane P. Moreira, Instituto de Informatica - UFRGS\rGonzalo Navarro, University of Chile\rNadia Pisanti, University of Pisa\rSolon Pissis, Centrum Wiskunde & Informatica\rNicola Prezza, Ca' Foscari University of Venice\rSimon Puglisi, University of Helsinki\rRajeev Raman, University of Leicester\rKunihiko Sadakane, The University of Tokyo\rSrinivasa Rao Satti, Norwegian University of Science and Technology\rMarinella Sciortino, University of Palermo\rDiego Seco, University of A Coru\xc3\xb1a\rSharma V. Thankachan, University of Central Florida\rRossano Venturini, University of Pisa\rNivio Ziviani, Federal University of Minas Gerais\r  Organizing Committee:\r Cecilia Hern\xc3\xa1ndez (University of Concepci\xc3\xb3n and Centre for Biotechnology and Bioengineering)\rJos\xc3\xa9 Fuentes-Sep\xc3\xbalveda (University of Concepci\xc3\xb3n)\r  Steering Committee:\r Ricardo Baeza-Yates (Northeastern University, USA, Universitat Pompeu Fabra, Spain and University of Chile)\rChristina Boucher (University of Florida, USA)\rNieves R. Brisaboa (University of A Coru\xc3\xb1a, Spain)\rThierry Lecroq (University of Rouen Normandy, France)\rSimon J. Puglisi, (University of Helsinki, Finland)\rBerthier Ribeiro-Neto (Google Inc. and Federal University of Minas Gerais,\rBrazil)\rSharma Thankachan (University of Central Florida, USA)\rH\xc3\xa9l\xc3\xa8ne Touzet (CNRS, Lille, France)\rNivio Ziviani (Universidade Federal Minas Gerais, Brazil)\r  **********************************************\rTutorial on Graph Databases\r**********************************************\rSpeakers:\rAidan Hogan (University of Chile and Institute for Foundational Research on Data)\rDomagoj Vrgo\xc4\x8d (Pontificia Universidad Cat\xc3\xb3lica de Chile and Institute for Foundational Research on Data)\r Date: TBA. \r Abstract:\rThis tutorial will provide an introduction to graph databases, which have been gaining more and more attention in recent years, particularly for querying large-scale knowledge graphs. An interesting recent development in this area has been the application of text indexing and compression techniques to optimize graph queries at large scale. The tutorial will be divided into three parts. The first part will introduce and motivate graph databases in the broader context of data management, discussing their advantages (and disadvantages) compared with relational databases, their data models, their key applications, providing also a short demo of graph database engines in use. The second part of the tutorial will focus on querying graph databases, introducing the key primitives used for querying graphs, along with some popular graph query languages, before concluding with some high-level challenges for evaluating graph queries in an efficient manner. Towards addressing these challenges, the final part of the tutorial will introduce indexes and algorithms that enable the efficient evaluation of queries over graph databases, starting with more traditional techniques inspired by relational databases, progressing towards more modern algorithms and indexes; in this part, we will see some surprising applications of text compression and indexing techniques for querying graph databases efficiently (in terms of both time and space). See the website for more details (http://spire2022.inf.udec.cl/#section-tutorial).\r  **********************************************\rCONTACT\r**********************************************\r For more information about the conference, please contact spire2022@easychair.org.\n\t"

title: b'ISEA 2023'

Categories: b'digital art' b'technology' b'creativity' b'cultural innovation'
Call For Papers: b"\nThe team of ISEA2023, the International Symposium on Electronic Art, is pleased to announce the launch of its call for proposals !\r  With 60 participating countries, ISEA has established itself as a major event on the global scene of digital creation, creative industries and cultural innovation. For its 28th edition, to be held in Paris in 2023, ISEA2023 expects 2,000 international creators, researchers and innovators, and more than 100,000 spectators for the artistic programme.\r (https://isea2023-proposals.org/).\r   Call for proposals ISEA2023, International Symposium on Electronic Art\r  Organised by Le Cube and EnsadLab, the research laboratory of the \xc3\x89cole des Arts D\xc3\xa9coratifs, this major event on the world scene of digital arts, creative industries and cultural innovation will take place in Paris from 16 to 21 May at the Forum des images, and throughout France throughout the spring of 2023, on the theme of Symbiosis.\r  Artists, researchers, creators, be part of the official programme by applying online now and take part in ISEA2023!\r To apply, you have until :\r    *   Artistic programming: 26 May 2022\r  *   Academic programming: 13 June 2022\r  Find all the details of this edition and the conditions of participation on the website of the call for applications: www.isea2023-proposals.org(http://www.isea2023-proposals.org).\r  On the theme of Symbiosis, ISEA2023 will showcase the best of digital creation thanks to a high-level selection from over 60 countries.\r You can now apply online to be part of the official programme and thus participate in the symposium and/or the artistic programme on the call for proposals website : www.isea2023-proposals.org(http://www.isea2023-proposals.org).\r  An event organised by Le Cube and the research laboratory of the \xc3\x89cole des Arts D\xc3\xa9coratifs, EnsadLab, with the support of the French Ministry of Culture, the organizing committee : Le Cube, EnsadLab, Forum des images, HACNUM, ENS Paris-Saclay, Universit\xc3\xa9 Paris 8, Universit\xc3\xa9 Paris Nanterre, EUR ArTeC, MSH Paris-Nord, Learning Planet Institute, Le Fresnoy, l'IRCAM, ENSCI - Les Ateliers, l'Institut ACTE la Sc\xc3\xa8ne Nationale d'Orl\xc3\xa9ans, l'ESAD - Orl\xc3\xa9ans, Leonardo OLATS  and numerous partners as General Delegation of Quebec in Paris.\n\t"
